description:
So I'm not a gourmet cook myself nor a food snob...but Kitaro is not what some would consider authentic Japanese.  However, not a problem as I have been a repeat customer for many years :) 

I will say that I am subject to a budget, so for sure Kitaro meets the bill in that their fare is both palatable and affordable.  One can often find their coupons for their "A-Trays" or "Golden Trays" (for about $5 off the retail price for these party sushi trays, and also 15% off dine-in coupons. Coupons often a printed on the back of Safeway receipts, and can be found in local newspapers and in mass-mailings of DM coupons.  

We order out their trays about once every month or 2, whenever I don't feel like cooking or are having a get together.
author: Hot Lunch Lad Y.

description:
This place is a perfect place to stop by for an inexpensive weekday lunch. They have 3 different pages of lunch specials all under $10, which is hard to find in SF now-a-days.

My go-to is a chicken teriyaki and sushi combo. The chicken is typically cooked through and has OK flavor and the spam katsu roll is interesting at best. The bento also comes with salad with miso dressing.

The reason for the 4-stars is because the staff is very friendly, attentive, and always smiling. The person looking for a quick, no frills, budget friendly lunch will enjoy this place.
author: Paolo B.

description:
Kitaro is one of those budget friendly Japanese restaurants my family has gone back frequently to over the years. It may not be the best Japanese food around but for the price and portions it's great. A bunch of their offerings are delicious too. I haven't checked the menus lately but I believe lunch is significantly cheaper and is a great value.

HIGHLY recommend their chicken karaage. Big chunks of chicken, fried well, and comes with a delicious spicy mayo sauce. My personal favorite here and the best karaage I've had! 

Also recommend their sushi rolls, katsu don, shrimp & veggie tempura, and salmon teriyaki. I usually get a bento box consisting of a combination of these things.

Service here has been consistently friendly and quick over the years. Plus the rice tea they have compliments the meal well.

Food: 4/5
Value: 4.25/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4/5
author: Brian G.

description: This place is literally the go to place whenever I'm at SF. The price are fairly cheap when comparing to other sushi restaurant and their portion are reasonable.
author: Annie L.

description: Kitaro is the spot to go if you are looking for cheap sushi in the Richmond District. You seriously can fill up on $10. I recommend getting either a bento box meal (the shrimp tempura is delicious), udon dinner, or the sushi combo meal (3 rolls and a salad for $10). An appetizer favorite is the garlic edamame! It can get pretty crowded in there with folks from the neighborhood but there is hardly ever a wait.
author: Sydney G.

description: Love this sushi place. Randomly went here when visiting a friend who lives in the neighborhood and now it's my go-to sushi place. Great deals for rolls, very quick service, always, super friendly staff.
author: Martin W.

description:
This is a pretty cheap sushi place! The food is just alright but you get what you ordered for a decent price. I really liked the seaweed salad here and definitely recommend ordering that. I would say the sushi here is just alright. If you want really good tasting sushi I would recommend not coming here. I ordered the shrimp crunch roll and it honestly wasn't that tasty, but for the cheap price I was okay with how it was.  

I did like that the service was pretty quick, although at times it felt like we were being rushed to order. Even though the restaurant was definitely not full. Overall, if you're looking for a cheap, sushi place this would be the place to go! I didn't try their other main dishes other than the sushi,but it seemed to look okay when I saw it at other people's tables.
author: Rithika V.

description:
I've been coming to this place since I was a little kid. Plus they have coupons! 

What I've tried: 
*Bento boxes: karage chicken and salmon sashimi - my fav
* Udon - standard
* Sushi - nothing special but good for the price

Overall thoughts:
*There's usually no wait even when it's busy
*Service and food is quick
*More affordable than most Japanese restaurants
*Decent food
author: Sarah W.

description: Always a delight to come to this hot local spot. Very affordable and great for families and big parties. Their service is quick and usually the food is super quick also. Love their food and love the ambience.
author: Shaeli Z.

description:
I can't say this is a great sushi restaurant, nor is it authentic by any means. But I really love it for what it is - a neighborhood sushi spot, with super cheap sushi and Japanese food, and fast and friendly service. I always get 15% off coupons in the mail from them, since I guess I'm a Richmond neighbor as I live just 5 blocks away. 

This place isn't going to have fresh sushi, at all, but it's cheap. I'd suggest getting the cooked rolls (spider roll, rock & roll, etc.) since those are always great. I also love the bento boxes here. Their chicken teriyaki and tempura are both amazing. It's a fun place to catch up with friends, since they do have sake and beer here too. 

Sushi trays are amazing deals here, and whenever my fiance and I have a party at our place, we always order at least 2, and they're a huge hit. They're decently priced, with the 48-piece California roll at $19!!! Wow. They have other trays too, with actual raw fish, closer to the $30 range. Lots of pieces of fish though, it feeds a lot of people!

I LOVE KITARO!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Cheap eat! No roll is more than $9 and a neighborhood gem! I love eating here all the time.
author: Miguel E.

description:
Beware the roll selection here is severely limited. And the quality of the rolls they do have can be overdone. Ive been coming here for 10 years now, and saw as they reduced/ replaced the selection of sashimi and rolls for "udon specials" and the "simple rolls" (ie. California, tiger) I suspect they've had sushi chiefs and staffers who've left so the quality's not just the same. 

Redeeming quality is their bento boxes and reasonable prices for lunch and dinner.
author: Shannon W.

description: Stumbled upon this place during lunch time, really good sushi! Lunch prices are amazing and you get so much for!
author: Saba A.

description: It said accept credit cards, no sign that under 20$ must be cash, walked 6 blocks to atm so they can safe 10cents on transaction on credit card
author: Vladimir G.

description: This has been our go to lunch place for years. The food is solid, portions are generous, service is efficient & friendly and price is right. Dishes we love: seaweed salad, shrimp and veggie tempura, salmon sashimi, and all the usual and unusual rolls they offer like the tiger roll, pink salmon roll, surfer roll, dragon roll - and many, many more. Love the miso soup and salad that comes with entree. With so many sushi places in this concentrated area, Kitaro's longevity speaks volumes
author: Kim G.

description:
I use to live very close by so this was a convenient place for me to grab sushi and especially on the go. People say their sushi is not the best - if you compare with really grand sushi then yes their sushi is rolled more messily and is very loose, maybe comes undone in two bites - but their meat, avocados, and rice was always fresh and their other foods like the teriyaki chicken tastes great.

ALSO if you grocery shop at Safeway, there is 15% coupons for Kitaro on the back of your receipts. Yay!
author: Hilary S.

description:
Among the row of sushi restaurants on this one block, this is the most yummy + cheap sushi. Kitaro is one of my favorite places in SF for a casual, quick, sushi fix. 

The only caveat: you've got to know what their specialty is.

Best orders:
Anything with raw salmon*, and yellow tail is good as well
Bento boxes are great and their miso is always tasty. I usually get it with salmon sashimi + another roll or baked fish
Fried: Godzilla* (super tasty) and fire cracker is good
Some specialty rolls 

The service isn't exactly a 3 michelin-star restaurant but for something quick and casual, it's a great choice.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Kitaro used to be a decent 3 or 4-star sushi place in the city, not because the quality was great, but because it was cheap and good enough for a sushi place. Unfortunately, as time goes on, it seems that Kitaro is charging more for poorer quality sushi. 

VEGAN and GLUTEN FREE REVIEW:

I got the avocado makimono and the seaweed salad makimono and both were sad, little things. They came randomly dotted with tobiko (fish eggs) which means that chefs don't switch their sushi roll mats between rolls. I sent it back even though I hate food waste and being THAT customer but there were fish eggs everywhere and it was not possible for me to pick off each egg one by one. My rolls came back fish egg-free and they were just fine. Sushi is just not the same for me without soy sauce for dipping, so I brought my own gluten-free soy sauce (yes, really). I would recommend doing the same if you follow a GF diet.
In the future, I'm going to tell the waitstaff to please take care that no tobiko gets on my food.

Other vegan options are the Irish roll (make sure you ask for NO mayo or sauce) and other makimono rolls/hand rolls. The veggie donburi might be vegan, but you would have to check about the teriyaki sauce they use. I doubt the teriyaki is gluten-free. 

Service is "meh". One of the waitresses is cold and condescending. The restaurant itself is FREEZING inside, so bring a layers and a blanket! I'm kidding but not really. 

Overall, Kitaro is going to need to step it up if they want to compete with the other 2 sushi places on the block!
author: Erin K.

description:
Kitaro Japanese Restaurant

The price is cheap, the food is now sub par. The service was kinda hesitant with my table and you can see that the waitress had to hold back some attitude. I used to enjoy coming here with family and friends year ago because of its wide variety of food for a good price but now it's spiraled down hill. In addition, I'm pretty sure that the stomach ache I've had for the past three days was from this place.  Thanks for the good memories. I'm most likely not coming back.
author: Liza H.

description:
If you don't like sashimi/raw sushi, this is one of the best place sushi place to go. Their raw sushi is okay... Not great, but their standard and fried ones are great. Very VERY cheap sushi too. I especially like the firecracker. So good! 

I can't give this place a 5 star because their raw sushi is just okay. Not a problem for me since I'm not a sashimi fan anyways. But I'm also dissapointed that they just put in the whole imitation crab stick into some sushi (like California) and then cut it into pieces, instead of shredding and mixing with Japanese mayonnaise like before or normal/good sushi would. 

Still one of our sushi place to go. Especially when we're feeling cheap hahah.
author: Alex L.

description:
Just a typical cheap Japanese food. Group of friends and I ordered about 6 rolls and 2 bento boxes, and the total came out to be around $60.

There wasn't anything special that stood out to me enough to wow me, other than the price. The average cost for each roll was around $5 which is extremely cheap!

Rolls had more rice than fish itself, which I figured since it was super cheap. I'm not sure that I'd come back unless we were looking for cheap sushi for a quick fill up.
author: Elaine C.

description:
If you are debating between the appetizer and lunch special, READ:

I'm a pretty big fan of their lunch appetizer salmon sashimi ($8.39). It's pretty good and it's very well priced for their portions. They also have yellow-tail sashimi ($10.49) but I have yet to try it.

It's definitely one of the Japanese restaurants that are on the cheaper side. I LOVE sushi but I don't feel like coming back day-after-day and that's why the 4 stars and not 5. It could be the quality of the fish or their rice that's making me a little bloated. Their rice is not as well cooked as it should have been but it's pretty ok. Sushi rice is cooked different than regular rice and has vinegar in it. It could be the process of cooking the rice as well. That's the kind of quality I was expecting from a restaurant at this price range anyway. 

I'll try some of their other stuff and maybe I can add another star. I am moving soon but I will definitely come back to this spot when I get the chance. 

There is another Japanese restaurant pretty much right next door so there's that.

So far, their lunch unagi-don has very generous portion of the eel. It's well made so I'd recommend trying that if you're into unagi ($12.59). The eel's texture is not as soft as some of the unagi I've had at other Japanese places but it still tastes pretty good.

I will be going back to try their $6.29 appetizer ebi-fry (deep fried shrimp) and their grilled (salmon, mackerel, etc) lunch. 

They will ask you if you want their appetizer or their lunch. I recommend getting just the appetizer since it's almost $3-4 more for just rice and a simple salad. At that price, you can get another appetizer or a small roll.

Besides, Rice is $1 and Dinner Salad is $1.89 so for example their salmon sashimi lunch (comes with rice and salad) at $12.31 is more expensive than if you purchased them separately (by -$1.03). Appetizer Salmon Sashimi is $8.39.

Check menu here: http://kitarosushi.com/kitaro/menu_lunch.html

Basically, you lose money if you buy a sashimi lunch than if you bought all of them (sashimi, rice, and salad) separately. 

For their combination lunch, you get to add two items for a cheaper price so that could be worth it but I can guarantee their portions won't be smaller than if you just got the appetizers separately.

Personally I don't like salads very much and especially the free salads at sushi restaurants so I highly recommend just getting 1 or 2 rice instead of a combination/ lunch special :)

It's definitely worth a visit though!
author: Kimberly W.

description:
I would vote for the food 3* and a half. And the other half is for their great price. 
It is the most affordable sushi restaurant I have been to.
author: Le T.

description:
Not bad but not good either, very average at best. Came in today with aunt and grandma, the service was poor as they have a lot of customers but the food came out very fast did not have to even wait 10 minutes for the food. 
The ordering process however was very slow, since they have a lot of customers, they take a while to get to you. The food also was only mediocre as the kake udon was soggy and lacked flavor and the chicken teriyaki did not come with a lot of sauce.  The sushi however was pretty decent and they give you 8 pieces each, I cant complain.
Overall, don't expect to come here for good food, but if you are on a budget and want very cheap Japanese food, this is the place to go.
author: Cheryn L.

description:
Kitaro is the everyday sushi restaurant you go to in the outer Richmond District where sushi is pretty cheap and of decent quality.

The 22nd Avenue block has three sushi restaurants on the block making this Sushi Row West.  They are the busiest of the three and most people come here for their innovative sushi rolls at a lower price.  The roll advertised the most is the Godzilla Roll.  We have been coming here for over a decade and it is especially good if you have someone (children) in your party that can't eat raw food yet or doesn't like sushi or doesn't appreciate high end sushi.  

We came here because we had a coupon, it was a Friday night and we were in a hurry.  We ordered a whole platter of sushi, miso soups, tea, etc and got in and out in less than 35 minutes!

There is no sushi bar or revolving sushi boats (not a fan of that) or high end specialty fish specials, but if you want quick sushi without the high cost.... go to Kitaro!
author: Erik H.

description:
Tip: When in doubt, order a Chicken Katsu with your combo lunch. They have stellar ratios of chicken to plate - as many as 10 big strips of chicken an order!
While my friends had the magnificent chicken katsu with another dish as part of the combo lunch, I had tonkatsu and a shrimp tenpura roll come as the entrees of my combo lunch. Tonkatsu had a nice crunch, but somewhat average pork. The shrimp tenpura roll had 4 kimbap-like pieces and had a nice balance between the crunchy fried shrimp, the vegetables, and the rice.
For the other parts of the meal: the salad had a good gollop of dressing drenching the iceberg, but the miso soup was awesome (although you have to drink it from the bowl). Tonkatsu sauce was spicy-sweet, wasabi and ginger was your average (somewhat) fresh wasabi and ginger, and the rice was your average short grain restaraunt rice.
This place is good; If I'm around, I might be back.
author: Timmy C.

description: The restaurant is clean, quiet, and not hard to find. The staff are friendly while providing quick service. The sushi tastes good for its price. The rolls are a little on the smaller side, but the sashimi portions are great. Overall, Kitaro is one of my go to sushi spots in San Francisco!
author: Juliana O.

description: Lunch specials at a decent price.  Food also served fast in case you're in a rush.  Not top quality sushi so best to stick to the non-traditional rolls.  Convenient to make your own combo plates because each item has it's own price to add up for the total combo price.  The beef teriyaki was ok, the meat was tender but kinda fatty.  Salad was the typical bagged lettuce with slivers of carrots.  Good for the budget conscious.
author: Kim S.

description: For the amazing prices, quick food wait, friendly and fast service, the quality of the food is above par with other local spots. Perfect if you're looking for something tasty and easy on the wallet. A plus that usually gets overlooked but I much appreciate, my water glass NEVER went empty and I'm a thirsty girl.
author: Olivia M.

description:
MMMMmmmmm...

Kitaro sushi may not serve up the highest quality of tasty morsels but it does serve some of the tastiest prices. A bit inconsistent as far as what you get.. Some nights are fine (acceptable) and others are... not so much. When I need raw meat in my mouth and am not feeling like hurting myself (financially) this is an easy decision. my main issue with them, AND THE REASON THEY DONT DESERVE 5 STARS [angry screaming voice], is they sometimes don't put the lotion on the skin. Therefore they get the hose again...

-Buffalo B
author: Buffalo B.

description:
Had lunch yesterday with a business associate. Very mediocre quality food. When my associate said his unagi rice was inedible because of off flavors we were told that he could not exchange it for another dish.
Very poor customer service and negative attitude.
Stay away !!
author: Jeffrey G.

description: As the San Francisco Chronicle says, kitaro is always clean, fresh, tasty, and cheap. The best quick option for an amazing lunch or dinner.
author: Matheus R.

description:
Not the best quality sushi but its decent, especially for the price. Its kind of my choice for a last-minute or back up lunch. 

For lunch I usually get the chicken teriyaki and tempura roll combo. You can't really complain at $8.99. They have different deals for lunch, usually just the combination dinner for dinnertime. 

Parking isn't too bad. Lots of metered parking everywhere. Friendly customer service!
author: Kathleen A.

description: Great food especially for the price. One of the freshest nigiri I've ever had in San Francisco. Been going here for years and will continue to do so!
author: Adam R.

description: I love this Sushi place I wish they had one out in Riverside. Every time I come out to San Francisco I have to come out and eat here. Their firecracker bombs are delicious and all of their sushi is amazing.  The seating is perfect.
author: Pamela L.

description:
I've been coming here after OB surf sessions for years with a good friend of mine. For what it is, which is a super cheap sushi restaurant, it gets 5 stars every time. 
To start, I love fried soft shell crab appetizer, and this is the best one I have ever had. It doesn't have to be expensive to be excellent, and this one is gold. Bento boxes are really good and awesome for lunch. I never order salmon at most places because it simply isn't that great but the baked salmon teriyaki is never dry and always juicy. Next, their sushi is great, I can't understand what all the lackluster reviews are about. It's not 3 star Michelin sushi if there is such a thing. It's just extremely good and well-priced on a budget. More importantly, I have never had a piece of renegade fish here, and that's more than I can say about some of the fancier places I have been to. 
Finally, my favorite thing may also be one of the weirdest. They have a basic iceberg lettuce salad with cabbage and carrots. Literally, it's the most basic mixture imaginable. BUT, there's this dressing they put on it. I'm gonna say it's a Miso/peppercorn/vinegar/ranch situation. And, it's incredibly good. I order a large plate of salad just to eat more dressing. It's that good. Then it goes on literally anything  else on the table. It might sound weird to y'all. But you'll know when you try it. It's legit. 
Finally finally, the staff is wonderful. They're always so sweet and accommodating, which makes the already good meal really great.
author: Luke S.

description: The first time I ate the Chicken Teriyaki it was so good I started to cry.  The menu is well priced, and the selection wide. Service is very good and your order comes quickly.
author: Anthony B.

description: This place is great for a quick lunch if you are craving for sushi but don't want to pay too much for it. I tried many of their sushi dishes, noodles and bento box before. I think they all are decent, nothing too special. Given the price is so cheap for sushi, you can't complain too much. The services here is great. They are pretty fast on bringing your food. The interior is nothing too special. Overall this is a good place for cheap sushi.
author: Sandy A.

description: Great sushi and reasonably priced. Never been disappointed eating at the restaurant or take out.
author: Max U.

description: This is the nostalgic sushi spot from my days in the city. Went there recently with my son and was pretty happy with our food. We ordered spicy udon which had fried chicken, tempura and tofu. This was the mildest version and it was just right for us. Added an order of CA rolls for under $2 along with spicy tuna rolls. I know this can be hit or miss but you can't beat it for the price and this time it was a hit!
author: Alpana A.

description:
This place is terrible. You pay low prices for low quality sushi paired with bad amenities. 

Thankfully the wait staff is very friendly.
author: Rodrigo C.

description: We're regulars to Kitaro and usually ordering food to go.  The best taste sushi rolls for that price.  In times, we love to have a late home sushi dinner with the red wine in front of the TV and never got tired of their rolls.
author: Alex T.

description: I use to love going to this place! It was a good place for cheap sushi and meals at decent prices! Over the years though, this place seems like they care less and less. We recently went here and were highly disappointed. The service is mediocre and the food is not worth it. Especially the teriyaki chicken in the bento box, the sauce and the chicken were just bad. The udon's broth wasn't very good as well. It's definitely sad seeing a restaurant that use to be very good go downhill
author: Nicole H.

description: Family style japanese restaurant that won't break the bank. Great tasting dishes with very fast service. I would recommend this restaurant over the other two on the same block.
author: Roland F.

description: I ordered the Spicy Udon Combo with California Roll. I laughed sooooooooooo hard when I saw the California Roll because they used imitation meat HAHAH. Gross. If I wanted crappy sushi I would've gone to  Safeway instead. I am not a fan of karaage in my udon honestly, so I won't be the judge of that part. The soup was okay, it wasn't spicy at all. The price is definitely cheap so don't expect good quality food.
author: Kristi A.

description: I eat here quite often. I love their spicy chicken udon, salmon teriyaki, shrimp and veggie tempura, dynamite sushi roll the most. Employees are really friendly here. And it's a huge restaurant.
author: Ruchika L.

description:
When there is nothing to eat at home... i can always count on Kitaro for very good, fast, cheap lunch/dinner takeout with coupon and they give a good amount too!  

When i go there to eat also fast and cheap but occasionally they may overcook something usually my salmon shio-yaki.  We always order the bentos: beef teriyaki/karage and salmon shioyaki/karage, some sushi rolls and fresh uni nigiri (6 orders).  I dont care too much on their customer service. Like any typical azn places, they are Busy but at least they refill my drinks when asked.  

What would i do without Kitaro around to save the day?! Thanks for the yuummy food
author: Ele K.

description:
Cheap and delicious. 

Kitaro has great food, it's a good place for affordable sushi. The staff tends to rush people for their order but once the order has been placed, the wait for the food isn't long at all. The seating is limited so it's best to avoid the busy evening hours when the place gets crowded.
author: Joy L.

description: This is my favorite place to go for Japanese food. I always order the spicy udon at level 2, which is medium spicy. There are four different levels of spiciness. Also, the spicy tuna roll is very good. The servers are very fast and efficient. Would recommend to anyone looking for some good, cheap, and fast Japanese food.
author: Colette L.

description: We had 3 rolls and all of them were very bad, fish was not fresh, they were big but full of rice. The service was good but I wouldn't recommend this place or come again
author: Katy D.

description: This is a legit Japanese restaurant, and they're cheaper than the usual ones! Plus, their servings are A LOT for the price.
author: Raine A.

description:
3 Japanese restaurants in one block, had to check out all 3 and we stuck with this one because of the variety in their menu. 
NOTE: the white take out looking menu's on their door is the thing you want to look at since some rolls aren't listed on their main menu. 

The inside of the restaurant is pretty dark and we were instantly greeted by an older lady. I noticed they had an upper level that looked like a karaoke lounge, if you're into that kind of stuff :o) 

When I was flipping through their menu, font and pictures were exactly like Kiki's in inner sunset! Under the same owner maybe but the atmosphere here was way off compared to Kiki's. They even had the pink dragon roll like Kiki's! Alright enough of the comparing, let's get to the schematics. 

SERVICE: 
We had all 3 waiters come up to us at one point. First the older Asian lady, then the Asian man, then a younger Asian girl stopped by once. The older Asian lady rushed my boyfriend and I. We told her 2x that we needed more time but she came to our table after a minute anyways, she wasn't rude but we felt she was a little too pushy. The older one and the man seemed everywhere, a little frazzled looking at times. So don't expect to find excellent customer service here because you won't find it.

FOOD:
Lunch special(tempura roll, rock n roll and California roll): eh.
Pink dragon roll: also eh. Roll fell apart easily. 
Ebiyaki: the only thing I liked about our meal. Tasty, flavorful, yay! 

So overall, this place is good if you're on a budget and don't care for quality. One thing I have to say is that I find it weird that you can't see the people making your sushi. If this place is owned by the same people as Kiki's, they should really consider remodeling this place so customers can at least see someone making it.
author: Grace Anne D.

description:
Kitaro is on of the cheapest Japanese restaurants I've been too. The sushi rolls ranges from $4 to $9 dollars. The quality isn't bad and does the job! As for starters, I would recommend ordering the garlic edamame. As for my entree, I ordered the teriyaki salmon bento box with tuna sashimi. I really like how they give you a at least 8 pieces of sashimi and not rip you off with tiny 4 pieces or something. 

If you want cheap sushi or craving cheap Japanese food, Kitaro is the place to go!
author: Jenn L.

description: It's a really good price for San Francisco. It's not bad, but I cannot say it was a wonderful culinary experience. It was ok.
author: Eldar B.

description:
I use to come here a lot but I just can't anymore. It's REALLY cheap and I can get over the quality of the fish because of the price. I only have concerns about the cleanliness which worries me about the question if the fish is sushi grade or not. I am allergic to shrimp and crab, but I have never had a problem before. However the last several times I came here I had bad reactions and didn't correlate it to this place (or I was just in denial because I do like eating here). SO I put it to the test and I tracked my reactions with how long after eating at kitaro. It only proves to me that there is a lot of cross contamination between the shrimp, crab, and fish, but it also means that the work space isn't cleaned often enough, OR maybe it is the fish quality.

Overall I think if you want cheap, decent eats, and you don't have allergies, this is the place for you, but be wary. Eating raw is no game.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
Kitaro holds a place near and dear to my heart. I've been coming here since high school and this place never disappoints. It's been through cheap dates, girls night out, birthdays.. you name it! Sure their sushi may not be the freshest, but for the price it is worth it. You HAVE to get the chicken karaage dinner and ask for extra spicy mayo sauce because you are gonna need more. Comes with a salad and miso soup for you to wash it all down. I also like their spicy udon, katsu don, FIRE CRACKER roll, and alaskan roll. There are many Japanese restaurants in San Francisco, but I always find myself coming back here- that's saying something.

Tip: If you shop at the Safeway in Richmond, they always have coupons on the back of your receipt for 15% off :)
author: Karmen T.

description: Fresh sushi and big portions at a great price! My family/friends/boyfriend and I been going to this place for years and have never been disappointed. Our go-to's are the Spider Roll, Alaskan Roll, Rainbow Roll, Tiger Roll, Spicy Miso Ramen, and Vegetable Tempura. Recently moving to the Mission District has not stopped me from driving the 20-30 mins across our crowded city for this sushi. To that point- there is also another location called Kiki's on 9th and Irving! I'm loyal to my Kitaro branch though:) I recommend this restaurant 100%!
author: Cassandra M.

description: Amazing sushi, no. Good sushi for a great price on a night that I don't want to cook, yes. For what this place is, it's great. Again if you are looking for the best of the best, go downtown and spend $100 a person.
author: Nick H.

description: really really good prices, especially for san francisco sushi! still fresh and tasty, and they have excellent lunch deals! a really cute atmosphere, good seating, nice staff! i've never seen it busy, but it's always nice to not spend an arm and a leg for good sushi!
author: Maddie Y.

description:
Left the Legion of Honor today with friends and we were hankering for sushi. Me? Sashimi.

We found Kitaro open during the off-peak times when most sushi restaurants are closed. I was apprehensive. It had a bad rating and bad reviews. For sushi that can amount to a pretty bad risk.

We loved it. The salmon sashimi was not bad at all. It tasted wonderful and for $14 the lunch special was extremely generous.

I think the best part of the experience though was the customer service. The short, asian woman, with short hair was cheerful, sweet, patient and prompt. 

SERVICE makes or breaks a place.  

So-so food with amazing, warm service vs. horrific, nasty service with great food. Which leaves a memorable impact affecting your decision on coming back?

Yep.
author: P K.

description: Been eating here for years, it definitely isn't nobu but great price point if you are trying to feed the masses.
author: Hiki L.

description:
I used to go to Kitaro all the time, but then when we moved further away, it was harder to get to. So my recent trip to Kitaro brought back fond memories.

One of my favorite dishes there is the chicken teriyaki. Usually, I'd get it in a combination with another item such as the California roll or tempura. The chicken teriyaki is tender with the perfect amount of teriyaki sauce. It's served with a generous amount of rice and a side salad. The shrimp and vegetable tempura are lightly covered in batter so that's it's soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. 

The firecracker is also another favorite item. Salmon and mackerel with rice rolled in batter and fried. Then top with a spicy aioli drizzle. 

A lot times you can find coupons for Kitaro in the mail or on the back of your Safeway receipts. Definitely a great way to save money on an already cheap meal
author: Andrea G.

description:
Best place for cheap SF sushi. Parking meters do get enforced.
+ invariably fresh
+ tempura has classic consistency 
+ good lunch sashimi specials
+ student priced
+ near golden gate park and does do take out
author: LBear B.

description: Affordable and tasty sushi! People that work here are super friendly. I usually order the dinner bento box or just sushi. The bento box comes with the miso soup and it's so good! I love their tekka maki tuna roll and sashimi. Must try!
author: Linore R.

description:
I have been coming here ever since I was little. It is a very fast, cheap, yet pretty good sushi place. Not saying the sushi here is the freshest or the best, but it is worth what you pay. I can pay almost $30 max for two people and get two entrees and a few appetizers. I usually come here when I am craving some japanese food but trying to save some money.
Their spicy udon is to die for. It really is spicy and really great on cold days.
Another thing I like here is the fire cracker, it is really good!! It is a small roll, only about 4-5 pieces. The price is good and the taste is realllllly good. I love the firecracker, it is a must try!
author: Ariunaa B.

description:
Aside from the cheap sushi, this place really doesn't have much going for itself. But then again, the quality you get reflects the amount of money you pay for. And you really don't pay for a lot here. 

I've been here a few times already and I can't really say what is ~good~ here. Last night, I had the dinner combination bento with chicken karaage and shrimp and vegetable tempura. The veggie tempura was probably the best part of the meal. Chicken karaage was waaay too deep fried to the point where I couldn't even bite into it. 

Also had a piece of the blue shrimp nigiri. Okay, in all fairness, that wasn't bad. It was also like $3 for 2 pieces. 

If it weren't because my boyfriend loves cheap sushi, I would probably never come back. Also, hot tea is $0.49 ... ....... ..
author: April Z.

description: The food and the pricing were very good. However the staff was very pushy. Every few minutes we had someone different coming to our table asking us if we would like to order more food. One of the staff cleaned up my table including the soy sauce I was currently dipping my sushi in. I almost gave it 2 stars because of how rude they were but the food and prices were not bad.
author: Tim R.

description: Definitely one of my favorite places. I leave near by and I order from them a lot. Delicious and not overpriced. Thanks!
author: Victoria K.

description: Bottom line, it's cheap(er) sushi and bento boxes.  My brother ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner and it looked like it was two dinners instead of one.  But you're paying for the price of one!  The others and I ordered a bunch of rolls and shared them.  There was plenty of food.  The rolls were decent but again, you get more bang for your buck.  The service was good.  It's been awhile since I've been here.  During our dinner, I notice that they do a fair amount of take out.  It's nice to know if I'm ever hankering for sushi to go.  Definitely a neighborhood type of restaurant.
author: Ang L.

description:
This place is the junkiest sushi I've ever tasted. Food wakes the body up, but after eating here my body was in shut down mode and I had to lie down. Food here is heavy and over salted and gave me a salt migraine.  They serve absolutely everything on plastic or melamine but either way it's leeching into the food and poisoning people. For goodness sake, will you just please upgrade to glass serving platters? Or at least stainless steel if you don't want them breaking? Owners of Kitaro, I'm talking to you.

The tea is so watered down you may as well skip it and ask for water. The food is tasteless and the miso soup is all salt. If you're looking down quality fresh fish skip this joint. If you're looking to get over charged for some greasy fast food inspired sushi rolls come here. I had a dream that Kitaro became a Japanese fast food restaurant all over America, synonymous to McDonalds. Did not want to come here -- but my other half insisted. Yuck! Won't be back unless they clean up their act .
author: Mary P.

description:
Went there last weekend with my parents. Didn't like anything about it. 
very bad looking in side.
We ordered California rolls and some other that they have in their menu. 
everything was bad. starting with the look ending with taste. You can only taste rice in sushi nothing else. 
Will never go back.
author: Carl D.

description: The food was good. Above Average japanese restaurant with reasonable prices (coupons on back of Safeway receipts). The sushi was was fresh and the beef was cooked well. I would recommend the garlic edamame, as it's flavorful and juicy. You can tell by the quality of the food that it's all fresh. Good place to get a quick meal, we were in and out in half an hour
author: Bob J.

description:
What was once a cheap and mediocre sushi resto has become a nightmare.

Horrible surly service. Quality of food is bad....fish is not fresh at all.

My last time!
author: David G.

description:
Went here tonight because grandma swears it's better than the restaurant next door. Can never argue with her, so we come for dinner. I get my usual at any sushi bar to start; ikura nigiri. Not very tasty, but meh. Definitely not mindblowing either. On to the next one! Chirashi sushi. Presentation is a little bland and flat, and for some strange reason, I was thirsty as all hell afterwards! The roe on the side tasted like plastic! My sister, who also ordered the same, also disliked the roe and didn't finish it. The fish was ok. Just OK.

Grandma devoured her chicken teriyaki/tempura/salad dinner bowl though!
author: Denise H.

description:
Kitaro is great if you look at it from the perspective of fast food sushi. If you put it on the same standards of other sit-down sushi restaurants, you'd likely be disappointed. But when you compare the price to what you're getting, you'll find it's not bad at all.

The portions of their nigiri sushi are quite nice. They also have ebi yaki, which is sort of a comfort food of mine. I also love that they have grilled squid. Those are usually the things I get. Their sushi can sometimes get a bit heavy, which is why I like to stick to their nigiri where I can pick the fish off of their portions of rice.

Their actual rolls are a bit sloppy to me. Don't get me wrong, I'll still eat them, but you just have to look at them differently than real Japanese sushi. Some people can look past the non-authenticity of this place because of it's price. Others are absolutely insulted by the fact that this place is even open.
author: Cara O.

description:
Hit and missed on the service.  They focused on to go order first.

Great place to have lunch.  Price is affordable.  Service is good and quick for lunch.

However, dinner service is bad.  We always go there for lunch and dinner.  On average, about once a month.  Recently, the day that sf hit 106 degree.  It was hot in there.  We accepted.  Wait for table was quick.  The udons and bento boxes were quick.  The. We waited and waited for our sushi order.  After 45 mins later we asked the actress.  She responded that we are focusing to go first.  Then the really rude experienced waitress/manager told us that sushi are on the way and three other tables asked for their also.  After 1 hour and 30 mins later, sushi came but the all the sushi were incorrect.  The rude manager then said you ordered them.  My wife said why would we ordered stuff my kids do not eat!!!!  She then said then you need to wait to we can fix your order.  They removed two sushi rolls do not belongs to us and gave them to the table next to us and removed one sushi from other plate and put on our table.  I told them you cannot touch with your hand and expect us to each them.  They then took them to the back and come back 5 mins later.  Do we asked for the check and they automatically added the tips of 15% because we have 7 ppl.  

Worse service ever.  The owner needs to come out and see how this is run.  I think is time for a new owner again.
author: Hugh D.

description:
I have not been here for a long time after marriage.
Today, i went there with family to eat quick and cheap Japanese foods.
Ordered sushi plate, two chicken teriyaki bento boxes, spicy udon, spicy tuna, dragon roll , grilled squid, and fried soft shell crab.
Yeah, a lot of foods and generous portion
All of them were delicious..
Highly recommend this place if someone does not spend too much money and want to eat tasty foods

Will go back when i visit my family in sf later
author: Jane K.

description: I 've been going to this restaurant since I was a Freshman in highschool and I am in love with this place! I usually come here during lunch time to get the bento lunch box that comes with sushi, rice, chicken terriyaki and a salad. I also love getting their sushi rolls. My favorite in particular is the Pink Dragon Roll.
author: Raven M.

description: I like coming here for my sushi fix, the prices are cheap and you get a lot of bang for your buck. I like the chicken katsu, chicken terrioki. The food is inconsistant at times, it depends on the day of the week that you go there.  The terrioki will be overcooked ineddible to eat.  The sushi is affordable and always consistent. I like the eel and the alaska roll the most.  There is a difference between take out and eat in when it comes to the food portions and the price.  I will sometimes do take out if the place is crowded and I don't want to wait for a table then the food.  I like that you got a big pot of tea at the table when you request that you want hot tea. At times I can't finish the pot with one other person and I can't finish my food because it is filling. It depends on how good is the food whether I want to wrap up the leftovers.
author: Alix J.

description:
Affordable Japanese, enough said.
From the sushi to the dinner sets the variety is deep enough to satisfy any want.
Don't come for the presentation but for the affordable Japanese food.
I like the garlic albacore, Irish roll along with the pumpkin. 
If you are in the neighborhood, stop by.
author: David H.

description:
One of the cheapest Japanese restaurant in SF. I always go here to get their bento boxes or udon.
Their bento consists of two entree, comes with rice, salad, and miso soup! 

I dont personally order my sushi rolls here because Their rolls taste and look home made, so I dont think it's worth getting.
author: Inge C.

description:
I'm a fan of the garlic albacore and bento boxes: grilled salmon was not overcooked and dry...that's a good thing! 

Soft Shell Crab was 3-4/5. Best soft shell crab was 'House'.
author: Thomas C.

description:
After being berated by my friends for agreeing to go to dinner at Kitaro Friday night, I prayed that I would power through dinner and leave without food poisoning. But I must say, I was actually mostly pleased with my experience here.

The place was poppin', assumingly because it's crazy cheap and people love sushi. I felt slightly judged by the wairtress after ordering large beers and large Sakes, but whatever, it's $5.29 per beverage, I'd be a fool to not order that. It was hot as all hell and of course, SF doesn't know what to do about a heat wave, so we sat and sweated it out. 

My friend ordered two side dinner salads ($1.79 each, what!) with a creamy, light, peanut sauce dressing. I was eyeballing the Sashimi, and you Yelpers said it's the best option, but I wasn't too hungry (but more thirsty), so when he ordered the 49er Roll ($4.79) and the San Francisco Roll ($3.69) I felt that would be enough food. We both liked the 49er Roll, which was spicy tuna, avocado, crab, and tobiko. The crab tasted fresh and the roll was slightly spicy. I wasn't a big fan of the SF Roll as the salmon salad was kind of mushy. 

Overall, I would go back since it's so cheap and I'm not really a picky sushi person: if it's spicy, raw, and fresh, I'll be happy. The restaurant was crazy busy and stifflingly hot, so I'm going to wait till this heat wave breaks and I can to get back into my boots and jacket combos, and stop wiping the sweat from my brow as I try to look cute while stuffing sushi into my face.
author: Crystal C.

description: This is honestly my favorite place when I come to frisco. I used to come here once every couple months.  I need to make my way out here again.  Prices are amazing and food is delicious. The servers are very welcoming and nice. When kintaro is packed it does feel very very stuffy but on the hand it's packed for a reason.   If the place was never packed, I probably wouldn't be coming here.  Good food and great service, what more can you ask for?
author: Klair A.

description:
Went for lunch, fish was fresh, huge pieces of nigiri, great prices. Sushi rice was made pretty well. 

Would like it better if the bathroom was nicer and the place wasn't so dark but considering how cheap it is for what you get, I'll be back.
author: Emma M.

description:
Don't come here if you're dreaming of jiro-dreams-of-sushi (lol sushi inception?). Come here if you want to get the some of the cheapest sushi in the city that wouldn't kill you.

Service was lacking and the waitress looked mean, but ~$5 for 8 decent squares of salmon sashimi (lunch combo) and $4.99 for two good pieces of uni nigiri that doesn't taste like piss, should they just give me free money instead?
author: Tian Q.

description:
Something's amiss here.  What used to be good Japanese food prepared by non Japanese is no longer appetizing. There used to be lines out the door.  Granted I haven't been here in quite awhile, but what a disappointment last night. 

I ordered the dinner combo bento box - tonkatsu and tuna sashimi.  Limp unappealing salad, unedible steam rice (old and chewy), old tasting ginger, weak wasabi.  Fortunately the tonkatsu and sashimi was edible.

I went home and still felt hungry.

I guess I won't be returning.
author: Shirley N.

description: 2 stars for the cheap prices, the fact that we were seated right away and the place looked clean. The other 3 stars are missing because the sushi is simply NO GOOD. I ordered the San Francisco Roll (which is usually made with lemon) but they charged me $1 extra to put lemon on their version. And the part that typically has crab imitation meat just had a disgusting chunk of canned tuna tasting fish. The sushi wasn't rolled well you can tell it was falling apart everytime you picked it up with chopsticks. My advise is to go to another sushi place, pay more but get good food. Garlic edamame was also nasty, seems like they got minced garlic from the store, mixed it with soy sauce and just threw the edamame on there. Nothing special about that.
author: Ana D.

description: They overcharge my card by few bucks. The place was cheap but i always take a photo of my receipts. Its a matter principle.
author: Irene A.

description:
CHEAP MAKESHIFT SUSHI. Absolutely nothing special. Most rolls are boring and unauthentic.

There are 2-3 other sushi restaurants on the same block if you would like to have real sushi.
author: Vivian W.

description:
They had a coupon in the Value Pack.  $28 for a really big platter of sushi -- actually, they had four options, two of which looked appealing.

I called in and the sushi was ready to go within 15 minutes, all packaged up with soy sauce and wasabi included.

The sushi was good but not great... but considering the price, you can't beat it.  Enough food for four people and lots of great choices.

Google them.  I am pretty sure you can get the coupon on-line but even without the coupon, great sushi to go!
author: Gary A.

description: Cozy spot and decent sushi. Took my parents several times here and we've had a bad experience with one particular waitress  -who is a bit older. She's rude and has an attitude. She has even thrown the forks on the table when we've asked for them. I was upset the last time I went and I ended up complaining to one of the other employees as my family and I were leaving. Not sure if I'll take my family there. My father is a Multiple Sclerosis patient who's in a wheelchair and doesn't deserve to be treated like crap. I hope the manager talks to this waitress. There's no need for that kind of behavior.
author: Alejandro D.

description: I came here for sushi more than 10 years ago when I did not know what sushi really taste like, it tasted ok.  I dropped by once to ask if I can exchange some quarters, the waitress was super mean, she said "Only 1 dollar, if you buy our food, I will let you have 2 dollars in quarters." Since then, I never came back again.
author: Shan S.

description: Good for basic Japanese food. Owned by the same people as kiki's. Good prices and food is good. Went here tonight and had the dinner bento consisting of salmon teriyaki and chicken karage. Comes with rice salad and soup. My friend got the bento with beef teriyaki and salmon sashimi and next time I'm definitely getting the salmon sashimi! The portion was very generous and it was pretty fresh and tasty.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Kitaro is a pleasant neighbourhood restaurant serving Japanese food (surprise!) mostly for American palates (this is a given when I see "California Roll" on a menu and two-bite rolls).  

Service is quick and very friendly. 

Prices are reasonable, the food is fresh. 

You can stuff your self and a couple of dining companions silly with good fare, and with drinks, get out for under 60$ If you don't go crazy.

In addition to sushi, there are other options such as bento.

They even can accommodate "vegans". (Sorry, sounds to much like "Vogons" to me)

This is not a fine dining experience.  It is just good, reasonably priced fare. Ambiance is casual, it's a bit noisy.
author: Karin The R.

description:
This review is mostly based on the rude and disrespectful service I received from two older Asian ladies:

Upon arriving, my friends and I were a bit overwhelmed with all the options we had from the menu, so of course, we politely requested a few more minutes from the server. She then proceeds to scoff and walks off... okaay, rude.

Once we were ready to order, we called over a different lady to take our orders. I told her specifically that I wanted the curry chicken katsu udon, she nods and then takes my other friends orders super fast, *DOES NOT REPEAT OUR ORDER*, and grabs our menus from us and runs off. Super rude. My friend ordered tempura udon, and her boyfriend ordered sushi rolls.

Later, someone brings out a miso soup and just slams it onto our table. We were confused why we had some miso soup, but we didn't get a chance to ask any of the waitresses why we had one because they were too busy lollygagging elsewhere. 

The first server then brings out a bento box of chicken katsu with rice. No udon. No curry. So I spoke up and said they took my order wrong. She then gives me this displeased look and storms off with the bento box. 

The 2nd server comes storming over to my table and gives me this glaring look as if steam was about to come out of her eyes and nostrils. She proceeded to say, "NO U ORDER DA CHIKEN KATSU~ Y U SAY U NO WANT THIS" 
and I replied with "No, I ordered the curry chicken katsu udon." I tried my best to be friendly but, damn, she looked like she wanted to rip my head off.

She then grabbed the miso soup (oh! so that's what it's for) and said "I TAKE SOUP" and she tossed it into the garbage can, and it was super loud. That was totally uncalled for.

I know what I ordered. Obviously that is why told you it's wrong. Everyone else at the table heard what I ordered. We all discussed what we were going to order prior to ordering. Honestly, it won't even be that hard to put the katsu into a bowl of curry udon, like lady, just calm yoself. 

I have never felt so disrespected and uncomfortable eating at a restaurant before. In the back of my mind, I kept thinking that she'd spit in my udon, so I couldn't even finish, let alone enjoy my bowl of udon on that cold day. 

Needless to say, I won't be back.
author: Linh H.

description: I am a regular at this restaurant. I like their food and the price is reasonable. However, for my most recent take-out order, they charged to my credit card a different tip amount that was specified on the total (I did include a tip). I don't know if this is an oversight or they have a tip policy I don't know. I haven't decided if I want to visit again.
author: Elise W.

description: Let me start by saying the food here will not blow your mind but the overall experience is great. The food is tasty, quick, and cheap. They have many non sushi options which is good for picky eaters and the teriyaki chicken is actually good quality. This is not the impress your date restraunt but its the place you'll go to alone and leave perfectly satisfied.
author: Gabo A.

description:
Went here for a late lunch Saturday afternoon around 3pm. 
Pros: Fast service. Inexpensive rolls so you can order a bunch to eat! :) Food came out quickly.
There wasn't any real cons, the only reason I gave it a 4 star was because the sashimi wasn't very fresh/fatty. I don't know if I would come here if I were craving sashimi, but I would definitely come back if I was craving sushi rolls.
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Can't beat the lunch special! Kitaro offers an extensive array of affordable Japanese cuisine with friendly, quick service. 

The sushi was good too! Rolls under $4?! Can't beat that. I'll definitely be back and I'm glad I took a local's advice to try it out. 

If you like Japanese food and are looking a solid lunch spot, Kitaro is a great selection.
author: Yiorgo L.

description:
Meh. This is a great spot if you're looking for cheap sushi, but if you don't care about the taste. The fish is chewy and the rice is thick, but the prices are extremely affordable ($4 - $6 for a roll).

If you're looking to get a cheap sushi fix, check out Kitaro, but I'd stay clear of you're actually looking for a good meal.
author: Jalahn W.

description:
My katsu-don at lunch was pretty sad. The flavors and colors were both variations of bland. The menu claimed it came with veggies, but the only veggies were onions. The katsu was soggy and flavorless, and I'm not sure if an entire egg was even used in the dish. I asked for spicy sauce, and I got a small cup of a bright orange creamy-looking sauce, which looked like the stuff used to garnish spicy rolls. Gross.

Also tried the spam roll, gyoza, and some specialty roll. All were fine, filling, and cheap but nothing great or interesting.
author: Carolyn F.

description: I used to come here all the time when I was younger because it was tasty (not exceptional but I was also in high school) and cheap. I just got it tonight for take out and it was downright gross. Never going to come back.
author: Marianna L.

description:
The time before last when I was at this place the server forgot to our order for almost a half an hour (until I asked about it.) This place has had some ups and downs. I told the owner last time I saw him how I felt. He claimed full responsibility for the actions of his employes. 

The staff is generally cool, sometimes I can see they are a bit overworked and disgruntled.
I recognize some of them as long term, over 5 years. I have been coming here for well over 10 years. Like another recent review, christian n noted, this place has changed from that time period.
I remember the list on the door and waiting a long time to get a table.

Kitaro today vs yesterday:
I think the food is about the same. 
They have added some new menu items but it is generally unchanged.
The rolls are all the same as a decade ago for the most part with some minor additions.
The grilled food, fried dishes and the teriyaki are certainly unchanged. 
Large portions and mostly traditional preparation.  
The selection of sushi rolls are mostly nontraditional = large Americanized rolls.  

Things can get screwed up when it starts to hit the table. Most of the time the food all comes all at once. Forget ordering an appetizer and having it come first, it will come out as it comes out: out of order and quickly. From time to time they just strait up forget stuff and you will never see it unless you ask. 

But the food is still the same after over a decade, even if the service has gone up and down over the years. Sometimes the tables are sticky. 
The prices have gone up some over the years but it's still some of the best inexpensive sushi in town. Nothing overtly fancy. Kitaro's is what it is. I used to think it was great when I was young. I didn't know any better. Now I know about the varying different qualities in sushi. When you can get sahshmi this cheap you have to be willing to give up quality in exchange for a deal. 
When a Pacific blue fin tuna sells for over $1000 a pound Kitaro is a cheep option. Just remember, you get what you pay for.
author: Ben M.

description:
It's tough for me to write this review because I have been here multiple times before, but tonight will be my last.

My boyfriend and I arrived at 5:30 on a Friday night. It wasn't incredibly busy, but it was obvious once we were seated that they were one (or two or three) servers short. Willing to put this aside, we eagerly awaited our food.

I ordered the vegetable udon, which was alright. My boyfriend was about to dig into his teriyaki chicken when he said, "oh, God..." I knew something was wrong and when I asked him, he pointed to a fly embedded in his rice. This fly was obviously in the rice cooker with the rest of the rice as it was buried pretty deep.

I pointed it out to a server (not our server, who hadn't looked at us since we got our food), and she shrugged and said "Oh, sorry." And backed away. I had to ask her to replace the plate; it was almost as if she thought the apology was enough. She went back to the kitchen and I watched her point the fly out to a cook. She came back and said they would remake it for us.

They brought out the remade plate, and we started eating. My boyfriend said he liked his food but I could tell that his appetite had been ruined (mine had too).

All in all, we had 4 different servers "helping" us, and not one refilled our water glasses when we gulped them down before we started eating. The glasses remained empty for the remainder of our meal, despite my asking 3 times for more water.

Despite having a fly in our food, they did not offer to comp anything or take care of the dessert we ordered. It took me asking 4 times for them to bring me a to-go box, but when we asked for the check they brought it immediately.
author: Morgan B.

description:
How this place is still in business is beyond me.  My family used to be regulars at this place years ago and decided to have dinner here on a Sunday night.  This last experience was definitely not what I remembered.  I'm not sure where their profit is going to but its not going to up keeping the decor and menu.  This was the first time I'm grateful my parents still use those coupons on the back of Safeway receipts.  

Bento box...disgusting!
Sushi ...disgusting!
The entire menu...disgusting!
author: Dean W.

description:
Kitaro - Don't Bother

We've frequented Kitaro many times though the years and have tolerated the same inconsistencies.  This place is super affordable with food that is not too bad if you know what to order.  If you don't, look out.  They give 15% discounts with coupons on the back of Safeway receipts.....but beware!!!

We've stopped ordering bags (SF thing) on to go orders, not as a way to save a dime but as a way to make sure our to-go orders are prepared correctly.  Most of the time our orders still need fixing.  The little guy at the front constantly talks over you as you order, even when business is slow.  He's tapping away on that machine using a pen, pencil or credit card without even listening as there is usually a telephone to his ear.  UGH!  We've found most of the recent staff to be hostile and rather unpleasant even when pointing out errors in our order.  We could place the exact same order 3 different times and come home with 3 different messes.  For god's sake, at this point they should be paying us!  We're tired and we quit Kitaro!  Good riddance...this place has turned NASTY!
author: Chris F.

description:
It is a nice and cheap place for decent Sushi... Definitely not my first choice but I would go for a quick bite every now and then... Best time to go is in the afternoon because the fish taste a bit more fresh.

Edit:2015 this place got worst both food wise and customer service. Waiter drops food, does not apologize. We ask for extra plate to share sushi and he throws them on the table. I mean why pay cheap for crap when for a few extra dollars you can have better stuff. 

Sushi was falling apart. The size were not equal. The fried tofu was just warm in the middle. As if it was microwaved. Enough said.
author: Ashish N.

description:
I love Kitaro, I've been coming here since middle school. They don't have the highest quality sushi but it's affordable, great portions, and worth what you pay for.

I usually order their rolls which ranges from $4-$10 and sometimes I order their bento boxes, which can range around $10 but less than $15.

Also, my favorite appetizers from here are the chicken karaage ($5.99) and grilled squid ($6.99).
author: B. R.

description:
Great place for a Quick and casual dinner! 
Good food, fast service and for me it's close to home :)
author: Yana A.

description: My friend and I are are doing a cheap sushi tour of SF, and I remembered this place as being one of the classic cheapies, with low quality to match. I found it a bit more expensive (though still very reasonable) and quite a bit better than I remembered, quality-wise. Nothing really stood out, but nothing was inedible. Friendly service. I'll be back when the economy crashes.
author: Nick C.

description:
Cheap Japanese Food. 

I am not a big fish connoisseur but I do love me some raw salmon (sake). Kitaro is a decent sized restaurant that offers good/decent sushi and a very good price (considering how expensive sushi normally is). 

Don't come here expecting Morimoto sushi by any means but I have been here twice and haven't gotten sick (knock on wood). 

This is your Japanese food on a budget. You get what you pay for.
author: Stephanie W.

description: The food is cheap and good for what it is! I only get the firecracker, Gyoza and garlic edamame when I go. The service is pleasant but not overly friendly. Nice interior, they keep it clean. It's a nice mid-week place to stop by and grab a snack.
author: Lydia B.

description: Ordered the beef noodle soup and the beef was tough and had a lot of fat. I asked about it and was told it was suppose to.
author: Frances L.

description:
Love the spicy tuna roll , tempura roll and spider roll. 
The place is usually busy, but food comes quickly. The waitstaff is always friendly.
author: Mac A.

description:
Love it! Love it! Love it! Minus the recent price increase but hey, got to fight inflation some how.  Still a great price for sushi!  

Fastest service in the west! All their rolls are delicious and exceptionally priced.  Seaweed salad is bomb diggity and all the tempura is quite choice.  

I cant get over how fast their service is too.  Its like t-minus 10 min before you have your food! 

I'm a regular here and will continue to be a regular here.
author: Thom C.

description: Been going to Kitaro since I was about yay high, according to the calligraphy hanging on the wall 1994, so it's been forever! It's definitely a place that's uber comforting and I love the food and smell of this place. My go-to is tea, grilled squid, bento box lunch/dinner combos, firecracker roll, udon noodles, and/or the California roll, chicken karrage, and spicy udon (numerical spicy level based on your preference, 1 being mild) combo.  And I love the staff-attentive and friendly. All in all, Kitaro feels like home!
author: P C.

description:
We go to Kitaro because it's decent food and we live in the district.  We were seated in a community table, 4 of us on one end and 3 other people at the other end.  They ordered and we ordered.  My son and his gf's food came, the other group's food came but where's my hubby and my food!!!  Asked 3 different servers about our food.  My son and gf ate over 1/2 of their meals before ours finally came!!!!

They said the ticket got lost but what happened the 1st 2 times, I asked????

Will have to rethink about going back!!
author: M. K.

description:
I am quoting a previous reviewer, Linh H, who writes:

"Upon arriving, my friends and I were a bit overwhelmed with all the options we had from the menu, so of course, we politely requested a few more minutes from the server. She then proceeds to scoff and walks off... okaay, rude."

My date and I had the exact same experience. We were one of only two tables in the restaurant, as it was only 5PM. We were seated and immediately asked whether we wanted anything to drink. Okay, no problem, we ordered green tea. Waitress returns a minute or two later with the teas and asks if we are ready to order. We hadn't even really looked at the menu yet! When we requested a bit more time, she was obviously irritated and walked off as she said Okay. When she returned, she was pretty unfriendly, no smiling, nothing, just took our order and that's it.

The sushi came quickly, and as far as the the sushi is concerned, it was mediocre at best, though I admit it was cheap. Four of their "specialty" rolls (Rainbow, 49er, Surfer, and Kamizake), plus seaweed salad and two green teas with tax came to about $35 with tip (though I have no idea why I tipped 20%). They use imitation lump crab meat which I think pretty much ruins any potentially good sushi roll, and I can't say that the flavoring was anything that could be described as "tasty."

I would not return here personally but if you feel like cheap, quick sushi, go for it.
author: Jen D.

description: I really love to eat the Japanese Food.But this restaurant I don't recommend because the taste of the food is not good.I'd rather to go to JapanTown buying the bento box in the supermarket to eat.
author: Baby L.

description:
Let's go grab some sushi... some really really cheap sushi!  Wanna roll?  Let's roll!  Where are we rolling to?  To the best place for rolls at a high school ninja's allowance and a college ninja's part time budget.  Ah yes... those were the days.  Today they are still the way this ninja had left them after he went on a journey in search of experience and tranquility.

These days, this ninja can afford finer grades and cuts of fish at other authentic Japanese sushi spots.  While this ninja would normally never order rolls, even more so with inferior fish after he left ninja school and into the real world, he has become quite the savage here at Kitaro.  He would never do their sashimi, and with all the salmon issues nowadays, he'd definitely opt out of anything salmon.  What he is game for is all their other sushi rolls!  Come on, let's be frank here, sushi rolls has become one of the best finger foods of all time with the combination of varieties of raw fish, sometimes cooked, teriyaki chicken (here at Kitaro), shellfish, all bundled up with that chewy roasted seaweed and fluffy short grain Japanese rice!  I really wouldn't recommend ordering anything else on the menu besides the sushi rolls.

For just about 40 bucks this ninja can pretty much feed his family of 4 here where their rolls range anywhere from 2.50 to 6 bucks while a few heavy hitters at 8 bucks.  The rolls you'll most likely see on this ninja's plate are (prices rounded):
-Spider Roll $6
-Godzilla Roll $5.50
-Kitaro Roll $3
-Rainbow Roll $8
-49ers Roll $5
-Rock n Roll $4.50
-Kamikaze Roll $5
-Tempura Roll $4
For descriptions of the rolls go to:  http://kitarosushi.com/kitaro/

If this ninja decides to claim all the rolls of the usual suspects, (do the math) it comes out to no more than 50 bucks after tax n tips for close to 50 pieces of tasty sushi roll bites!

Come with a group of hungry ninjas to be sure you get to try all the different sushi rolls!  If it costs an American Gladiator about 10 bucks to super size a good beefed up combo at Mickey D's then this American ninja would rather slap his 10 bucks down at Kitaro, turn it into scrumptious pieces of sushi rolls with a bunch of ninja allies, and use the ninja chomping technique to make the little gems of ninja goodness disappear into our bellies.

For the price vs quantity and quality of their rolls ONLY... 4 ninja stars and a Yums stamp of approval.  If you decide to go for everything else besides the rolls, you are setting yourself up for an experience of 3 ninja stars or perhaps less depending on how generous you are.  But then again why would any wise ninja go for something they are not known for anyway?
author: Colin M.

description:
Kitaro, great place for quick service, and dependable small wait time for food to be ready to be consumed! 

The combo plates are my usual order for inside and to-go. When ordering to-go, it takes them less than 10 minutes from when I call and when I get it ready to take home. 

They always let me add whatever sushi order to pair with the Chicken Teriyaki so that's a plus!
author: Keith L.

description:
Katsu-don tasted terrible. Rice was cold and hard, The katsu tasted undercooked. The chairs were dirty (old rice stuck everywhere). Service was mediocre. This is more of a come-and-go place. Don't expect to have a fantastic sushi experience here.

Bleh. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else for real Japanese food.
author: Cheri S.

description:
We don't go here often because of the parking or lack thereof.  However we dropped by here yesterday for a quick lunch. We were seated right away.  They weren't full up at high noon.  We ordered the tonkatsu/veggie croquette, Teri salmon/tempura and Teri chicken/tempura.  

The miso soup was ok.  At least it wasn't overly salty. The croquette was fried just right - golden brown. Tonkatsu wasn't dry or tough. The Teri and tempura are also spot on. 

The minuses

They charged us 30 cents for hot tea.  That is really nickel and diming your customers!  The salad tasted watery. It looks like they didn't dry the lettuce in the spinner hence the water from the lettuce diluted the dressing. 

It's ok but not worth the $4 parking.
author: Wendy H.

description: Solid, cheap sushi place. Unpretentious. Probably on the Americanized side. You get a discount if you bring a safeway receipt (see the back of the receipt).
author: Ryan Y.

description:
My friend: "Hey, Stephenie, do you want to meet us for lunch at Kitaro?"
Me: "You couldn't pay me to eat there."

Yes, this was a real life conversation I had with my friend recently. The only reason that I'm not giving it a one star is because I know a few people who really like the food here and insist that the sashimi is really good. I've only had the sushi rolls, so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and assume that the sashimi is not terrible, but that's all I will concede. The sushi rolls are so bland and boring, not to mention warm when they shouldn't be. I (embarrassingly) took a friend here once and we both almost gagged on the garlic edamame that we ordered. Just. Gross.

The one benefit of Kitaro is that it's cheap. Like dirt cheap for sushi. But I will gladly pay more to get quality sushi. There are just too many other places in San Francisco that far surpass the quality of sushi rolls here.
author: Stephenie S.

description: Kitaro is a good place to stop in for a quick, cheap lunch. Most rolls are under $6 and the quality is what you pay for. They have some pretty great lunch combo options (udon + donburi and a few bento options) that are a great deal.
author: Lauren C.

description: This place is great. For what they have, their sushi tastes pretty fresh, including their sashimi surprisingly. I usually go here for their sashimi dinner, which includes 20 pieces of sashimi. You heard me right. For that, that's a deal. They have a great selection of sushi rolls, hand rolls, and dinner plates for decent prices. The service is decent, but as long as they don't take forever or treat me like an asshole with their prices I'll take it.
author: Brandon P.

description:
Super cheap sushi when your first and second choice options for dinner are closed for some reason. 

Not your top notch quality sushi, but they're pretty decent for the price you pay for. 
I don't remember the exact rolls we ordered, but I definitely wouldn't mind coming back here again for lunch or dinner. 

Ill probably write an updated review with more details when I go back.
author: Harriet W.

description: Beware of this dishonest business. I signed my receipt with no tip written in since I leave a cash tip. Later on my statement Kitaros added a 10$ to their own receipt even after I signed it! If u pay card here double check your statement!
author: Jaseon F.

description:
I ordered a dinner entree: Chicken Karage that came with rice, salad, and miso soup.  For $7/$8 there was a huge amount of chicken. I'd say about 12 big pieces.

Service was fast. I was in and out in like 30 minutes. 

Parking is difficult.

They charge $.50 for tea.

I would definitely come again. Worth the price.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Quantity is there. Quality is okay.  I would definitely come here as a broke college student as many of the rolls are in a very, very affordable range.  However I didn't feel too happy about the seared/cooked salmon.  If I was in the area and wanted a quick and cheap roll, I'd definitely come here, otherwise, spend a little bit more for a little bit  more of a higher end product. 

The people like the prices apparently, it is packed here.
author: Morris C.

description:
came here for a birthday party. The food is not that great. I ordered the chicke. Teriyaki and the kamakaze and forty niners roll. the fish tasted old . The
Service sucks too the waiters are rude and didn't bring us water until after we got our food. I asked one of the lady's beforehand
To bring us water and she walked right past me. It's pretty packed but I'm guessing because of the cheap price tag .
author: Lisa N.

description: Man oh man I love Kitaro.  I know that many people consider this "cheap" Japanese food and honestly... it is.  However, I think it's one of my favorite cheap and good eats.  I love getting their lunch combo... usually kaarage and shrimp tempura roll.  Their chicken kaarage (Japanese popcorn chicken) is legit the bomb.com especially with their spicy mayo sauce.  Writing this review makes me want some right now... even though I legit had it yesterday.  Their prices are pretty good too... and they have 15% off coupons on the back of Safeway coupons so it's a great steal.  I am known to have a "cheap" palette but I don't really mind it.  As long as it tastes good to me. Definitely come here to give it a try!
author: Sam L.

description: I remember coming here all the time for ok sushi for a great price. I remember the mexican roll b re ing my favorite with a special spicy sauce in it. I was all excited to eat it again...took a bite...fell apart then I thought, did they give me the wrong order? I didn't taste the spicy sauce at all then went digging in my roll for it. After cheering and tasting very carefully I had a hint of the sauce. That's how little of it they put!! There was way too much rice surrounding each roll, they were not rolled tight enough, and all cut unevenly. If they were on Master Chef Gordon Ramsey would probably dump their sushi in the trash.
author: Karen T.

description: Ordered the sashimi lunch special. The waiter dude brings me tofu. I told him what I had ordered and he even confirmed by repeating it the first time. A few minutes later, not being convinced, he brings out the menu and continues to imply that I didn't know what I was ordering. I've been going here for the last 5 years, at least 2 or 3 times a month, and I have never once fudged up an order. He needs to lay down the pipe and get another job.
author: Anthony N.

description:
If you are looking for a dank (super delicious) sushi spot where the price is right and the service is on point, then look no further! I come here at least once a week with my roommate and enjoy ourselves every time! They also have a good deal on Sake Bombs, a perfect pre-party spot for Friday nights. 

I have to also give a shout out to Nicole, one of the servers there. She knows my roommate and me by name and always goes out of her way to say hello even if she is not waiting our table. She is super sweet, and always has on a huge smile!!
author: Taylor S.

description:
Food: Mediocre. Chinese interpretation of Japanese food. 
Service: Awkward, uncomfortable.
Restaurant: Way too hot. 
Verdict: Not going back.
author: Y T.

description:
Where in SF can you get average sushi for dirt cheap. Rolls for $3-6! Sashimi platters for $7. Appetizers for $2-5.

The pricing is simply awesome. The sushi is very average, and that's a good thing when it comes to price. I love going to fancy sushi places and don't mind paying $40-60 a person for great quality sushi. I also love simpler nights spending $10 a person to load up on solid rolls.

Get the firecracker (baked salmon), spider (soft shell crab), agedashi tofu, rainbow roll, etc.

Service is also excellent. I'll be back for a simple sushi dinner again!
author: Chuck N.

description: The food is good very tasty, place is very super packed, parking is horrible no highchairs available for little ones , but food as I said is very good , worth it
author: Irena M.

description: They have good quality food and good prices. The service is ok. I have been eating here every couple months since I live close-by. Just for the past few years, their portions on sushi became smaller because they don't want to raise the price too much, due to the economy.
