And you can always get their coupons in mail in the neighborhood. And they always have lunch special. I like to go there with my parents once in a while.
author: Darren Z.

description:
Haters gonna hate, this place has good food for ridiculously good prices (for SF especially). No, it's not the fanciest avocado-mango-carrot-tuna roll covered in eel and salmon deep fried with tobiko on top, but it has some fancier things and the majority of the rolls are just under $5 or $8. I LOVE sushi a crazy amount and as a poor student all I really ask for is that the fish is fresh and the rice is correctly seasoned, and Kitaro does both of those things. 

I've only had the sushi so I really have no idea what any of the other food is like. All I know is the people are nice and super fast, and I got a box full of sushi for under $20. I live in Richmond so I've eaten here 3 or 4 times in the past two months.
author: Christine U.

description:
What happened?

I just got back from a long international trip, and I was feeling a bit homesick and wanted a comfortable place I knew I liked for dinner. I called my best friend and when she asked where I wanted to go, I suggested Kitaro. "Kitaro...?" she said, and I didn't like the way her voice sounded.

I've been coming to Kitaro for 13 years, since I moved to the Bay Area in 2000. I used to wait for over an hour outside it to get in. As I learned more about sushi, how to better appreciate it, I've stuck with Kitaro -- it served a great purpose. It wasn't the best sushi around, not by a long shot, But it also wasn't the worst. 

What set Kitaro apart from its competition was a (relatively rare) mix of crazy rolls AND good quality nigiri, and absolutely the best price to quality ratio around. It simply was not possible to get sushi this good for this price anywhere else in SF. 

Well, forget all that. Now I know why my friend was disappointed when I suggested it. 

I don't think I'll be back. Crawling out to the Outer Richmond isn't as convenient as it used to be for me. There is no reason to make a special trip to go to the Kitaro of late 2013.

The quality of the rolls is very poor -- overall the construction of the sushi is very sloppy. Rolls fall apart, small and lopsided; fish is cut irregularly and layered together badly. Nothing looks appealing on the plate anymore.

The ingredients are no longer as fresh as they used to be, either. The fish is blander, and certainly some of it was older, too. Of course, freshness matters in sushi. 

I don't know if that's because of the obvious downward trend in the clientele (people have noticed, clearly, because it was half empty at 8:30 on a Friday night) or because of the general slide in quality, but the fish was simply not fresh enough.

Also, the place just generally looks run down now. It's not receiving care. The tables and seats are beat up. I don't know what's going on with the owners and managers, but clearly something is up. Nobody is paying attention to the way this place is sliding now. 

It's sad. It's a San Francisco landmark to me. Heck, after I posted this review I noticed the profile photo I use on Yelp was taken AT KITARO. But now I would never recommend it. It's not flat out make-you-sick terrible, but there's no care or craft in the food anymore.
author: christian n.

description:
This place is pretty good for the price. If you want cheap Japanese food. I only come here for their rolls. Specifically, spider, california, and a rock n roll.  My best friend always gets their tempura. I'm not a huge fan, but she loves it. 

The ambiance is nice I'd have to say. It gets kinda loud at times because of the families you see coming in. 
Some of the servers can be really nice while other can be really rude and ignore you, but it won't stop me from coming if I'm ever in the neighborhood.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Highlights: 
- Cheap and quick no frills lunch or dinner option.
- Fire cracker roll (deep fried sushi roll) and vegetable udon are my go to items that are safe in my book.
- No wait usually the times that I have visited. 

Improvements: 
- Anything else on the menu I feel is average at most. 
- Don't expect high quality, it is why everything is so cheap. 

Tip: 
- Parking is difficult in this area. Test your luck!
author: Tracy T.

description: Good food for a cheap price. The vegetable udon with spicy broth is my favorite and a very good price. You can eat 10 dollars worth of food and feel full. Sometimes the quality is not there for the fish but vegetarian/vegan food is always good here!
author: Campbell R.

description:
Price & Quality- The prices here are ok and the sushi is average. Where this place really excels in is in their ramen - straight up delicious. Only come for that really.

Service- The staff is really friendly here which is a plus.

Vibe- Kitaro is usually filled with people which is cool since the place accomadates. 

Will I come back? If i'm craving ramen, hell ya!
author: Moises L.

description:
Kitaro...man...CHEAP ASS FALL APART SUSHI. PERIOD.

I got sick here recently. Spicy tuna roll turned out to be a few day old sashimi. Not cool. My "fresh" salmon sashimi ALSO had this fishy flavor to it. WTF MAN?!

Miso Soup? Well ME-WAS-SO-DISAPPOINTED. 

Never coming back here again! UGH..Where's the Pepto..
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Only time I really come here anymore is if, and only if, I have the 15% off coupon. [http://s3-media4.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-kbZGWBipwYqO8UxqiLAeA/l.jpg]

I loved Kitaro, but as my taste buds matured throughout the years, so has my expectations for quality, and Kitaro just doesn't cut it. 

Sub-par and thin Salmon Sashimi: [http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UIakpO0WpTt8rBYSJDAYpQ/l.jpg]

I recall back in my high school days how if you spend more than $20 for a meal, you must've been crazy. That's about a weeks worth of lunch money right there! So, if a bunch of friends were craving for Japanese, (and we all know Japanese is pricy wherever you go), your gonna have to dip into your hard earned allowance money for that. Kitaro, however, was the exception. It was (and still is) very inexpensive and you walk away full, even for a hungry teenager like I was!

Kitaro and I have a ton of history, but in truth, I have outgrown you and now move onto the finer Japanese cuisines and concoctions. I thank you for showing me how delicious Japanese food is at a young age and now, setting my standards ever that much higher. I hope you don't take this review the wrong way and hope you contiune to house the next oncoming era of happy-go-lucky teenagers in discovering a love for Japanese food, like I have.
author: Albert L.

description: The sushi place is delicious and totally worth it for its cheap price! My favorite sushi roll is the firecracker. They only give you a few but it's still really good. The spicy udon is also very much recommended. The restaurant has a very nice interior with a comfortable environment to it. The workers are also kind and efficient.
author: Carolyn H.

description:
FOOD COLORING IN PINK SASHIMI!!!!!
Ordered the lunch special,at my old reliable cheap fast Japanese place. 
Udon in spicy broth was fine.   Pink tuna sashimi over rice was served on the side.
Upon lifting my sashimi, the rice was bright flourescent PINK.
In this day and age where food quality and authenticity is paramount, a cost cutting measure like this steers me away from this place.
Last time the rice turned pink I blamed it on the ginger, this time there was NONE!!!! 
Try squeezing your fish on a white cotton OR paper napkin or cheesecloth and you will see...
author: Dude P.

description: I dined few times at Kitaro before and never had problems with quality of food. This time I ordered takeout and to my disappointment got rice balls instead of sushi. Literally... Rice content of any sushi roll I ordered ( tiger, dynamite and rock n roll) was 90%. Save your money and patronize other place  - quality is appalling at Kitaro
author: Victor B.

description: Update: Its been a little over a year and the restaurant has slowly but surely been going down hill. The quality of the food has dramatically declined. The service is still on and off and it feels like the chef lack of effort shows in the food. Therefore, we will not be coming back.
author: ChrisplusTerri L.

description: Good service, good food and good price.  This is the place I go whenever I want Japanese food.  The quality is consistent, been going to them even before they moved from across the street years ago.  New workers and same good service.  Good management.
author: Red Bean B.

description:
I love Kitaro!! I read some of the other reviews and can imagine there being off-nights and bad service (as if that hasn't happened at every non-fine dining establishment), but luckily nothing like that has happened to me in the past...decade? Not quite sure when my family first started eating at Kitaro and ordering takeout, but it has been a long while. Of course, our family is based about a mile a way so I don't have to take a long trek there (when I'm in San Francisco). I'm not telling you people from Kansas visiting SF to seek out Kitaro (and ask for kid-sized chopsticks?? I would have given a puzzled look at that, too) or to drive all the way from wherever it is that isn't convenient. I get you - driving and parking is a hard thing to do.

I live in LA now and gave some other cheap sushi place a block away from me down there a 2 star rating (maybe they were having an off-night too, but it was really terrible). Yet, every time I come back home to SF, I get some Kitaro. It has never merited such a bad rating from me. My family even felt comfortable enough to eat at Kitaro on Chinese New Year. Yeah, we're lazy and un-Chinese like that!

Now...is Kitaro the most grand sushi place? Of course not. If you're even just the slightest bit of an upper class food connoisseur or sushi lover, this probably isn't your place. But Kitaro is my place.

I'm a real fan of deals and value. So, if we dine-in at Kitaro, I'm not going there for spectacular service and fine dining. I'm going there for the affordable, tasty, non-Japanese food.

I always get the chicken udon - I love the chicken in it. It's only $6.49. We also usually get California rolls. I love their California rolls - they are tasty! We went last night!

And yes, going in line with my love for deals, we always have a coupon for Kitaro. They come in the mail, but if you're not fortunate enough to live in the area - you can sometimes find the coupons on the back of the 7th Avenue Safeway receipts. Hell, we even went to Safeway once to buy something in the hopes of getting a Kitaro coupon on the back. How backwards is that?? Not recommended for non-locals or most people, obviously - just us Kitaro junkies. We have four coupons stockpiled in our drawer right now.

Bottom line, Kitaro is where we go when we don't want to cook and are craving California rolls and/or sashimi. It really is, out of all places, my SF treat.
author: Felicia H.

description: A great variety of Japanese food and sushi! My family has taken their catering sushi matters that are fair priced for picnics and family pot lucks. I've had every bento box their as well as their Udon. I've been going their since i was in grade school with my family! Always a good meal! Favorite appetizers of mine are the seaweed salad and fried tofu.
author: Nicholas G.

description:
Amateur sushi. Their prices definitely reflect the quality of their sushi. 

- sushi rice had no flavor
- avocado in my Alaska roll wasn't ripe...is it too much trouble to ask for an avocado that isn't hard?! and the raw salmon on top didn't taste fresh
- the house sauce on the Godzilla roll completely overpowered the dish and I couldn't taste the tuna inside 
- sushi came out really fast, like suspiciously fast, which makes me think they don't spend too much time preparing it 
- server didn't check on us once during the entire meal 
- on a positive note, I did enjoy the vegetable tempura 

My friends chose this place over Little Tokyo (still my favorite sushi place), which is a couple doors down, as the prices are a bit more expensive than Kitaro, but the quality is way better. Also, the sushi at Kitaro doesn't come with Miso soup and a salad and Little Toyko includes it. 

Who cares if the prices are cheaper if the food isn't that good? I mean don't get me wrong, the sushi wasn't bad, but nothing here made me want to come back.
author: Deanna Y.

description: Completely disappointed, they serve  California rolls that are not made out of crab salad. The salmons are too cooked and the the quality of sashimi it very bad.
author: Elaine P.

description:
Good , cheap food. I especially love their combination boxes which are so filling.  Chicken karrage and vegetable tempura is a good combo!  

-1 Star for their service.  Don't expect them to go out of their way and check up on you.    You have to flag them down.  

Despite this, they have some good food in a good location.  Good luck finding parking.
author: Victor L.

description:
I've been coming to Kitaro since 6th grade. That was 10 years ago. For a restaurant to survive in San Francisco for more than a decade, that says something! Considering all the new trendy Asian fusion restaurants popping up, Kitaro still delivers yummy inexpensive sushi and Japanese food. 

I remember in 8th grade for weekend lunches or dinners with my middle school friends. I would order their chicken teriyaki cause I loved it. hahaha. And their Alaskan roll. 

Nowadays I will come here occasionally for  their Alaskan roll. It's still soo worth it. For like $5 I get 6 pieces of sushi stuffed with salmon and imitation crab and avocado. Mm. Their rice is also soft and proportioned nicely. A nice rice to fish ratio :) 

PS. I think they have a sister restaurant Kiki, on 9th and Irving in the sunset district. Which I also like.
author: Kayla O.

description: Love the sushi here.  Fast service as well.
author: Erica S.

description: This place have really gone down a lot in the past year or so. Definitely do take out and not sit down. Last time I sat down there were fruit flies everywhere around me and I had to wait 25 mins to get my check. The sushi isn't absolutely horrible but don't expect it to be a place that you are raving about after you leave.
author: K M.

description:
Kitaro is a great place for budget sushi that's still appetizing. Expect to pay much less than what you would at an average sushi restaurant. However, you get what you pay for and nothing more. Kitaro gives you the sushi you want without the extra frills you would get at pricier places. I stick to more basic rolls here as some of their fancier rolls such as the Dragon rolls or Tiger rolls are a bit pricier than their quality would justify them to be. 

Should be noted that service is great and wait is never too long even during dinner.
author: Kennie D.

description: Simple, affordable,  killer lunch Ben to box, steak teriyaki is cooked med rare, salmon is oily goodness.  Miso puts a smile on your face with the cold weather and there's rarely a line
author: Kai W.

description:
Nice, respectful and efficient staff. Fast service. Kids friendly
Good Agedashi tofu, generous plates of sashimi, delicious grilled squid.
author: Marielle C.

description: As good as (cheap sushi) gets. Nice people and a decor for small people. You'll know what I'm talking about when you visit. Don't forget to order the Godzilla!
author: Robert P.

description:
Super inexpensive sushi. Most rolls are less than $5 and at most like $9. Its good if you're on a budget and are craving sushi. The kamikaze and godzilla were pretty good and can definitely get you full. They also have teriyaki plates for about $6-$8 I believe, which is a steal! 

The place is nice and clean. Service is also very quick!
author: Jaclyn N.

description:
If you're on the go and have a craving for Japanese food without worrying if it's good or expensive, then this the place to come. This place has your typical combination meals, sushi, and custom rolls without special attention to detail and tastes. 

I had the sushi combination plate for $10 which was a great deal. It came with 8 variety pieces of fish along with a California roll and a salad. Appetizers were mediocre, but how can you ever go wrong with fried foods?

Service and delivery were slow. All my friends' combo platters came out 10-15 minutes well before I received my sushi plate. On the flip side, our server was way too hurried. He kept pestering us if we were ready to order even after a minute has passed by!

Price is good considering what you're paying for. The coupon that you can get in the mailer sometimes sweetens the deal. Come here if you're not looking for something fancy and you don't want to spend too much on your meal.
author: Christopher N.

description:
the usual pick of rolls at super cheap prices. Nothing stellar but satisfies the craving.

tons of options, but the rolls are small. 2 rolls here = 1 typical roll
however, the price for both rolls here, still less than most places
author: Larisa V.

description: My over-excited roommate came home from work today waving a coupon flyer for a big tray of sushi. After 2 hours fighting on who would drive all the way out to the Richmond, we phoned in our order, hopped into my car and began our journey to Kitaro Japanese Restaurant. We used our coupon to get the "Party Sushi Tray" and the "Deluxe Tray" and we definitely get our money's worth. The picture shows it all. You get a lot of sushi. The sushi tasted ok and very affordable. The Deluxe tray came with chicken karage, potstickers, edamame and shrimp tempura. It was a little cold by the time we got the food back to the apartment. The condensation from the to go packaging made the tempura a little soggy. The gave us a medium size cup generously filled with soy sauce to go with our sushi. The deluxe tray came with three different types of dipping sauces. I asked my roomie where he got the coupon and he told me it was from of the Valuepac coupons you get in the mail. You gotta order the food To Go when you use the coupon. It was amazing how they had all this food ready in 20 minutes. Sort of like a fast food version of Japanese food.
author: Jordan C.

description: Quick service. Not very social people but awesome food and it's so quickly served! Love it
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Cheap sushi? Yes please!

I came here last night to get dinner because my boyfriend and I didn't know where else to eat. He ordered the bento box with beef teriyaki and chicken karaage. He  didn't really like the chicken karaage. I thought it tasted decent but not fresh enough. I ordered the hot dog roll and godzilla roll. The last time I ate the godzilla roll, it was yummy, but this time.. I didn't like it. Or maybe because the fish wasn't fresh? Who knows. But the hot dog was yummy, fried stuff on the outside and inside was basically like a california roll if I remember correctly.

The total came to be around 24$, and overall, decent for the price. I would come here again for someone who is on a budget.
author: Julian Y.

description:
When I ate here, I thought to myself the tea pot, tea cups, menus, and plates look exactly like those at Kiki's in the Inner Sunset. And according to other reviewers, Kitaro and Kiki are "sister restaurants", so no wonder there is so much similarity between the two!

For about $10, their sushi combo comes with six pieces of nigiri, a California roll, miso soup, and salad. The nigiri did not taste fresh, and they were kind of warm, too. Ugh. I could barely taste the difference between some of them. I could only really taste the unagi nigiri because it was already pre-seasoned with sauce. The California roll was tiny and made with imitation crab! But, I guess you get what you pay for here at Kitaro. However, I did like how their salad dressing wasn't watery. One perk to this place is that the service is fast!

Kitaro has decent, though cheap, quality food that will fill you. If you're on a budget and don't really care for high-quality fish, Kitaro is an affordable option. Maybe I came on an off-day for nigiri, but if I come back, I'd avoid their sushi and opt for their bento boxes instead.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
They still need to improve on their options during lunch time. I mean their beef teriyaki lunch box i guess you can say is adequate. But the tempura roll is a joke to have on the list...its really more of a tourist trap than anything else..or if your just in the area and desperate for asian-ish food

Knowing that this place hasn't changed since it opened....id rather go back to Tomo's near Century 20 daly city...even just the ambience there is more welcoming and modern than this little Sh*thole...
author: Eric C.

description:
The atmosphere and restaurant does not have friendly service or a pleasant vibe and food has definetly gone downhill from years past.

The place use to have a line out the door with great food and now it's half empty.

We ordered the rainbow roll and sushi was skimpy and fish NOT fresh.  The tempura was greasy as the oil was old.  Definitely, not worth trying or going back as with their low quality food and unwelcoming service was a disappointment compared to their past.

I hope they take this review as a means to improve to their glory days or become a thing of the past.
author: Rocky S.

description: I enjoy the food and its definitely cheaper than the Japanese restaurants at Japantown which is a plus for if I'm craving Japanese food close by to where I live. The food is decent and the servers are nice. However, its not a place where you would come out of the way for.
author: Samantha Y.

description: Golden Tray ... Mixed Tray... Happy Tray... all delicious! I guess I never really dined in. Love the quality of the sushi with reasonable pricing!
author: Lisa R.

description: More of a 3.5 stars. I would come here if I wanted a quick meal but the food is just mediocre. They have a very limited selection of sushi rolls. I usually get the chicken teriyaki, chicken karaage(but it's a hit or miss sometimes kinda dry)Alaska roll, 49er roll, and kamikaze roll. The place might not be the best but it does the job. Good for take out as well.
author: Sherry H.

description:
I've had quite a few dinners at Kitaro since I moved to the Richmond district. It's also walking distance from home for me. Every dinner I've had, I've enjoyed. Good value sushi place. Love the Godzilla rolls and the Firecrackers. 

Is it worth making a special trip if you're not in the neighborhood? Maybe not, but if you are, it's a nice place. Friendly staff, too! And fast service.
author: Celeste H.

description:
3.5 stars

Strange how I have been here more than 15 times and never wrote a review for it. Where have I been? Well, some of the highlights of this place include the chicken katsu bento box, the strawberry smiles and the cheap prices. The udon is a mess with hardly any meat and their so called rib eye beef in the udon does not taste anything like it. It is a chewy mess of flesh and the Philly roll is just nasty. Service is attentive though and I dig the strawberry smiles but when I found out where I can get a whole box of them, I found out Kitaro was overcharging us for the little strawberry delights. It's a great place for bento boxes and groups but not for udon and the Philly roll. Also, parking is the worst in this area. Park far and walk, you will need it.
author: Danster L.

description:
The prices are pretty cheap, but appropriate considering the quality of the fish you get. I've given this place a few chances and now I'm done. 

I like sushi, and I like bargain restaurants.  But if there's one thing that's a *must* when eating sushi, it is fresh fish. The sushi I've had here tasted anything but fresh, and if sushi isn't fresh then what's the point?

Ever had that experience of eating sushi that you know isn't the best quality, but the prices are good so you keep eating..... and then you take a bite of something and it feels/tastes questionable, which then makes you question your judgment? Yeah, that just about sums up my experience here.

I would go back, but NOT for the sushi.
author: A A.

description:
I had dinner with few friends at the restaurant on October 24,2015. We ordered udon and combo dinner. At the end my elderly friend gave me her salad. I only ate 4 pieces of the lettuce. I had stomach cramp after I went home and diarrhea all night. My other friends didn't have the salad, they were fine. Thank goodness my friend  didn't eat the salad otherwise she would have end up in the emergency room.  I left a message to the owner, she never return my call.

Food used to be very good when it was owned by the former owner.
I will not recommend anyone to dine at your restaurant.
author: Ellen Y.

description:
came here a lot with my mom when I was younger.  decent japanese food with coupons.

mom usually gets tempura udon and pink dragon roll.  cooked warm salmon on top of california roll.  filling and tasty.  salmon is moist and creamy from the mayo sauce on top.  
they have a lot of different creative rolls like spider rolls, chicken karaage roll, godzilla roll, etc.

decent sushi/rolls in the neighborhood.
author: Linda T.

description:
Being back in the city and in the Richmond district we were going up and down Geary to find anything to each. We saw Kitaro, peeped the menu posted on the window and decided to try it out.

Their menu ranges with a variety of sushi rolls, appetizers, bento boxes, udon, and donburi. Their prices are what got us to go in. Working with budge and seeing what was on their menu fit with us.

The prices on the bento boxes vary for lunch and dinner. I had their Salmon teriyako bento box which was served with rice and salad. For less than $5, you know most places can be hit or miss for that price. I'd have to say it was very delicious and their portions were a decent size. Others that I was dining with had the Tonkatsu and vegetable Udon. Both were in good poritions and we all share meals. The tonkastu was great and wasn't super greasy. 

The service was pretty good and the place got packed while we were there. It isn't that big but there are a good amount of tables. Good place and I would come back if I were back in the area.

All parking is street parking since it's off of Geary.
author: Steph S.

description: Good service, cheap but good food, Kitaro never disappoints!
author: Ashley H.

description: Loooove this place, yummy food, I always order garlic edamame, firecracker and salmon teriyaki and the best is that is super inexpensive ! Love Jeff, always friendly!
author: Karina A.

description: Fast fresh delicious and affordable. No frills but no overpriced sushi either. I have been coming here for over 10 years and love the food.
author: Christopher E.

description:
Another one of my Favorite Restaurants!

-California Rolls are good! 
-Udon and Tempura is OFF THE HEEZY
-Chicken Teriyaki is decent
-Kitaro Roll IS HELLA GOOD!!
-PINK DRAGON ROLL IS BOMB!

Place is good, hit it up.
author: Kevin K.

description:
I haven't been to Kitaro in a while. The other day, in the neighborhood, decided to stop by for lunch. OMG! What a horrific experience! Service was not the problem. The issue was the food. Usually their rolls have been decent - not great, but a half notch above super market sushi. This time, the nigiri that we ordered looked decidedly DEAD. LIMP. FLOPPY. Is this fish fresh? The rolls fell apart and were tasteless.

Long story short, we left praying that we would not get food poisoning. Of course, if we had been smarter, we wouldn't have eaten the dubious looking fish in the first place. But well, we ain't that bright.
author: Tim M.

description: Horrible. Soggy nori, flavorless and oily tempura. With so many good sushi options on Geary, I'm not sure why I chose to go here!
author: Anne B.

description:
Yesterday I had lunch at Kitaro which is a regular stop for me when I want my Omega3! Dependable quality sushi at a fair price! This time however, a special treat! A new waitress named Justina was amazingly attentive, made sure my order was right and once I started noticing, I could tell she was on top of all the tables in her section.

Kitaro has kicked it up a notch! I particularly recommend the 49'er roll!

Thank you Justina!
author: Jason K.

description: 1 star for decent service and speedy food prep, another price for decent prices on Japanese food in the Richmond, and a final star for mediocre sushi. The serving sizes are pretty small, and some of the rolls come cooked (e.g. the pink salmon roll). It's just very lackluster food. You can do much better at the sushi boat restaurant next door. They did help put up a 16-person group on Friday night for dinner, so I'm pretty grateful for that.
author: Danny C.

description:
This place was my roommate's favorite restaurant since it was so close to our house, inexpensive and the food was descent. What is more to ask coming from a hungry, tight-budget college student. 

My girlfriend and I have eaten here a few times after being dragged by our roommate and going due to their convenient location. 

Every time I go to this restaurant, I get the dinner combo either the Tonkatsu, salmon, chicken teriyaki. All of the dishes are descent, none of them stands out. The quality of the food is all seemed like microwaved and not made to order. You get what you pay for!
The Godzilla roll is pretty good, that is the only roll ive tried. But I wouldn't recommend any  of their sashimi since one time L got salmon and it was dreadful. 

Overall its just a place if you live near the middle of the richmond and are too lazy to cook, i would recommend this place. But I would not come out of your way to eat at this restaurant.

H&L
author: H N L.

description: Bad service, very rood. In addition the food was bad, the rice tasted dry as if old. The sashimi was cut very small and thin, it tasted ok but overall a bad experience.
author: Ester B.

description: Yum! Search and find. Busy but didn't have to wait. Sushi was served quickly but delicious. Parking in the Richmond is always a challenge but easy access for public trans on Geary it just search around for a spot.
author: Debey G.

description: Food was alright. This rating goes to the other waitress with the ponytail who was very rude. Sorry for not knowing salmon sashimi donburi came with sushi rice instead of regular rice when every other restaurant I ever been to that served me donburi gave me regular rice. She should have let me know instead of assuming I would know when the order came. She should not have given me a tough time and lecture me and accuse I was in the wrong. I hope you understand now why there is no tip left for you. Our actual waitress was very friendly. She had a boyish very short hair and glasses. I am glad she was our waitress.  I would go back again if I am served by that boyish waitress. I just hope that ponytail waitress gets her act together after this review.
author: Jeanine H.

description:
I went to here in lunch time today
When saw my shrimp tempura, I was shocked.
Tempura is not crunch at all. Also way of breaded and deep fried is totally wrong.. color should be light yellow and crunch.

Wrost tempura ever.

Service was okay
author: David K.

description:
Udon done it man!! 

You've turned me into ugh Udon Noodle Soup slurping MoFo Fo Sho!! 

This place has some very good Udon soup and if you can eat it without slurping I'll buy your soup! Just kidding I'm broke which is why I'm here looking for a good deal but you've got to try their Very Spicy Chicken or the Very Spicy Curry Chicken Udon soup its Da Best.

On a cold rainy day it soothes your soul!!

On a foggy grey day it brightens your being!!

On a slow sickly Monday it b*slaps da sniffles!!

On a hueva hungover holiday....Ok I'll stop...you get the picture.

However if you dare go for the sushi you best think twice, take a look at the price, cuz its a roll of the dice and fishy bites, not so nice.

Peace.
author: R J.

description: First thought, "Damn this sushi is cheap." Price is what attracted me, I wanted to see how the quality was. I would say quality was exactly what I expected for the price. I ordered the salmon sashimi appetizer and received a good-sized portion, as well as the 49er roll which had about 5 large pieces that took two bites each. Sashimi was decent but definitely not as fresh as higher end sushi places, and 49er roll was simple but did its job for my sushi fix. Restaurant is clean and medium busy inside, you will get a seat though (I went on a Thursday evening around 6pm). My friend got a bento box with shrimp/veggie tempura and beef teriyaki. Both were decent, nothing spectacular, nothing horrible. As I was leaving I remember thinking "solid 3 star place," mostly because the price was fair for the quality. Come for your sushi fix and decent portions, but don't expect excellent quality sushi.
author: Stephanie T.

description: It's maybe not the best sushi restaurant in San Francisco but very tasty and great prices. My son has to eat their every week. Our favorite sushi is the dynamite.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Cheap, fast, consistent, no BS sushi spot. 

This is a go-to for lunch during the work week.  My coworkers get the teriyaki lunches (chicken/beef/fish) for $7 and the portion is HUGE.  Think of the bento box and that its roughly 3 dishes across and 2 dishes down.  The teriyaki protein covers 3 dishes left to right.  Its insane. 

The sashimi sampler is $11 and it has about 4-5 pieces of 4 different types of fish.  Its satiates me when I'm craving sashimi. Its comes with salad, rice, and miso.  I like to get it with all salad.  I don't know what it is about the simple salad dressing and the ice cold iceberg that you get from Japanese restaurants.  Its really a no-frills salad but I'm a sucker for it.
author: Deanna A.

description:
We came here around 5 thinking it would be dinner, but it was still lunch; strange. The lunch menu, to me, didn't have much of a selection to choose from. But we ended up getting udon, a lunch special and the pink dragon roll. We wait a good 5-10 minutes for our food. 

My first impression on the pink dragon was "the salmon is cooked??" I guess I should've read the description more than looking at the picture.. but I decided to just eat it because it was still sushi to me. I knew the salmon was cooked, but I didn't think it would be over cooked. Not only that but the rice was pretty hard; it wasn't even a bit chewy. So I sent it back because of it being over-cooked and because of the hard rice, and one of the waitresses came back and said that the pink dragon is suppose to be like that. Even though she was upset with me, she decided I can choose something else from the menu. I decided to just get the Alaska Roll. Something simple, I guess.

In the end, I wasn't too pleased but our first waitress was super kind and the other dishes we got were just okay. If I were to go back.. hopefully for dinner and not lunch, I'd get something else than the pink dragon.
author: Sylvia b.

description:
I've been here several times before, but revisited this place last night after a year or so. Not bad, not bad. The food here is average, but what you really have to like about this place is that it's super cheap. C'mon...specialty rolls around the $5 price range?....I'm sold.

The food is decent. I ordered the spicy miso udon, which is basically a big bowl of miso soup (minus the seaweed), add spiciness, udon noodles, tempera fried onion pieces, ans chicken karaage. I liked it. The udon noodles were not over done or anything...had a nice texture. We also had the godzilla, alaskan, 49er, and dynamite rolls, and also two orders of the the yellow tail nigiri, and an order a piece of the shiitake mushroom and pumpkin sushi. All were decent. The hamachi was in good shape....no fish smell or taste to it. There was also a bento box order on the table that looked like a good portion.

I think if you just don't expect much when coming here, consider the cheap prices, and not care that a sushi bar, complete with chef, is missing from the front of the restaurant, then this place will work for you.

Paolo says: Bargain Japanese food?!? Kanpai!!
author: Paolo V.

description:
This is one of my many neighborhood go-to sushi spots. the price and qauilty do go hand in hand. Don't expect the best sushi of your life, but it can be worse. Cheap, quick, descent sushi that doesnt burn a hole in your pocket. They do togo so thats always a plus. Their service is pretty quick too. Maybe not so much on water refills though. 

If you're looking for something quick and easy, check out Kitaro
author: Ashley P.

description:
Affordable sushi. 

Of course, the quality cant be compared with the best sushi spots but its still a place that I would visit. In fact, I come here at least once every two weeks. The combination dinner is the best deal. I usually get the sashimi with another entree such as chicken katsu or vegetable tempura. You get a crazy amount of sashimi for just $7.99!
author: Julie H.

description:
Lingering questions.

1. How could my pumpkin roll and Suzuki special (striped bass with ponzu sauce) together be less than $6?

2. Did my upset stomach a few hours later have anything to do with the quality of their source?

Usually I'm adding stars for great deals. Not this time.

Don't want to dismiss the quick and attentive service. And I did enjoy the meal. Just left me with to many unanswered questions.
author: Jason B.

description: Theres way too much rice in the sushi they make but if you order the sashimi then everything is good. I came here for Mother's day because there was no line compared to all the other sushi places. We got 16 items for 7 people. I think the portions are small but the price is cheap so I think you get what you pay for. So I think this is a place to go if you dont really care about the quality of sushi and dont mind the rice. Well not be my regular but I don't mind coming back.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Affordable Japanese food.. Come here for their lunch set, it's definitely worth every penny!
author: Rachel H.

description:
What's so spectacular about this little Japanese restaurant in the Outer Richmond? Why 5 stars? Because simplicity has its charms and there is definitely something to be said about consistent good quality. 

Kitaro offers a wide range of vegetarian sushi - the more trendy and upscale sushi places in the city have a one-page Ramsay-approve menu, but Kitaro does a whole 12x16 menu page of single-ingredient rolls, which feature usual veggies like avocado and cucumber rolls, and special treats like the pumpkin roll. Most cost under $3 and all cost under $4.50. 

I appreciate little things about Kitaro. Like how they don't assume I want my edamame cloaked in giant crystals of rock salt, but they offer salt and even a made-to-order garlic edamame. Be sure to try the potato croquettes - they're made to order and will be served piping hot, with just the right amount of breading and seasoning. The ice cream is a good quantity (and price), I even love the random storage-area (?) decor perched above the tables that looks like its barely tall enough to accommodate magical sushi elves. 

Kitaro's no-fuss food is perfect for a quick meal and it's very comforting and trustworthy. Just like from my mother's kitchen. I know exactly what I'm going to get and I get the same consistency every time. Yes, the server barely talks and very rarely smiles, but she is alert for when the glass of water needs a refill. The person taking your order over the phone may hang up before they say goodbye and won't thank you for calling but you're not calling to make small talk and don't worry, they won't screw up your order. Like, ever. I work with a buddy who lives around the corner from here and we usually get a lunch to-go from here for under $10. I've eaten there probably at least 50 times in the last 6 months and they have yet to do so much as to give us a quantity of wasabi that varies between orders. 

There's no awkward screaming of Japanese greetings as you come in through the door. I can almost guarantee the first thing someone (in a green shirt) will say to you as you walk in is try to guess the number of people in your party with a small, curious smile. Two? Three? 

Maybe that is what I love about Kitaro. The comfort of consistency. I'm sure I'll be back soon enough.
author: Meg P.

description: I thoroughly enjoy eating Japanese food. This is especially true when it's dirt cheap! Now this isn't anything fancy. But if you're in the mood for some chicken teriyaki and a few rolls, this place gets the job done. I've had the chicken katsu dinner and the portion is huge! I also order some of their sushi rolls which aren't bad either for under $5. If you're feeling like a cheapo, this spot is for you.
author: Leanne E.

description:
Solid food for a good price. You could easily spend $5-$8 for a meal, which is pretty good in my book. They also let us sit and talk for 2 hours while refilling our water, so they get an extra star. 

They honored our 15% off coupon. They are honorable.

My tummy gives Kitaro Japanese Restaurant...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: Definitely try the firecrackers and the chicken karaage! My family and I come here often and that says a lot considering I'm the only in the family who likes Japanese food. I usually order about 4 sushi rolls for myself while my family indulges in the likings of bento boxes and udon. Their sushi is cheap and delicious, and if you sign up for their mailing list, they send you coupons every month for 15% off your next meal.
author: Cristina L.

description: Five stars for good service and cheap food. Quality of the sushi is not the highest but doesn't mean it tastes bad. Portions are good sized and it is a good value for the money. Chirashi sushi plate is not real pretty presentation wise but for the value for the money you can't beat Kitaro
author: Ken L.

description: To me, this place is the pioneer of the sushi rolls in SF :)  Kinda fresh not ever getting sick here.  So fars so good.  Sometimes stuffs may be over sauced but that's it.  Gonna update after I try this place again.
author: Juila L.

description:
Cheap and fast for lunch, but they earn an OUO designation for Order Udon Only. 

Chicken karaage was huge, tough chucks of grease. CA rolls with artificial crab and no obvious way to order up the real stuff...never worth it. The tuna sashimi was also not very good.  

Yet I am one of the few lower reviewers here thinking the service was just fine. What was awful is any food other than udon. If they changed their name to Kitaro Udon House they might earn 3 or 4 stars.
author: Luke M.

description: A good, cheap spot with a large menu, solid sushi and bento boxes that are very generous . However, the service can be either extremely pushy or borderline unattentive. We keep coming back as it is just too good of a value to pass up, but the service needs some consistentcy to get more than 3 stars.
author: Jared C.

description: Came for my friends birthday party lunch. Got their lunch special (comes with teriyaki chicken, salad, rice, and California rolls) and I also added miso soup and the 49er roll. The price here is pretty good ranging around $5-$10 for a meal which is not bad.  Sushi rolls was good and not bad for what you pay for. Would recommend Kitaro to others if your on a budget.
author: Peter C.

description:
I'll admit, it's not the best japanese restaurant in the City, but, for the price, it's our go-to sushi place.  Also, as locals, we almost always use the 15% off coupon that is printed on the back of all of our Safeway receipts.
The menu has a good variety of specialty rolls and traditional japanese fare.  And the wait staff is always friendly. All the food is made in the back kitchen so you just have to trust that the sushi and rolls are being made fresh.  I haven't had any issues with the food not being up to par.
I do have a little issue with the masks on the wall though.  Not all of them.  Just the red one with the questionably shaped nose.
author: Joel F.

description: I always order Chirashi or Sashimi so I have a good feel for fish quality. And Kitaro is... average. But at these prices? These big portions? Best value sushi in town.
author: Dante J.

description: Best sushi joint in the Richmond. Their firecracker roll is the best on the menu I order it every time I go.
author: Maritza C.

description:
If cheap is what you want, come here and that's all you'll get. 

Chicken Karage - probably the best tasting of the bunch, which doesn't say much for anything else

Pink Dragon Roll and Tiger Roll were just decent

Hot Dog Roll which is a fried CA roll. Why they decided to name the roll hot dog is beyond me. 

Chicken katsu donburi - lacked flavor or taste in the rice

Chicken Katsu Curry Udon - pretty inedible besides the chicken katsu

So if all you're looking for  is cheap, go here. If not, dont!
____
MAY '11 Health Score - 93
Parking is a bitch
author: Dennis L.

description:
I know it's Chinese-owned and the sushi rolls/sashimi aren't the best out there, but for the prices, you really have to dumb down your expectations for a 5-star meal and just be content with the decency of the food. Because let's face it, most of us can't be having $$$$ meals every day!

Their chicken katsu and karaage are the best, and for what's supposed to be a 7-slice sashimi order with your bento box, I've always gotten double the amount for the same price. I don't think the slices are cut any slimmer than other sushi joints but as long as my mouth and belly are happy, you'll hear no complaints from me! Fave roll would have to be the Dynamite roll (but really, it's mediocre at best). 

Parking can be a big hassle here so we usually try to eat earlier to beat the usual lunch/dinner rush.
author: Liana L.

description: I really like this place for takeout. I work down the street at aziza and we all eat from Kitaro occasionally. I ate there twice in one week because I love sushi and this is good sushi. I will update when I've dined in the actual restaurant.
author: Alexandra R.

description: I've been coming here for nearly 10 years and I've gotten the same thing nearly every time: bento box with chicken karaage and a California roll. This also comes with miso soup, rice, and a salad. Simple and really good. I'll occasionally switch it up with chicken udon or get edamame and other sushi to share with friends. The food is cheap and delicious. Comfortable environment. This is definitely one of my regular spots when I'm in SF.
author: Vika M.

description:
Ok people, I'm sorry but I have to disagree with some of you on this place.

I'm a San Francisco native, a food snob born and bred, daughter of a gourmet cook AND I'm Japanese.  I normally don't throw out my total gangsta street cred like this, but I feel like I know a little of what I speak here... and those two star people are just wrong.

This place is an absolute budget friendly GEM.  The true test of any sushi place is NOT the California Roll people - or the freakin teriyaki dinner combo plate!  Seriously are these the same people who think Tom Cruise made a kick ass samurai?  Hakujin...  you're not allowed to say a place has generic Japanese food if all you're ordering is a California roll and teriyaki chicken.  Your ORDER is generic!  Why do I feel the need to smack myself on the forehead for having to point that out?!  These people have the same logical sense as Fox News and it makes me want to punch them in the junk.  Don't make me get all Judo on you... my boyfriend's been teachin me some moves.

The way to judge a sushi restaurant is the fish.  Order hamachi, order maguro, order uni and sake and unagi and then try to tell me this restaurant isn't amazing.  In fact, let the chef decide and order the chirashi.  For you un-initiated, that means they'll give you an assortment of what they feel is freshest and tastiest served over a bed of sushi rice... and it's less expensive than ordering the sushi.  Let's call it a Japanese restaurant's way of rewarding you for knowing what the F you're doing, trusting the chef and having a set of kogan.

Damn sometimes you people drive me nuts!

In summary, Kitaro kicks ass and Tom Cruise is not a samurai.  You're welcome.
author: Mariko H.

description: Kitaro has been a go two for good being cheap sushi. I was disappointed with the service though when I found on my online checking that they had added more to the tip then I allowed, very disappointing since my tip was over 20% ready. Today I will call to have the error corrected and will update readers in a following review.
author: Gabriella B.

description:
MMMm yum! A very comfortable place for a casual Japanese dinner- perfect ambiance: not too loud or crowded but still a lively popular place. Came here on a recommendation of a coworker and I was very happy with Kitaro. 

The minute we sit down, a waitress asks us what we'd like to drink. The menu featured lots of rolls at pretty awesome prices: $3-$12!! Yay! 

They have a 2-Choice Combo Bento dinner which is great for sharing and comes with lots of sides. Prices are separate and depends on your choices. We got the chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura- whole bento for about $10. The chicken teriyaki was really better-than-average quality: juicy and tender, not dried out. The tempura came with a great variety of veggies: potatoes, broccoli, pumpkin (yums!), etc. 

Also got the spicy tuna roll and the Pink Dragon Roll (baked salmon on a cali roll): the PDR came in 9 thin slices and very delicious. Rice was cooked well and rolls made fresh. 

Overall, had a great experience- affordable, pleasant service, yummy bentos and sushi rolls!! A Yelper can't ask for more! 

Parking is hit or miss, your best chance is around the quieter residential streets perpendicular to Geary.
author: Eva H.

description: Usually get the lunch sets on page 1 but tried new lunch menu A thru D and the teriyaki chicken was junk. Taste boiled.
author: Satoshi K.

description:
I have a strange relationship with Kitaro... I think I have spent more money here, in the past years, than in any other sushi joints, but to this day I just can't bring myself to get excited about Kitaro.

"Woo hoo, we are having Kitaro tonight!".... No, can't even visualize it.

It is more like: "We have not had sushi for a wile, really need to get my sushi fix. The car payment and day care payment are due this week too... and there was a 15% off coupon on the back of Safeway receipt... Awe, shoot, alright, lets do Kitaro this time."

So, this is our non-exciting, inexpensive sushi fix.
author: Katya L.

description:
Pretty good "cheap sushi". Paid around $25 for a very full dinner. 
But you get what you pay for. Everything is mediocre but at least the sushi is fresh and i don't worry about getting sick after i eat it. Also, the Hamachi nigiri is top quality.

Food ranked in order: 

Amazing: 
1. Hamachi nigiri - SO WORTH THE PRICE. each piece was so huge it practically should have been two pieces. Love that it comes with the skin partially on. Very fresh and the best bang for your buck. 
2. Tiger Roll - generous amounts of unagi and avocado over shrimp tempura

Average: 
1. Volcano Roll - breaded and deep fried - guilty pleasure
2. Tuna nigiri - fresh but not as big of a portion as Hamachi nigiri
3.  Philadelphia Roll 

Not so good: Everything else
1. Gyoza was soggy and tasted like something i would unfreeze and make at home
2. Shrimp and Veggie tempura - very few pieces of veggie and very few variety, they didn't even have one sweet potato one! Also, the "melon" (??) pieces were way undercooked. 

Only come here if you want cheap sushi grub that won't make you sick! But go to Kabuto for high quality and tasty sushi.
author: Lily S.

description: My husband brought our eldest child to eat here during the weekday and he raved about the food. I asked my daughter, who loves Japanese cuisine, and she told me that it was good but nothing special about it. Anyway, my husband brought our younger kids and me to eat an early dinner. I was so looking forward to it because my husband and I frequent Kitaro a lot before we had our kids. Note: there are no specials on the weekend. The food was good but nothing special about it. Miso soup was not hot enough. The California roll was so small and not worth the price. I told my husband that I don't want to go back again.
author: Janet W.

description: I come here at least once every week and I live on the other side of the bay bridge. The salmon nigiri is always very fresh, their soft shell crab is crisp, and the Alaska roll is always delicious. Prices are cheaper than any other sushi joint in Sf.
author: Tim S.

description: Went here for a quick dinner with husband. He ordered chicken teriyaki. It came looking like it was steamed, not grilled. It had no color, no grill marks. Looked very unappetizing. Tasted very bland. I ordered shiitake maki. It came with white mushrooms, not real shiitake mushrooms. The rice used for the maki was warm, too. Didn't appreciate the shortcuts with both our items. At least the tempura shrimp tasted good. We won't be back.
author: Ami B.

description: It's cheap and good. What's there to complain about? People are being too uptight with this place.
author: Melisa W.

description:
It's a good place for casual and cheap meals if you don't mind rude service. The interior is nicely decorated and food usually takes about 5-10 minutes after ordering.
 
-Their rolls are decent, could be rolled tighter so it's not falling all over the place while you're eating, but cant expect much for the price.

-Their udon taste like packaged udon that you buy at the supermarket. 

-Their bento box tastes good, and since it comes with miso soup, rice and salad it's pretty filling.

I only come here because the food is okay and the price is reasonable. Other than that I would NOT come just because their service sucks! Out of all the times I've been here I noticed that two of their waiters are biased towards middle aged and Caucasian customers. Just saying.
author: Oriel F.

description:
everything about this place is exactly like that a kiki.

decent food, inexpensive, and convenient.
author: Ken T.

description: I've been coming here since freshman year of high school now I'm a junior (around two years) I used to like this place a lot but now that I've been trying out multiple sushi places kitaro is no longer my top favorite place reasons are the bentos I tried multiple times are just average, the tempura shrimps and veggies always seem to be very oily I feel like I'm eating more oil than an actual shrimp or veggie then the teriyaki chicken is just okay the last time I tied it, it had this weird taste felt like it was under cooked and the bento boxes just seemed old the paint on the bento boxes were clearly chipping off so I had to look carefully at what I'm eating... And the service there was okay they came around asking me every minute if I was ready to order with my friends but we just sat down for probably 2 minutes I felt pressured to hurry and decide (which I shouldn't have but I did) then at the end when we all got our food and ate our food we asked for the check no one came to our services I had to walk over to a waitress tap on someone's shoulder to get their attention and she told me to wait... I just wanted to pay with my card then leave but by then the waiter was gone to the back and seemed to forget what I had asked I had to wait around 15-20 minutes after finishing eating just to pay for my food...... then again I don't want to be so mean to kitaro because I've had better days here but that was honestly my experience lately and I was just devastated by the service and food this time around the only reason I would come back here is for their sushi and cheap prices and if I was hungry and close to this area. Also a tip if you go to Safeway on the back they usually print out 15% off coupon for kitaro so you should defiantly take advantage of that!
author: Teyonnna H.

description:
Where else can you get, literally like 14oz (2 huge pieces) of grilled salmon, steamed rice (nice and firm), iceberg lettuce salad, miso soup, AND a 6-piece grilled salmon skin roll, all for $11.80??

The thick slices of grilled salmon were so tender. And I much enjoyed the salmon skin roll. It was an acceptable size (not tiny), and it contained just the right combination of salmon skin, fatty salmon pieces, and an abundance of green onion. Flavorful, salty, satisfying!

They were super fast with my take-out order (I called at 11:30am, my order was ready by 11:45). I don't know if I am brave enough to try their sashimi, but I am definitely going to make Kitaro a go-to spot for extremely inexpensive & tasty bento lunches + cooked/grilled/veggie rolls.
author: Jessica C.

description: The sushi is pretty good but I got grossed out in the restroom.I went here after I went to Ocean Beach. But their service is OK.
author: Kristy C.

description:
3.5 stars!

I wasn't able to try everything here, but like any sushi place, I sampled a rainbow roll and a baked salmon roll (pink salmon).  My friends ordered chicken katsu, chicken terriyaki, and a sashimi combination with sake bombs.  Rolls are surprisingly cheap (about $6-7 a roll)!  Bento boxes are about $9.  

The service was okay, our waitress sort of disappeared and never really checked on us.  The portions of the bento boxes were huge, the rolls were pretty decent too.  The sashimi combination looked delicious but Lewis said the fish was frozen instead of fresh fish.  For 4 people, our dinner about $64 (or maybe less), which isn't too bad.  

I want to come back here and try some other dishes!  It beats the price of sushi in SoCal!
author: Anne N.

description:
Decent CHEAP sushi. Decent service. Decent location. Decent _______. 

Some friends and I stopped in before a night out in the city for a quick dinner. I got the gozilla roll and the pink dragon for about $15 for both. The rolls were extremely hot when they came out which is a plus when they're supposed to be. The portions were reasonable but not the greatest. Tried some of my friend's fire cracker roll and it was pretty good! Probably should have got that. 

The service wasn't the greatest but they got the job done. The lady didn't really know what the rolls she was giving us were unless we asked about it. Fairly large menu. One of the cheapest sushi experiences I've ever had and the food isn't bad! 

Quick, "get what you pay for" sushi joint.
author: Tammy N.

description:
This is not my favorite to say the least. The sushi is a hit or miss. I have tried several things and the quality is not consistent. 

The service can be very very slow....the staff is nice. 

My friend said it best this place is cheap but not to cheap if your on a budget this is a good place to go.
author: Shawn A.

description:
Within five minutes of being sat, my companion and I were approached five times by I think three different servers asking if we were ready to order yet; I am not exaggerating.  The servers were impersonal and rushed.  After we put in our order, we had to wave down a server whenever we needed anything.

The garlic albacore nigiri was surprisingly good, and the cut was generous. I tried to order garlic albacore sashimi after I tried the nigiri, but they brought out another order of nigiri. So it goes.

There is way more rice in their maki than should ever be allowed, even at less expensive sushi joints.  At certain points throughout my rock-n-roll, I could taste neither eel nor avocado, just a ball of rice with a scant impression of nori inside.

The tempura portions were fairly generous, and the tempura shrimp was a highlight of our meal.
author: Nicole J.

description: Kitaro fixed their problems! Woohoo! I've eaten here 3 times in the last couple months and every time it was delicious, just like the old days!
author: L L.

description: I recently visited Kitaro with my Girlfriend and I can for sure say to stay away. The food was not so good, and the Teriyaki Chicken was undercooked which made my experience worse. Above all that in the end the waitress took forever when trying to process our bill, only to find out a couple days later that the card had been used to purchase online items. I don't typically use credit or debit cards, but the time I chose to, card information was stolen. The way of coming to this conclusion was because of how unreasonably long it took for the waitress to bring back our card. When ever I tried to look for her she was no where to be seen which means that she might have been too busy copying down the card number. I will never come back again, and for people who are thinking about going. If you want your card info to be taken to only realize that online purchases were made then this is the place for you.
author: Brian K.

description:
Our regular Japanese restaurant has closed down.  So we ended up here for lunch.  My son hasn't been in here for near 8 years now.  Myself never.  Well, all in all, it was just okay.

The food was fresh, and they give large portions.  However, it all tasted a bit bland.  The teriyaki and tempura sauces were extremely bland.  The salmon sushi I really do not know if it's good quality.  It just looked like slabs of cut up raw salmon.  

The service was the same as if one dined in a Chinese restaurant.  In fact, it appears that the place is Chinese owned.  Anyway, the waitress was efficient and we got everything we requested and ordered.  Except she had no idea what ponzu sauce was.  The reply was indiscernible too.  So we guessed that they had none... Communication issues I suppose.

Not sure if we will return in a hurry, but it was certainly better than some other Japanese places in the area.
author: Luisa T.

description: Food was good. Though the service wasn't up to par. Ordered the lunch combination sushi with miso soup. Had to ask the waitress 2 times for the miso soup after the food was delivered 10 minutes prior. Wasn't too busy.
author: Steve P.

description: I thought the sushi here was a good value overall but you get what you pay for in terms of service and some quality. We ordered some fried shrimp balls that were advertised on an insert wht a blurry photo in the menu for $3.95. We couldn't tell what it was and the server said "fried shrimp" so we orders it but it was really like a shrimp hush puppy topped with a sauce and some shavings of dried fish. The hush puppy was raw liquidy batter inside and very unappetizing, I was worried it would make us sick. Also we ordered the beef ramen and he beef was kind of tough and grisly but the broth and noodles were good. I did find a hair in my soup but it may have been mine, either way I was grossed out... The rolls we got were all good and fresh tasting. Godzilla, spicy tuna, eel. There are several servers in the restaurant and they each take a turn going to every table and asking you the same questions, rushing you to order, but that's ok because it's cheap and there's a 15% off coupon on the back of your Safeway receipt. I saw another sober using one and dug through my purse for an old receipt- packrat tendencies FTW!
author: Emma H.

description:
I am seriously baffled by this place. I ordered some to go food today at 6. I walk in and the place is PACKED, so I am taking that as a good sign that the food must be pretty good, at least decent. Then I see the menu, kinda low on the choices and the prices are super low so not too sure about it anymore, but decided to give it a try anyway.

I ordered the katsu curry don, kamikaze and alaskan roll. I love udon, I love curry, and I love katsu, but together? Not so good in combination. Or maybe it was they way Kitaro made it. The curry sauce was just dark yellow slop with no taste whatsoever and katsu was not cooked very well. I took a couple bites and dumped it.

The sushi was edible, that's the best I will give it.  And it will have to do for now because I am hungry with nothing else to eat except for that yellow slop I ordered, bleh, no thank you! 

Overall, not a place to go if you want some good sushi...or food in general.

If you just need something...anything to fill your stomach on super low prices, this is your place to be.
author: Pauline T.

description:
Been here dozens of times, for many years. 

The food in general isn't what you called fancy, but definitely a bang for your buck. 

Perfect for lunch-breaks during work, a quick crave of Japanese cuisine in the spare of the moment kind of thing.

I would recommend this place if you didn't come here with an high expectation. 

I love their Beef Teriyaki Lunch boxes, their beef are juicy and favoring.
author: Steven M.

description:
LOVE KITARO! 

Echoing what everyone else says.  I've been coming to Kitaro for a few years now and love it every time.  It's fast, cheap and yummy.  I honestly don't know how the places nearby can compete!  We always manage to get a great parking spot and a table right away!

Why not 5 stars?  Cause there are better (more expensive) sushi spots in SF.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Decent quality, fresh sashimi with large portions and a cheap dinner bill. Really, what else could you ask for? They're also super fast! It's definitely not a five-star sushi restaurant, but it fulfills my sushi cravings, and so far, I have been a happy customer with no complaints.

Parking around dinner time is ridiculous, FYI.  I've been just double parking outside and getting my food to-go.
author: Betty W.

description:
This is by no means the best sushi I've had, however, for the price it's fantastic! The rolls on average are about $5-$7. If you are looking for a quick, decent and less expensive place for sushi this is my recommendation. 

The staff can be a bit rude if you talk too long after your meal. The decor is cute.
author: Preston J.

description:
After coming here for over 4 years, I've realized that the quality of their sushi has gone soooo downhill.

FOOD:
The portions are SMALL AS F****. At one point I ordered a roll (that cost maybe $6) and they gave me 4 pieces of sushi. That was falling apart. Which is surprising to me because it was 80% rice... I mean... how does just sticky rice fall apart? Wtf.

Yes, the sushi is cheap. But what you get in return isn't even WORTH what you paid. I wouldn't even eat it if it was free. So so so disappointing.

SERVICE:
Oh lordy don't get me started. My sister and her friend once came here and they left after paying a tip. A block later, they were being chased down by the worker who GRABBED my sister's friend by the arm and demanded more tip. The worker pounded my friend with questions about the service, and she ended up having to shell out another buck.  
This has happened more than once, so don't be surprised when you are chased after by an employee or manager.

And they charge tea $1/person. I could get that tea for free from Chinatown.

After discovering Little Tokyo 2 stores over, I am never coming back.
author: Karen L.

description:
Delicious sushi at a great price! I've always been pleased by my meals at this place..for the amount paid, I don't think you can get much better than the quality of the sushi delivered here. The menu features a variety of tasty rolls and bowls that will make you crow with satisfaction. I've tried most of the items on this restaurant's "special rolls" menu, and have to say that my favorites are the Godzilla (so good that they have a large glowing sign dangling from the corner?) and Fire Cracker Rolls, simply because they are unlike any I've ever consumed and so very gratifying!

Besides sushi, I've also tried their "Today's Special" of the moment (it's actually a misleading name since it's remained unchanged for many weeks), which consists of spicy chicken katsu udon with the additional option of six California roll pieces for an added $1.50. Although filling, I wouldn't recommend this dish to the flavor sensitive as it comes with a very "instant curry" taste, and isn't anything especially unique. The California Roll is made with a disproportionate attention to rice volume and is also far from the best I've tasted. 

Dripping wet menus, unfriendly waitresses, streaked tables - true, the dining environment isn't wonderful. But come here for inexpensive, taste-bud satisfying Japanese creations, and served food rather than food with service, and you will get exactly what you want.
author: Amy T.

description:
OH HELL NO!!

I came here because they have amaebi for cheap, and I didn't want to go all the way to San Mateo for some sushi. 

The restaurant was half empty, and the waitress wanted to sit me and my bf at a table (that looks like a 4 top) that is literally an inch away from another customer.. Seriously, wtf. We asked to be seated elsewhere. How awkward is that..?

On to the food, amaebi was actually pretty good. Soft, sweet and tender. The fried head wasn't bad either.

Now the sushi on the other hand was crap. They MICROWAVED the sushi..... oh dear god. I forgot which one we had, but you just know when it's microwaved... 

Tea leaves were overused, so the tea tasted like water.

-0 star for waitresses
-3 stars for amaebi
-1 star for food

By the way, the one guy with glasses is the same guy that works at Kiki, just fyi.
author: Sandy T.

description:
My family used to order the sushi party platters back then... when I was in middle or high school?! This place has definitely gone downhill from then and I wish I hadn't step foot here again this past weekend because it didn't satisfy my craving for sushi- it just made it worse and made me grumpy. 

I ordered the lunch sushi special combo (california roll, tempura roll, and  the rock n' roll) and additionally the 49er's roll and pink dragon roll. 

First off, let me say that overall the sushi is so frustrating. The rice is not the nice aromatic plump ones that most places use and all the rolls were all oddly mis-shapened and downright ugly. The flavors were lacking.. all the rolls I had were dull (plain) and not very appetizing, even with soy sauce + wasabi. 

49er's roll (spicy tuna, avocado, crab & tobiko)- it had tuna alright, but the fish did not taste very fresh and absolutely was NOT spicy. I ordered this roll just because it has "spicy tuna" and it turned into a "stinky fish with other ingredients" roll. 

Pink dragon roll (cooked salmon)- it's average, slightly better than the other rolls, but still not appetizing. 

Cheap pricing came with cheap food.. but it was not worth it because it left me so dissatisfied that I would much rather pay more and get real sushi. Some people say it's fine because you're not paying premium pricing but you know what, I'm still paying for food at a restaurant and the food should at least live up to restaurant status, not some mumbo jumbo (question mark) that I can probably make better myself.
author: K. N.

description:
Their menu is really limited. I used to come here all the time when I went to school around this neighborhood. The only item I order from here is the Pink Dragon Roll. Ever since I've tried different Sushi Restaurant, I would say Kitaro sushi sucks. 

This place is great for people who are on a budget. Did I mention? Service suck ass!
author: Annie Y.

description: Rolls here are pretty legit and well priced. Cheaper than most sushi places. Annnnd they have a spam roll. :) I come here often.
author: Jamie B.

description:
For every location you live in you have to have a sushi joint that is your go-to sushi place that is both cheap, filling, and satisfying.  Good thing for Yelp, I've landed the best sushi place for the price within blocks from where I live.

Although I went there mid-week around dinner time there was no wait for a table for two.  We were immediately seated and greeted with menus.  The interior definitely wasn't bad or run down even for the price point of the restaurant.  I love when restaurant has simple menus that still offers you a good variety to chose from.  Some restaurant menus are overkill with a whole bunch of different rolls and what not.

The prices for the food is definitely a big plus.  I personally like the fact that these rolls are more on the simple side compared to other restaurants with over the top rolls that takes away from the delicacy of sushi.  In addition the rolls are obviously smaller to meet the price point which allows you to try more rolls out than you would with big rolls.

The food came out faster than average at a sushi restaurant and pretty much all at the same time.  We ordered 6 rolls all together and are satisfied overall with the quality and amount of sushi for the price paid.  Will definitely come back again when the craving for sushi hits again.

Enjoy.
author: Zhen C.

description: I'll give Kitaro this... consistent food and prices. They aren't the best nor are they the fanciest but if you want good fresh sushi thats been a main stay in the Richmond for over 20 years theres nobody else. They've been there the longest and they have always been good. You cant beat longevity or consistency. They've managed to be the go to sushi place in the outer rich for a long time.
author: Anthony M.

description:
What has happened to Kitaro?!  The last six times I ate sushi there, I got the Urgent Creamy Deuces (UC2's).  I don't believe a person should find it necessary to don an adult diaper, in order to feel secure about driving home from dinner.  But, if you need to cleanse your colon - Kitaro is a great, affordable option for a High Colonic.  It does the trick in no time at all, and at a fraction of the cost.  

I had been a regular customer for many years.  I'll miss it, but I'd rather flush my money down the toilet, in a less excrementitious way.
author: Loretta G.

description:
Good rolls for the price. I mostly get the sushi platters for parties from Kitaro - good value for those. 

Other good rolls: 
Surf roll
Godzilla roll
Ca roll
author: Bessie T.

description:
If it wasn't for SAKANA BUNE being CLOSED for an hour, we would've known better not to go to Kitaro!

Kitaro deserves a one star. Better yet, if yelp allowed zero stars, it would be rated the LOWEST. They have horrible customer service. My friends and I went to eat here for dinner. The restaurant was less than half-fulled and we were seated promptly. 

Our waitress, Angel, did not serve us tea like she did with other people that had walked after us. Everyone else in the restaurant was Caucasian, but us, we were Chinese. Honestly, is she really playing the racist card??? She was very rude and did not attend to our needs with a SMILE. A smile for your customers would not kill your day. We had to keep asking to refill the teapot. Furthermore, we had asked for light soy sauce two times. She mugged at us and grabbed the soy sauce and put it on the table next to us expecting us to get it ourselves when people were sitting there. LIKE HELLO! HOW IS POSSIBLE THAT SHE COULD HAVE GIVEN IT TO THE PEOPLE NEXT TO US? 

After these incidents, we refused to be nice to her. We stopped saying please and thank you because she did not deserve it if she can't pull her act together. As a waitress, she should have been well trained and learned the simplicity of having DECENT customer service without inflicting her own personal problems into the work atmosphere. She needs a reality check.

As for the food, it was decent. It was proportional and fulfilling, I guess. But the fact that the customer service was horrible, it made the whole experience here BAD. I would not recommend eating at Kitaro because HORRIBLE customer service = unenjoyable experience.
author: Jessica T.

description: Just good affordable sushi. I ordered 9 party platters for a work party. Everyone loved it and ate all of it. I was initially worried because the sushi was maybe too affordable and other reviews said that the sushi was small, but this was money well spent.
author: C S.

description: This place is the furthest thing from authentic.  For the number of Japanese restaurants near by, definitely try the other ones.  Our food was sub-par at best.
author: Edgar C.

description:
I've been going to this place since I was in high school. It's great for cheap sushi but I've grown up a little since then. 

The food is decent, service is ok, the prices are cheap (especially if you have their 15% coupons printed on the back of safeway receipts). The biggest issue I have over the years is that they changed their "crab" to those imitation crab sticks. They aren't going out of business... why do that?! All their rolls that have crab have those crab sticks. Yuck. So now when I come here, I either get the bento box combo or avoid all the rolls with their "crab". I have always loved their kaki fry though, yum! 

Also, have you noticed there's a weird smell when you walk in?

I still frequent here every once in awhile, but it's definitely no longer a go-to spot for Japanese.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I've been coming to Kitaro with my family for the last 10 years. I've never had an issue with the food itself, but tonight the service was so egregious that we honestly won't be returning.

Our party of 6 waited the usual amount of time for our table, and while the restaurant was full, there were at least a 9 or 10 servers making their way across the floor. Strike 1 came when the waiter took our drink orders. Only 1 soda and 1 iced tea, the rest of us wanted water. The soft drinks and 2 cups of water came out, but we were left with broken promises and dry mouths instead of the other 2 waters.

Our table ordered our meals. I ordered assorted nigiri, and the rest of the table ordered dinner combinations and various cut specialty rolls. The waiter repeated back all of our orders to make sure he got it right.

We still haven't received the other cups of water.

Food starts to come out, albeit slowly. Still no sign of water. We ask several passing waiters, who all respond with "ok" and "no problem", but still no water. The drinks that had been brought out are now empty, but no refills are offered.

Everyone's food is out, except for my nigiri. We are finally given our cups of water, around 30 minutes after we sat down. My family starts eating, expecting my plate to come out any minute.

15 minutes have passed, and my family's plates are now half empty. Anxiously, I ask a server if my order is coming out. She grabs the ticket for our table, but my order isn't on it. We go over what I wanted again, salmon, yellowtail, albacore, suzuki. No apology for forgetting the order, but she takes the ticket back to the kitchen. I figure, ok, the order didn't go in, they'll make it fast now that they know I'm waiting.

15 more minutes go by. My family is finishing their plates and I still don't have food.
I call yet another server over, she then calls another server (now 4 people have been involved in this order) and they say it's almost ready. Again, no apology. We're almost laughing at how absurd this ordeal is, but I'm also pretty hungry now.

My food is finally brought out - well, 90% is, the suzuki from the "daily menu special" is brought out 5 or 10 minutes later.

I quickly eat my food so we don't have to sit around much longer. Meanwhile, my father calls a server over and asks if there's a manager he can speak with. The single word answer, "no".
