The check was brought to the table with no acknowledgment that the order was forgotten, brought out 30 minutes late, and took 4 people to get correct. No tip was left and we will not be coming back. I'm normally pretty forgiving of service, but when they can't muster a simple apology, or let us speak with someone in charge (someone has to be in charge, right?) there's really no excuse.
author: John R.

description:
I think Kitaro is a solid 3.5 stars, but they do offer coupons (and I'm a student), so I am going to round up to a 4 for this review.

After craving sushi for the longest time, I asked my friend, a native SF resident, where he goes for sushi.  He recommended Kitaro Japanese restaurant, and so that night, we (along with 6 other friends) went to grab dinner.  It was a Wednesday evening about 7:30 p.m. and the restaurant was maybe half-full.  We were seated and given water and tea promptly.  

If you haven't looked at the menu (or read other reviews) yet, Kitaro is not your typical Japanese restaurant, or at least, not what I am used to.  They have a lot of variety from udon, to donburi, and tempura.  But where Kitaro is different is their sushi.  Pretty much, everything is about half the size that I would imagine it to be.  This sounds like a horrible characteristic, but actually, it works out: everything is smaller, and everything is significantly cheaper.  So, you get to order more items and try more things!  

Everything is very fairly priced and the fish tastes fresh.  The rolls are nicely made and tightly rolled.  My friend and I shared so that we could try more things.  Between the two of us, we ordered:

-Inari (2 pieces for about $2): Very simple and just as I expected.  I personally love inari, so I was very pleased with the cheap price.
-Firecracker roll (5 pieces for about $4): For some reason, this roll came out by first, and by itself.  It is a deep-fried sushi roll containing tuna and drizzled with two sauces.  It is pretty tasty and a nice alternative to typical sushi rolls.  The sauces were good too.
-Spider roll (5 pieces for about $5): The spider roll may be one of my all-time favorites.  The softshell crab inside was cooked nicely and actually decently sized (I've gotten some pretty puny-sized pieces of crab in the past at other restaurants.)  The roll was also made nicely so that it didn't fall apart when I tried to pick it up (which often happens with the spider roll because it is so big.)  This was really good.  I would recommend it.  
-49er roll (5 pieces for about $4): This roll was also pretty decently sized.  It had tuna and avocado in it and was topped with tobiko.  The tuna tasted fresh and they filled the roll with it so that you could really taste the tuna in each bite.  
(We originally ordered the Mexican roll, but they were out of guacamole, so instead we ordered:)
-Salmon skin roll (8 pieces for about $2): This is a very simple roll with just grilled salmon skin wrapped in rice and seaweed.  It isn't anything fancy, but it tasted good and is very cheap/filling!

Our total for these 5 items was about $18 before tip (and before coupon!).  It was quite the deal and we were both full.

Overall, the food tastes pretty good and the service is decent.  They are friendly about refilling water and tea and the sushi came out pretty quickly.  Each of our orders came out at different times, which was not that great, but it was fine. My friend had a 15% off coupon, so it was a really great deal.  It was $75 before tip for a group of 8 of us, and we were all full.  Kitaro is definitely not fancy, but it's a cheap way to get some decent sushi.  The food is probably 3 stars, the prices will bring it up another half-star, and the coupons bring it up another half-star (as a student, I'm always looking for deals.)

Notes:
-Parking in this area can be difficult (unless it's past the dinner rush).  I circled for about 10 minutes before finding a spot.  Also, the meters are free after 6 p.m.
-They often have coupons; our coupon was on the back of a Safeway receipt.
-My friends said that this is a sister restaurant of Kiki's (in Inner Sunset).
author: Samantha L.

description:
Simply put:

This is your very basic sushi. Nothing over the top, but for the price... How can you complain?! 

The garlic edamame is a favorite starter of mine. So much garlic flavor it's perfect.
My friends always get the firecracker rolls, they smell so good and look even better! Definitely order that roll if you are unsure of your choice. There are several vegetable rolls, which taste so good (just incase you or your friends are veggie friendly).

The restaurant itself has a very open setting, where you sit right next to strangers. It's definitely not a bad thing, it's just not a very private or intamite sushi spot.

The beer is overpriced in my eyes so I usually skip it. The tea feels so good in the cold outer Richmond, definitely try it! And it's free :)

Overall this is my sushi spot, I'm not a fancy girl, I don't need fancy sushi! Just basic good tasting rolls!
author: Ashley D.

description:
At Kitaro, you get what you pay for. The fish is usually a hit, but sometimes a miss. Most of the time I get nirigi, which is decent. I've tried the croquette a few times and those are always good. 
I live close by so I get take out. When I have eaten in,  the service has been great. They're attentive, nice, and quick. The restaurant itself could use a bit of improvement.  New carpet, more light.
author: Ana I.

description: I think their combo platters are pretty darn good. I was not a big fan of their sushi. It was OK but the combo platters are much better and a good value. Service is good., They are hopping when it's busy!
author: Kris T.

description:
When I was younger, my girlfriends and I used to frequent this place. Yummy, filling, and good communication talk. There was always a line. But now, that I'm back, the food is still good, still hearty. 
Parking spots is like a game on Geary street, and somehow, one is always appearing. The hot tea is perfect. The beef teriyaki is tender and just the right amount of sauce. The tempura batter could of had a little bit more flavor, a little bit lighter. It needed something. The mackerel was fresh and the tuna sashimi was good. The side salad with dressing is always my favorite part, but something was missing in the miso soup. Maybe more base needed?
The Pink Dragon roll with the salmon on top was good, a little maybe too bland. it could have used something else in the roll. One of my least favorite off their sushi menu but I'm glad I've tried it now to know. Will order plenty more next time and keep coming back. Still one of my favorite sushi spots in San Francisco because of its location, and ability to always present well. Good service. Less expensive.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
Why is everyone hating on Kitaro?

Kitaro is probably one of the most under-rated Japanese restaurants in SF. It has a great lunch bento box special where you can pick from a ton of options like Chicken Katsu, Sushi, and Teriyaki. The prices are SO GOOD for the amount of food you get. It's amazing the amount of bang for your buck you get at Kitaro.

The chicken karaage here is SO GOOD! The chicken teriyaki is also bomb. As for sushi, the pink dragon roll is always everyone's favorite, but I definitely love the firecrackers too!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Pros:
- Amazing chicken teriyaki
- Tasty chicken karaage
- Really good pink dragon roll and firecracker sushi
- BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK SUSHI
- Sushi uses fresh fish

Cons:
- Not the most gourmet food
- Not the cheapest Japanese food, but well worth it
author: Kevin L.

description:
They have good-sized bentos and sushi but i'm not crazy about Kitaro. I ordered their beef teriyaki with vegetable tempura and it was horrible. Their vegetable tempura was soggy and their beef teriyaki had more fat than beef! I was really disappointed when I ate here. 
Despite their reasonable prices, I would not come back for their bentos. I haven't tried their sushi, so maybe i'll give them another chance. 
Kitaro is a no-no for now.
author: Tessa A.

description: Wowww oh so satisfied!!! The sashimi cuts are different than most but still buttery deliciousness. Service was quick, lots of people enjoying their food here. My friend enjoyed the chicken katsu and teriyaki as well. Miso and rice were simply perfect. Charging 50 cents for hot tea is just wrong, esp when it's nothing special- but the prices here are pretty reasonable so keep that 4th star! I'll b back :-)
author: Coco J.

description:
Casual place with a noise level of mediocre.
Reservation needed on Fri-Sun.
It gets packed on those days.
Fun, tasty, reasonable prices.
Service ok.
Stack up on the rolls when ordering sushi, worth it...
author: Noucha A.

description:
I had always wondered about this fabled "Kitaro" place that kept sending me coupons in the VALPAKs all of last year. I finally had the chance to try the place out today with Mellie P., who made the suggestion that Kitaro serves "cheap and fair" sushi.

Of course few of the sushi selections are authentically Japanese (meaning, the kind you would find IN Japan), but nonetheless, the joint seems to be a pretty popular place. It seems that people come here for the sushi fusions mainly.

The atmosphere is bustling, busy right from 11:30 (opening time); we were lucky to be one of the first few in the door so we could put our order in right away. By the time we left Kitaro, it was already packed to the brim, and it was only 12:30. Decorations are simplistic and modern, with a few Japanese theatre masks hung on the walls.

The service: they were attentive with us before the rush of customers, making sure we got our orders in on time, but they failed to come by our table to pick up our dishes/bring us our check when the lunch rush came in. I would have thought that they would have been eager to get us out the door since the stream of customers kept coming in, and we were obviously well past finished with our meal. Maybe they wanted to allow us time to relax after the meal? But I was feeling restless after awhile, so it would have been nice to have a little more service so we could get on out with our tasks for the day.

The food was decent; I decided to venture out into the sushi selections and ordered the Firecracker Roll and sweet potato nigiri rolls. The sweet potato nigiri rolls were intriguing, with the slabs of potato drizzled with teriyaki sauce on top. The Firecracker Roll was spicy and flavorful; I wished there had been more to the order than five rolls, though. Nonetheless, the prices were fair and I would have ordered more if the servers actually came back to our table and asked us if we wanted to add more to our order (more service = more tip?).

I didn't expect too much from Kitaro, but I didn't expect the worst either. Maybe I'll come back (around 11:30 again) whenever I have sushi cravings (which, strangely enough, is rare).
author: Helene K.

description:
FOOD: Food is okay. I felt as though some of the meat was not cook thoroughly or just too bland. Sushi is pretty tasteful for what it is. I just did not feel as though it was FRESH. Its like I can taste it being a couple days old. 

SERVICE: Pretty slow. I'm not sure we came at their busiest time, but either way its as though they forgot about us. We sat down and it took about 7 minutes to realize we never received menus. Our food came out promptly, but there were some side dishes or extra requests that took some time. We always had to call on the waiter to remind them of that drink we ordered or when we wanted the check. 

PRICE: You get your average $8-10 meal for sushi, bento box or even your daily noodle. Not bad for a quick japanese bite on geary. 

OVERALL: Honestly, if you're around the area and if you want a quick fix of sushi/bento boxes by all means stop on by. However, I think there are better restaurants around the area to full fill those needs.
author: Isabel N.

description:
The food is worth the price, really cheap, but the service is REALLY poor, the waitress the helped us was unpolite and rude. 
I might never go back
author: Abner P.

description:
It's still my spot  i LovE taking my out of town friends here!  They are always to mesmerized by the price and the taste. 

Friend: I want to take you to my favorite Japanese resturant! You'll love it!!

*my thought*
My Sushi spot blows your Sushi spot out of the water!!

Me: Ok.

the only neg point was the Tea tasted like burnt tea leaves.. PASS.
author: Sherrell D.

description:
I am no sushi eater, so some of you may want to ignore my review.  But I always go out to eat with my boyfriend. 

I got the Bento Box with teriyaki salmon, vegetable tempura, and some edamame.  The edamame wasn't too good, possibly overcooked.  But the rest was delicious, including the rice and salad. 

The service was fast, but not too good. $1.50 for a can of soda.  Yikes!

Will probably try a different place next time, but it was still alright.
author: Jill B.

description:
I LOVE this place!! Especially for lunch you can get a combo plate for only like 6 dollars!! I love their California rolls and sometimes our family used to order the big platter of them! I always get the chicken terriyaki and california rolls combo! 

They also have fast service so you're in and out of there without wasting much of your meter time (:
author: Stephanie W.

description: Wonderful service , got seated right away at 1pm and got the food around 1:15-1:20, they were very generous with their portions and the quality was still great for the low prices they have. Very satisfied with this place :)
author: Andrew C.

description:
I attempted to brave the parking adventures here again...and the lack of parking won.  Any parking karma I may have had saved up was pretty much exhausted these last couple of trips after circling around.....and around.....and around...

Fortunately, their Salmon Sashimi brought happiness to my stomach...along with the Chicken Karaage.  Too bad I can't say the same for their Katsu Curry Udon dish.  Ugh.

and then we went around...and around...and around....
author: Mike L.

description:
I've been to Kitaro's several times.  I always get a consistently good (not amazing) meal for a great price. There are definitely better sushi places out there, but Kitaro's is fast, friendly, and cheap. On top of that, the Safeway on 7th Ave gives 15% off your whole order on the back of their receipts. 

They bring out your food in the order it's ready. Sushi, udon, whatever. And they tend to put the whole table's sushi on a few shared plates. Not a big deal, but something to be aware of if you want your own plate, or are deathly allergic to whatever your meal-mate is ordering...

Parking is the most challenging part of eating here, but that's not unexpected on Geary.
author: Mari F.

description:
I live three blocks away from Kitaro, so it's always been my family's go-to restaurant for sushi. A few feet from the door  you walk in, you're hit with the sweet, sweet scent of.. well, I could never really put my finger on it. Perhaps it's the miso soup? Not really. Whatever it is, it's one of my favorite scents. 

Every time we go there, we always order basically the same thing:
Garden salad (BEST dressing EVER!)
Seaweed salad (a must-have in between rolls)
Guava drink (kind of watered down, try asking for less or no ice)
California roll (always a favorite)
Kitaro roll (Teriyaki chicken is always nice and warm, never too much sauce on top)
Alaska roll (probably my favorite out of all of them, even though I can't shove the whole thing in my mouth without looking gross)
Pink dragon roll (pretty much California roll with salmon on top, always nice and warm)
Firecracker (my FAVORITE! Always hot when it comes out, and mildly spicey. Tons of flavor, nice and bite-sized)
..and some other rolls!

I've never tried the udon or any of the raw fish (I'm not into any of that), but out of all THREE (who's idea was that?) Japanese restaurants on the block, Kitaro is THE BEST.
author: Lissa D.

description: Very good sushi and reasonably priced. Only drawback, they are not very flexible when small menu changes are requested.
author: P O.

description:
I used to be in love Kitaro. It pretty much was my favorite sushi spot in SF. 

And now I've evolved and outgrown it. Their sushi is actually pretty average. You can find the typical sushi rolls that any other restaurant has. The definite upside to Kitaro: their prices. I would definitely choose to come here if I didn't want to shell out a lot of cash for a quick sushi fix. 

Their service has always been decent. Nothing to complain about, and nothing to rave about.  Seating is kinda limited so sometimes there's a wait. 

My recommendations for ordering: the firecrackers! they're cheap, good, and a party in your mouth. and the seaweed salad. really good and also cheap.
author: Danielle G.

description: The best spot for quick, tasty, inexpensive lunch that I know of!!! Service is quick, maybe not everybody is trained in San Francisco style customer service, but they do their job perfectly well! Found it by chance, and been here at least once a week for last 2 month, food never disappoints!
author: Sofia K.

description: I forgot Little Tokyo opens at 5pm for dinner so I decided to try this place since I haven't tried it before. When we arrived we were seated quickly. I thought they didn't have much choice on the menus. I ordered some sushi and my bf ordered the combination lunch with grilled mackerel and beef teriyaki. Our waitress was fine and didn't neglect us whenever we needed anything. I got tea (which was charged $0.39 by the way) and my bf got a coke. I was so hungry I didn't have much opinion of the quality of our food. One of the sushi rolls, the special one, looked normal but the ingredients inside was of a measly portion and also did not taste very good. Very disappointed.The grilled mackerel from the lunch bento was not very good also but the beef teriyaki I thought was good. Could have had better! -At Little Tokyo. Never again.
author: Carmen L.

description: This isn't the best sushi place in town but for the money you spend it's worth it. Sushi rolls are really cheap so don't expect the best quality in their sushi. This is a great place if your looking more for quantity than quality.
author: Moses D.

description:
You get what you pay for. You actually get a lot in bento boxes which was really shocking considering the prices ($10-15)  

Food: I got the chicken teriyaki dinner plate ($8-9) and my sister got the shrimp and veggie one. we split it so we could get a better deal. The food looks good but the taste was well... The food was so salty I chugged all my water (which I never normally do) and then some. There was wayy too much batter in the tempura and the chicken just wasn't tasty. Tt was really chewy but not in the good way and the teriyaki sauce wasn't good at all. We also ordered the alaska roll. It had six pieces that were basically falling apart. 

Service: They seem to not have sections for certain waiters/waitesses so you have to try and flag the next available server (IF they see you). My cousin asked for the server for a booster for her daughter and we ended up not getting one because she kept forgetting (thankfully my baby cousin is big enough to be able to see over the table). They definitely could improve on customer service because they did not look happy at all. Usually someone greets you with a warm smile and there definitely was no warmness at this place. The pros would probably be that our food came out relatively fast. 

Setting: Its nice but somewhat cramped. It doesnt seem very wheelchair accessible to me. I enjoyed the pretty lights on the ceiling (the paper lamps). 

Overall, it was just a meh experience. I dont think I'll be coming back here the next time I visit SF though.
author: Christina D.

description: I like this place a lot. Nice price and good food. I don't like that they don't have delivery.
author: Anastasia G.

description: I went here solo.  The atmosphere was ok, but the sushi was good.  Not an expert with Sushi, but for the price, I was very happy.  I live in the area and will be back!
author: Gabe R.

description: Quality of both food and service are very low. I highly recommend going somewhere else if you want a pleasant meal. It's not that cheap for what you get.
author: Lily J.

description:
Kitaro has been a staple restaurant for every trip I take to San Francisco and there is only one reason for it.

It is not for the superior quality of the food. There is definitely better Japanese food to be had in the city..

It is not for the great location.  It's all the way out in the Richmond district and not especially exciting for the non-local.

It is not for a fast, friendly dining experience.  The service is fast, attentive but nothing spectacular.

What Kitaro DOES well is that it serves great sashimi lunch deals.  They don't cut the sushi the best way but it's hard to mess up salmon sashimi and it always melts in mouth.  That's the only reason I would venture so far out of the city center to come here.
author: John H.

description:
This place is awesome. Me and my boyfriend can get a filling dinner for $20. I'm a vegetarian and not a huge fish fan, so the fact that there is an array of veggie sushi rolls (I got pumpkin) for 1.99 for six. Such a good, cheap deal. And tasty too. The udon soup is good too, flavorful and filling. 

My favorite part was definitely the pan-friend garlic edamame for around 3 bucks. SO. GOOD. I live around the corner and I'm considering ordering these just to take home with me and munch on while watching tv. 

All in all, if you're looking for super reasonably priced sushi, where you won't have to wait to get seated or waited on, this place is for you.
author: Adelaide M.

description:
Been coming here since 6th grade. The food is fast and cheap and decent enough to enjoy. This is a great place if you are dining with a friend or two but if you have like a party (3 or more), it might not be the place hence the space the restaurant has. 

Last time i've been there was the night of my high school prom. Recalling from observing the dishes we ordered the portions were huge. A chicken katsu meal would fill you up by the time you are half way through the bowl. But hey, I didn't mean that in a bad way. 

The lunch bento box menu is pretty good. You order a meal (let's say chicken teriyaki) and you order a type of sushi to go along with it. It also goes along with miso soup and salad. 

If you're in the neighborhood, and want some Japanese food, Kitaro is the place. Price is reasonable.
author: Henry D.

description:
Went there for a family dinner. The dining area was warmer than usual, a fact acknowledged by the wait staff. Upon being seated, we were told by one of the waitresses that they did not have kids menus. She did, however, recommend an appetizer on account of the portion being small. The waitress also have me a puzzled look when I asked for kids chopsticks. Not exactly the most welcoming environment for a family. 

The food came out in a timely manner. We ordered vegetable tempura udon, Godzilla roll, deep fried California roll, salmon sashimi, gyoza, chicken Katsura, and a salmon/chicken combination plate. Overall the food was very tasty. The sushi was fresh. The chicken was well cooked. Salmon was a tad on the dry side, but was masked by the teriyaki sauce. The udon was very tasty and the tempura was nice and crispy. 

I would rate the overall dining experience as below average. While the food was pretty good, the dining environment and the hospitality of some of the waitresses were subpar. The timeliness of the food is canceled out by the dining room temperature. After eating there, it seems like I would be better off ordering to go and enjoying the food at home.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This place was surprising.   We brought the kids here on a whim one day, and they really enjoyed themselves as did we.  

First off it's crazy cheap - especially for being in the city.  Secondly - it's really fresh for being so cheap. The combos gave us a lot of good flexible options.  Plus we ordered several other rolls and shared a feast of food. 

 The decor isn't the greatest, but the atmosphere is happy, and the staff attended to us nicely.
author: Samanta V.

description: Do not come here. This place sucks. Food-below average, service- none. Prices- very cheap, yet not worth your health and nerves.
author: Hanna F.

description:
I really appreciate the prices in this place, and the food isn't half bad.  I've read some reviews about the sushi and I just have to ask one thing: why?

Here some signs this restaurant is not a good place for sushi:
  -- no sushi bar
  -- thus no sushi chef
  -- no sushi chef means you don't know who's cutting the fish and making the rolls
  -- if you do order sushi, it magically appears out of the kitchen
  -- magic sushi from the kitchen?  good luck with that.

If you go, please stick to the bento boxes.

And for those people who I see waiting outside of place on a Saturday night, you can do better.
author: Dan B.

description:
Friend:  So, what are you in the mood for?
Me: Sushi.
Friend: Where do you want to go?
Me: KITARO'S!!

I have fond memories of the place.  When I lived in the Bay area, this was my go-to joint for very inexpensive and tasty sushi.  I loved it so much, that my cousin and I were here, at least, once a week.  When I go and visit the Bay, I still make it a point to visit Kitaro's for my sushi fix.

My favorite is the battered and deep fried Godzilla Roll (spicey tuna tempura roll, topped with a wasabi mayo sauce). Often times, the roll was so FAT, I couldn't get all of it in my mouth.  Not bad for $5.  The cool thing about the place is that they offer different choices.  This includes the Kitaro roll (grilled teriyaki chicken w/ avocado), for those non-seafood eaters, and the Irish roll (cucumber, grean bean, avocado, fruit and a sauce), for those vegetarians, to eat. The price range for their sushi rolls are $2.99-$7.99, most of them in the $4 range.  

The place is often times busy and if you don't want to wait, you can always order to-go.  The staff is friendly. The only problem I recall about this place is that parking sucks.  When you are hungry to the point where your sugar level has dropped, this makes the experience of finding parking all the more worse.  Though it may not be the highest quality sushi, the price and the taste of the sushi rolls are very well worth it!
author: Rianne D.

description: Portions are getting really small.  I come expecting good portions. The sashimi orders are a rip!
author: Demanding T.

description:
Only reason for the 4 stars is I wish they started offering better variety of fish. They are a little limited.

Other than that, the fish is always fresh, the cost is unbelievable when you consider inflation, the quality of the service is always friendly, and the food always gets there quickly.

Will continue to come here as long as the doors are open!
author: Walter W.

description:
The most generic Japanese food ever.  Now, don't get me wrong, I love generic Japanese food, and I'm Japanese-American, but Kitaro did what they shouldn't have done.  They served me the worst California roll I've ever had.  It's pretty hard to mess up a California roll, yet Kitaro managed to ruin it.  C'mon Kitaro... you can't mix some mayo with that imitation crab you put in there??... not even some rip avocado... C'mon brah brah!

Other than that can't really complain.  The rest of the food here is pretty standard.  Chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, tonkatsu, etc...  The prices are very inexpensive, so don't expect anything fancy.

My friend ordered a San Francisco roll, which tasted weird.  Tasted like they put canned salmon in there, but who knows(the person who made it, that's who.)
author: Anthony N.

description:
A nice place for good tasting sushi at a low price. In fact, their whole menu is pretty cheap (dinner combos, bento boxes, lunch specials, etc).

I ordered 4 rolls of sushi:
The Fire Crackers: salmon & albacore sushi tempura w/ spicy sauce
The Kamikaze Roll: spicy yellowtail, avocado crab & tobiko
The San Francisco Roll: salmon salad, avocado & tobiko
The Godzilla Roll: spicy tuna tempura topped w/ house special wasabi sauce

This all came to about $17.
I got full, the service was fast. It's a great deal.

My favorite was the Godzilla roll because of two things (1) I'm a fan of tempura cooked sushi (2) the special wasabi sauce is bomb!

While some of the sushi ranged from good to okay, I still think it could've been more fresh. But hey, this place charges for sushi at such a low rate so what do you expect. You get for what you pay for.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Horrible customer service! Placed a takeout order totaling about $140, when I got home they were missing tempura from 2 of my combo orders and salmon teri from another. When I called back they were hardly helpful. No apologies, just lousy attitude. How about,'sorry you got home and your order was wrong. let us make it right.' This is the second time they've done this to me. 

Food is mediocre and customer service is horrendous. Like others said, this place used to be good. Now I hope they go out of business. 

Food is not cheap nowadays. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere.
author: Robbie W.

description:
Good, cheap food. Fairly good service. Nice, clean environment.

3.5 Stars.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I only come here during odd hours when parking is available.

Also, if you sign up on their site, you will have a 15% coupon snail mailed to you every month.

Cheap, fast, and not authentic Japanese food.

Do not come here and expect much.

The fish is cheap and not that fresh.

For the price, you cannot go wrong.
author: Shelley L.

description: I hardly ever write Yelp reviews. However, after being sick and in pain for more than 24 hours, I felt compelled to. I am severely gluten intolerant, and I hate being that annoying person that has to ask about every little thing on the menu to make sure it's gluten free. As always though, I swallowed my pride and politely asked our waiter to make absolutely sure that each roll I ordered was gluten free, because sushi can be a sneaky, hidden source of it. He assured me multiple times that everything I ordered was fine. Well, here I am now, sick as a dog. I understand that this place is cheap and you get what you pay for, but I don't think that should mean getting lied to and poisoned.
author: Sara G.

description:
Kitaro is the Panda Express of Japanese restaurants in the RIchmond district - sometimes, you wander in inexplicably because hunger has clouded your mind and erased ideas of better places.

The portions for the combination bento boxes and prices for many of the sushi rolls are fair, but nothing about the food will leave you with a sense of contentment that fresh and tasty sushi rolls usually do.

Although Kitaro is a cheaper Japanese restaurant and will fill your stomach, there are better options in San Francisco.
author: Andrew M.

description: I picked up some rolls for lunch the other day. Alaska, CA, kappa , miso soup and sake nigiri sushi. Everything came out to $11! Can you believe that?
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I had always heard everyone at USF say they were "going to Kitaro" or "picking up takeout from Kitaro," but I had never been.  

I happened upon this place sort of by accident.  My mom and I picked up my roommate from the VA and then went to the Irish bakery on Geary.  Seeing all the baked goods reminded us of our hunger.  But where to go when down that way on Geary, but for sushi?

Kitaro is one block over and sat us immediately.  I'm new to the whole sushi thing and they accommodated me very graciously.  

I can now say that I eat food at or from Kitaro at least once per week nowadays.  I always order the Mexican roll.  The tiger roll and tempura rolls are also particularly tasty.  

You really won't find a better deal than they're bento box dinners.  Huge portions of teriyaki chicken, rice, salad and miso soup all for $6.99!

Also, if you shop at the Safeway on 7th and Cabrillo, save your receipt!  You can get 15% off at Kitaro!
author: Aishling R.

description:
I usually just get takeout sushi, mostly their party platters. The quality of their food has gone done recently which is disappointing, but basic items such as the veggie and fried rolls are still pretty good. The prices are competitive with the approx 10 other japanese places around the same area, but i'm the kind of person that usually only goes out for things i can't cook at home. Since i usually order teriyaki or katsu whenever i go to a japanese place, i know i can make it for much cheaper and better quality at home. 

The last time i was at kitaro, the service was ok, though like some other people, i did feel a bit rushed. I find the place to be a bit small and loud for conversation, but if you don't mind these kinds of things, then give it a try.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description:
CHEAP! I'm a parrot at this point, because I'm repeating what everyone else is saying, but I like to think that I made a bird-related pun, and that someone out there enjoyed it.

Seriously though. I find little fault with a sushi place that is this affordable. It's not the most exciting sushi; it's San Francisco, after all, so there are better places out there. But it's also difficult to find food like this at prices like this in a city like this, so props to Kitaro for being consistent. I was, however, disappointed that the seaweed salad I ordered cost more than a whole sushi roll. Disproportionate, to say the least.

In any case, I'll be back here. The firecrackers--little tempura'd, spicy-sauced rolls of something aquatic and delicious--are kind of addicting.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
Ended up here with a few of my classmates after cruising down Geary. The place itself was decent, not too shabby. The service was cool, they were nice enough to let my friend use an outlet to charge her iPhone. 

I came here on a Friday, and during Lenten season, for us catholics, we can't eat meat on friday, and since I hate sushi I ended up getting Udon. I just got plain Udon, nothing special same goes for the taste. 

I think the thing that pissed me off though was I ordered mango mochi for dessert. I expected atleast a couple of pieces, but they brought it out and they only served up ONE FREAKIN' MOCHI. Not only that, but they cut it into fourths, as if that'd make it better. I spent $1.50 on one piece of mochi. That's so ridick. I didn't have the balls to complain. I guess that's my bad. But seriously, are you kidding me? 1 piece for $1.50. Ridiculous.
author: Mellani L.

description:
**This review is way overdue**

A colleague asked if I wanted to join her to Kitaro's this Thursday and I said "Heck No!!"

Their sushi is mediocre.

Their service is lame.

Their male head boss is an A$$.

On top of that, we waited for our food for heeeeeeeeeeeeeeeecka long. 

Was very upset and left w/o giving a tip.

Why would you bother coming here.
author: Kenny C.

description:
I'm glad I came here when I wasn't even hungry! This place was just somewhere to go after missing a yoga class. It's not the best sushi, but definitely not the worst. It's not expensive at all, and they're pretty fast with orders. No wait to be seated, but the place was pretty packed. 

Real strict with the alcohol tho. My friend didn't have her license on her, so they took her sake cup away. When they caught her drinking from our cups she was lectured and watched the rest of the visit.

With all the restaurants in this area, this will probably be my last time here...
author: S Y.

description:
so cheap, i expected the salmon to suck. quite the contrary. it was surprisingly fresh. (4 stars for salmon alone! :)

all the rolls were ok. nothing special. (cheap. better to pay less and get what u pay for.? unlike most places were the rolls r super marked up and still disappointing... ha)
author: Lisa N.

description: If generous portion sizes and cheap prices are important to you, there is no better place in the neighborhood.  Service was also prompt I thought and I went during a busy lunch.  Four stars only because while the hot options (noodles, teriyaki, chicken) have a reasonable food quality, the sushi and other raw options (sashimi) were just passable so it would be hard to give out five star.
author: Daniel Y.

description:
4 stars because they know they really should be 3 stars but they don't front. Good prices, decent fish, and the wait staff is excellent. 

I suggest trying the salmon sashimi dinner with 10pcs salmon nigiri and avocado makimono on the side. Hell yeah that's a lot of food but it should set you back just a little bit less than $30. Make sure you check the back of your Safeway receipts for a 15% coupon... boom, tip paid for!

Pink dragon roll is bomb too. Ask for it raw.
author: Mike B.

description:
When I used to live out in the Richmond, we'd come here all the time.  My cousin called it the cheapest sushi in the city.  I have yet to verify that.  It got a lot of hype around that time (and since), so the wait time and parking around the restaurant tend to be long/difficult.  That said, I did like the sushi when we used to go there, especially the broccoli sushi.  Yes, broccoli.  Yum.

Since I now live in Bernal and frequent Moki's I've definitely seen much less of Kitaro, but it still has a special, cheap-eats place in my heart.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
It's a short walk from my apartment, and we were looking for something to eat so why not stop for some cheap sushi?

It's sandwiched between two other sushi joints, but still gets a pretty good crowd during lunch time. Super affordable, and pretty decent food. Not the best quality sushi/japanese food, but you get what you pay for!

Between two girls, we shared a combo bento box which came with soup, salad and rice. We got chicken terriyaki and an eel roll with avocado. It all came out to be about $8 which was really good.
author: Stine H.

description: This place keeps sending us coupons in the mail. My 2 roomies and I finally gave it a shot. We ordered a $30 party tray that had around 50 pieces of sushi. I also ordered seaweed salad for 4 bucks that was tasty but not a huge portion. The coupon only works for pickup and it was ready after 30 minutes. The sushi was fresh and tasty. Let's just say there were no leftovers and our appetites had been satisfied. I would order sushi from here again. The drivers in this neighborhood are horrible so I suggest taking a street that's parallel to Geary to get there.
author: Marty J.

description:
i'm surprised that a majority of the votes are only three stars. is this the best sushi i've ever had? no, but you have to take the price into consideration and when you consider the price this place is amazing! 

dynamite roll: spicy tuna light batter-dipped fried topped with spicy sauce. delicious and tasted like a specialty roll you would find at a fancier restaurant.

mexican roll: shrimp tempura & avocado with chili. pretty tasty standard roll.

fire cracker roll: salmon & albacore sushi tempura w/ spicy sauce. amazing ! the sauce was what made this. they should put this sauce on everything to make it even better. 

tuna and spicy tuna rolls were also good and pretty standard.

the staff was friendly and the food cheap and good and more than fairly priced.
author: Michael G.

description:
1 star because I used to get freebies from my dad's friend.
Another star for the Godzilla roll.

My dad's friend no longer works there. I have found places with better rolls.

NEXT!
author: Susy C.

description:
I was quite saddened when I ended up not enjoying this place as much as I used to.  I believe it has gone downhill because I remember the food being quite good here for the price.  The service was rushed and I didn't receive any additional service until we were done with our meal...not even a water refill.  
My tempura udon was not even served with any garnish.  Just a plain bowl of broth with some unsavory noodles floating around inside.  The nigiri and chicken karaage were the only dishes that came out looking appetizing and well prepared.  
We ordered a few rolls, and we did not know that one of the rolls was going to be served hot.  We sampled it with low expectations but it was worse than we thought it would be.  Hot, mushy, and flavorless.  

They are in desperate need of new management because I was appalled that they would put a couple of things on the menu without specifying certain details.  Those shortcuts are just a set up for disappointment for the customer.
author: Amber R.

description: Charged me tips without even my consent. Really! Also there was an hair in my beef soup but they exchange it. Overall it was okay but the tip part really made me mad. Cause how is you gonna force me to tip you guys.
author: Joe Y.

description:
I was craving sushi since last night! Soooo I had to go to a place where there is cheap and good sushi! And that place is Kitaro! Yumm tonight, came strictly for the rolls. My friend and I ordered the tempura roll, dragon roll, unagi roll, spider roll, godzilla, rock n roll, fire cracker balls, and dynamite roll! DELISH!

The godzilla roll had like a wasabi sauce drizzled over it and i DID NOT know it was wasabi and it totally burned through my nostrils, so be aware!

The rolls were pretty decent, I mean you get what you pay for. Never get California rolls, sooo stereotypical and noob! And they are being stingy on the size of the rolls! I swear the last time I came here they gave a bigger portion! There was only like 5 pieces of unagi roll, wth! 

But my satisfied my sushi craving tonight, so good job Kitaro! You never fail my taste buds, but doesn't hurt to give a little more sometimes. It's just rice!
author: Alice Z.

description:
Parking sucks!!  I drove around for 45 mins before FINALLY finding a spot.  UGH!

As far as seating goes, they have a waiting list, but I'm not very sure how good they are on using it.  As soon as a table opened I saw people jumping to sit ... which was really not fair and got on my nerves.  But whatever, I moved on quick ...

After we got sat ... in tables that were EXTREMELY close to each other, we were served so quick.  The food came out quick and we were out of there a lot sooner then I thought.

I know that I do sound a bit negative in my review, however, the place itself was pretty good for it's price.  You get what you pay for ... I'll probably be back again when I want some cheap Japanese food.
author: Pia V.

description: Nothing special but does the job. Rolls are very cheap here. I usually go for the Godzilla roll, spider roll, dynamite roll, and the Firecrackers. 4 stars just because it's consistent and reliable.
author: Lielen d.

description: I come here every week because their price reasonable and the fish very fresh! Their bento box portion is huge and cheap. Nice place, nice food and nice service.
author: Emily W.

description: Cheap prices cheap sushi good service. It's a mediocre cookie cut version of a sushi restaurant but it works for me.
author: Pamela I.

description:
I've been coming here for over six years because the food is fairly priced and consistent (except for Sundays-I think the main chef has his day off). This is a good place to order to-go, except they won't give you miso soup if you order to-go. I've been here at least 50 times.

I've never been a fan of udon, and this place hasn't changed my mind about it. It is pretty tasteless and dull.

However, their beef teriyaki is very good (except on occasional Sundays). It is tender and I like their sauce. I suggest eating it with the chili powder. The shrimp and vegetable tempura has too much batter. I feel like I'm eating mouthfuls on batter. The sushi is consistent and good for its price. I've never gotten sick from their sashimi-which is good.
author: Jason C.

description: Prices are very reasonable. Nice space, food comes pretty fast once you have ordered. Actual sushi was ok. Servers are not really attentive. We waited 10min to get a box and the bill. They also use imitation crap which I am not a huge fan of.
author: Alexandria W.

description:
The service was fast, however, the food was awful. This place is only good for those who want really cheap sushi.

The crab sushi was terrible. They only have imitation grab. As if that not bad enough, they actually put it in the form of crab sticks in all of the rolls. On the menu they only mention that the California roll has imitation but the truth is its in all of the sushi. We also ordered beef and chicken teriyaki which were both mediocre. I'm definitely not coming back here again.
author: Kate G.

description: Food here is reasonably priced, which explains why the place usually fills up during meal times, especially during weekends. The combo set meals are good value for money. What amazes me the most is that the service reps manage to be responsive and courteous even when they are very busy.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
loud!  great prices!  Huge portions!

yet another place I go to when I need something decent to fill my stomach with. Good bento box.  Plenty for leftovers, too.  I would have loved this place in high school.
author: Shinny L.

description:
I'm over this place. 

Get the food to-go. Tipping unfriendly workers isn't fun.

I like the udon and the miso. 

The sushi quality is very poor. Granted, everything is very cheap.
author: Paulina F.

description:
With all of the sushi restaurants in the city, this is probably one of my favorite ones...I've looked far and wide and tried several places and this one is one that I am a fan of. 

You walk in thinking the place is tiny, but it's actually pretty spacious.

+1 for prices
+1 for decent raw fish
+1 for taste
+1 for service

If you want to go to a place with some decent sushi at a reasonable price come here...

Other places in the city you need to dig deeper in your pockets for decent sushi. 

I like it here also because you dont have to go into the heart of the city to find some good sushi...
author: Ashley C.

description: My friends took me here twice. I had the rainbow sushi and my friend got the eel sushi which tasted good. My other friend took me here for a birthday party, so we got the party trays i think. This place has been here for awhile.
author: Serena Z.

description:
KITARO is an excellent & inexpensive place for a fun JAPANESE meal, and ESPECIALLY FOR VEGETARIANS like ADDA! 

There is an excellent selection of unique VEGGIE SUSHI items such as the SEAWEED SALAD, TAMAGO (egg) NIGIRI, INARI, ASPERAGUS, OSHINKO (radish), AVOCADO & the wonderful PUMPKIN (acorn squash) !  At $1.99 a roll they are the best priced veggie sushi in the City!  

The Deep Fried SOFT TOFU is well prepared with a nice topping of teriyaki sauce. Three large pieces for $3.99.

The meat/fish folks will love the RAINBOW ROLL with the variety of fish, and the ROCK 'N ROLL with its barbecued eel & avocado are top choices. 

There are COMBO dishes that are reasonably priced. (Chicken Teriyaki as well as the Salmon Teriyaki are favorites of my friends) 

The HOUSE SAKI is reasonably priced and tastes GREAT!

The staff is very attentive and they really do take the time to accomodate and make one feel welcome!
  
KITARO is always packed all the hours of the day (11:30-11:00pm). 

Yes, everyone's taste in sushi is different. KITARO has had so many customers for so many years, it goes to prove KITARO is a wonderful SAN FRANCISCO bargin!
author: Addadada A.

description: LOVE this place. If nothing else, you must try the "firecrackers". An order of the most delicious saucy, deep-fried sushi balls you will ever have. The rolls are inexpensive and the location is 5 min shy of Ocean Beach. Go sleep off your food coma with your toes in the sand.
author: Marie J.

description: You can't beat 6 rolls and miso soup for $30. 3 people left stuffed and satisfied. We really enjoyed the Dynamite Roll! (We ordered a second one.)  We will be back soon.
author: Chase L.

description:
Everytime someone says, "recommend me a place you go often in the city for sushi," I say "Kitaro" and everyone gives me this "uggh gross" look. Like dang, it ain't that bad. Let's clear things up...

(1) my rating reflects my entire lifetime sushi experience and although Kitaro doesn't have the "OMGAH I'M GONNA DIE THIS IS THE BEST SUSHI EVER" effect, it doesn't mean it's terriable. 

(2) I always order the bento box with salmon and spider roll and it's da-da-da bomb. So order that.
author: Lily W.

description:
My friend, a fellow yelper :), suggested we grab some sushi before going to see a Greek play and I was on board with out hesitation because I LOVE sushi! So, we met up at Kitaro. 

Ok, I am going to sound like a total child saying this, but I liked that the menu had pictures! =P Hey, this is great for people who don't eat sushi often (doesn't apply to me, but still), so that was good thinking on Kitaro's part. 

We started out with the miso soup, which was really good and I had the tempura roll, one of my favorites, and the tiger roll, which I hadn't tried until I came to Kitaro's. Us girls also had some sake (4 shots) and it wasn't strong at all!

As for the staff, they were nice and our waitress was polite.
My favorite sushi rolls are:
Tempura roll
Tiger roll
California roll
Godzilla Roll

Bon appétit! :)
author: Narina A.

description:
I don't where to start with kitaro.  back in the day this was the place to go and it was always packed.  I guess it should've been a sign when there was no line and the restaurant wasn't even half full.  

I shared an assorted sashimi plate and 3 sushi rolls, tiger roll, surfer roll and a pink dragon roll.  the sashimi was just ok.  it wasn't as fresh as others.  besides how the heck can you mess up sashimi?  the rolls were edible but not very tasty.  I don't know what it is, did they change owners, change chefs, or did we come at a bad time?  

I know better now and I will not be eating here again.  I don't like giving bad reviews but kitaro's really does deserve this.  I sure hope the owners read this and make the necessary changes that make kitaro's one of the more popular sushi restaurants like it was 15 years ago
author: Samson M.

description:
This place is just awful.  I ordered takeout for lunch one day (my usual faves, Rumblefish and Drunken Sushi, aren't open til 5pm) and the whole experience was horrible.

The menu online said we got miso soup, salad and rice with our lunch order. Sweet.  We ordered two rolls from the lunch menu and a lunch portion of tuna sashimi.   So I walk over there to pick it up, they charge my card and I leave.  Then I stop and check the bag..wondering why it was $16 for 3 small items.  There was NO soup, NO rice, and the biggest portion of sashimi I've ever seen. It was like a whole tuna in there.

So I go back and find out they gave me the dinner portion of sashimi and that the soup and salad offer only applies if you eat lunch at the restaurant. UMMMM maybe you shouldn't put that on the to go menu then?!

And why they gave me a dinner portion at lunch...I can't say.  Probably trying to make some extra $$. They picked the wrong girl.  I demanded my 2 miso soups and for them to give me a lunch portion of sashimi.  They wouldn't give me the soup for free so I told them to just give it to me and not refund me for the sashimi. 

Instead they charged my card again and voided the other charge. The difference ended up being $1.  Whatever.  But then they couldn't find the void receipt to give to me.  She started looking through the trash. I told her to forget it and just give me my food.  She left and came back 10 MINUTES LATER.  Just to add 2 miso soups and remove half the sashimi??? They were prob spitting on it in the kitchen. 

Finally, the food was just ok. No tofu in the miso soup, which is my favorite part.  My roommate said the sashimi was alright.   I'm so annoyed with this place, especially when there are so many rad sushi places to go to instead. 

Do yourself a favor and go ANYWHERE else!
author: Jamie B.

description:
Pros:
- for the price, food is really great, and comes usually quickly like in 15 minutes. if the price were greater, ok, the food would need to be more elegant to justify. but it beats the standard, set by the price.
- it's not super-exotic like you might see in japantown, but it's not low-quality either. well presented too in the bento trays. restaurant has nice decor. i usually get the shrimp and veggie tempura, chicken katsu, chicken teriyaki, or rock-and-roll. perfectly crispy, not soggy and not over-fried. and i love the miso and green tea they serve here. this place is awesome, will left me feeling satisfied every time. 

Cons:
parking's seriously hard around here. if the parking lot across the street is full, expect to circle the blocks several times. park 3 blocks away and walk over, or just come on weekdays, not weekends.
author: Vince W.

description:
Came here for dinner with a couple special people in my life.  It was my first time here and I'm quite impressed with the service, the price and the flavour.  The portions are quite adequate and you really get good value for your money.  The bento boxes seem to be most popular with the patrons surrounding us.  

The sushi rolls seemed a tad smaller than what I'm used to but I didn't expect too much since it was less than $6.  I ordered the Dynamite roll and the Firecrackers  both of which were lightly fried in tempura batter and that alone satiated my appetite.  

The chicken katsu bento box came with 2 large servings of chicken...very crispy and moist.  The salmon teriyaki was cooked perfectly and the tempura was light and yummy.

Living in San Jose, I would never have thought of coming here had I not known someone that lives close to the city and frequents this place.  I'm so glad I was introduced to this establishment.  

Oh...and did I mention that for 3 people, the bill came out to less than $30?  Awesome deal!

Minus 1 star for the bathroom....but what do you expect?... It's an Asian restaurant in the city...
author: Margaret G.

description: Usually fairly crowded but always a safe choice for japanese food.  When ordering sushi, try the DYNAMITE ROLL!
author: Samantha L.

description:
You get what you pay for

Kitaro's has a waiting list because people want cheap Japanese food. That's exactly what Kitaro's serves, cheap, as in bad Japanese food. The restaurant is quite crowded and it is hard to hear yourself think, much less listen to another person talk. But Kitaro's offers the cheapest Japanese food next to Costco's faux California Rolls.
author: Carol Y.

description:
Good cheap sushi, not the best around but if you have a need for sushi and not a lot of dough. This is the place for you, parking is horrible on Geary so expect to drive around a bit for a spot. 
 All rolls are tasty and made really quickly, avoid the "hot salmon" roll. It is cooked salmon, yuk, hot sushi?
author: Emily L.

description:
Their salmon (sake) sashimi has a lemon marinade which makes it quite refreshing.   All these years and their quality is very consistent.  Decent fish at very affordable price.  Clean tables always and prompt service.  

As if the place isn't cheap enough, I don't know why I only go when I bring my 15% off ValuPak coupon.  The extra $3 savings just makes me that much happier.  

Food's alright.  Rolls are enormous and beware of the overly generous rice portion in them.  It's Atkins hell and South Beach purgatory.  

Parking is close to impossible.  There are always double parkers there hopping out for take out.  I used to be one of them.
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
Cheap enough for sushi and some japanese items.  Always a wait at nights and weekends.  They do have creative rolls.  Service is okay.  Food is good--sometimes it goes down though.  Quality goes up and down...and the parking's a pain.  

Do not go to their sister store, KiKi!  Boo.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Giving 4 because I eat here once a month - sometimes more.  It's cheap, fast and tasty.  Everything we've tried has been good to great.  Nobu it is not but $10 or less each for a happy tongue and a fully belly yes. 

Stand outs are:
-Firecrackers - little tempura coated spicy tuna bites
-Futomaki - a texturey circus of flavor in bite size pieces
-Hamachi and onion rolls - yum!

Service is quick if not noticeably friendly.
author: Julienne G.

description:
The waitresses must be practicing to be ninja assassins at this place. We had barely sat down and glanced at our menus when a woman appeared suddenly and asked if we were ready. Just as she turned away another woman came out of nowhere and asked us again!

They seemed anxious to get our order and get us out of there. 

The sushi is classic themed sushi with names like 49er Roll and Philadelphia Roll. Plain and mediocre sushi. 

However...It is cheap and easy!!!! Who doesn't like cheap and easy?!?! C'mon....you know you do!
author: Jay H.

description:
three words: cheap, fast, tasty.  

i mean don't get me wrong, i liked it. i just can't give anything higher than a 3 star because it doesnt set itself apart from all the other cheap, fast, tasty sushi places i've been to.

parking is a coin flip.  good luck on a busy night.
author: Ray R.

description: for the quality of the fish and food, this place is alright.  hey this helps out a college student who's lookin cheap sushi.  not recommended for a date but recommended just to satisfy your sushi cravings.  service is also okay.
author: Kurt N.

description:
I came here for the second time yesterday. The first time I don't remember liking it very much but the prices are very cheap. Yesterday, I ordered the "Katsu Curry Udon" (it was the special of the day) and I actually really enjoyed it !! I don't normally even like udon but I really enjoyed drinking the curry soup and eating the pork and fried onion :) For $6.99, not bad. 

I tried my husband's food and it was pretty average. The chicken karaage was pretty yummy when it first came out and hot and fresh. :D
author: S H.

description: Cheap eats. Good place to take the kids for lunch
author: Parker S.

description: Love the tempura, miso and unagi. Good quality and very reasonably priced.
author: Rebecca G.

description:
i got the futo maki and spider roll, takeout, for $10.  WIN.  
it was decent ok quality.

savage garden was playing on kitaro radio as i waited.  FAIL.
perfect if you're a cheap date, or just need that tempura-rice-soy sauce fix.
author: Ethan L.

description: If you want cheap sushi this is the place to go, they are not horrible but deffinetly no where close to being good.
author: Vlad M.

description:
After circling around for 20 minutes looking for parking, I finally sat down with my friend.

THE FOOD:  cheap, boring, lack of variety.  fish didn't look fresh; they lacked that sheen  you would see in fresh sushi grade seafood.  The rolls taste not much better than the packaged ones you can get at super markets' refrigerated section.   They used IMITATION CRAB and TOBIKO for CHIRASHI!!! Are you serious??   Well I guess I shouldn't expect to see real crab and salmon roe at a sub par restaurant like this one in the first place.  

Sayonara Kitaro.
author: Tadaa T.

description: I love Kitaro! When I relocated here my family of San Francisco locals took me here and apparently it has been one of their spots for a very long time! The sushi is cheap but delicious! I have gotten the beef teriyaki and it was cooked perfectly. Strongly recommend fire crackers! Really good for the price.
author: Austin P.

description:
I'll give this place three stars because the sushi is quite decent for being RIDICULOUSLY cheap.  Their rolls are definitely a little padded with rice but I would much rather this be the reason for their low prices than bad fish.  I especially love their 'firecrackers', a guilty pleasure I'll admit.  

I used to be somewhat of a regular at this place but hadn't been in a couple months until I went last week.  I've never had major issues with the service before but this last time was sub-par. They forgot my miso soup, then kept ignoring me as I attempted to flag down the waitress and remind them. 

All in all this place is fine but I need to stop being lazy and go on a hunt for better sushi places in my hood.
author: Heather D.

description:
Meh, this place could be better...but i'll give them the benefit of the doubt since we had decent service.

I hope I don't put her on blast but it was quite pleasant to see one of the waitresses there after I had just seen her at Kiki's the day before.  She was very helpful and nice.

The food however, eh..might i warn you, dont get their chicken teriyaki.  It's pretty chewy liked its not fully cooked.  This has also happened in the past.  And it gives you that feeling on your teeth like the way spinach does..pasty-ish?..for lack of better words.  Other than that, everything seemed normal, nothing out of the ordinary.  Probably wouldn't come here again unless I had to but its cheap so I guess if in the area, craving for japanese food, this will do.  

But if i was really desperate I would cross over the ggpark over to irving at eat at KIKI's. 10x better PLUS cheaper AND they have their special bomb.com snowball sushis. A+.
author: Em C.

description:
I used to always get the Dragon roll, but now I usually get the sushi combo which is 6 Nigiri + 6 California rolls. It comes w/ salad (and miso soup if you're eating there). I also love the simple kappa roll and tuna roll. Service is usually good so I can't really complain.

Their party trays are good, too. I always get coupons from them or on the back of my Safeway receipts!
author: Justine O.

description:
Cheap, decent Americanized sushi? count me in

hearing a lot of great reviews from a couple friends, my boyfriend and I headed here and ordered chicken teriyaki, chicken udon, firecracker sushi and the 49ers roll

don't get me wrong; I'm all for deep fried sushi but the only thing particularly wrong with my order was the chicken udon. the portions were perfect for one person and it was a basic udon: broth, chicken and green onions but it had a really weird flavor to it--as if the chicken was not seasoned or marinated in anything. I'm not sure how to describe the taste except that it was too...ethnic? is that the word for it? anyway, ew ew ew I'm never getting the dish again

other than the chicken udon, the chicken teriyaki was yum yums, the firecrackers were a bit small (but at 2 something, thats reasonable) and the 49ers roll (spicy tuna + other stuff) has become a favorite of mine

on my second trip to kitaro, I ordered the vegetable udon ($5.99). eh it was really bland and oversimplified: vegetables (squash, potato, broccoli, carrot, onion) noodles and broth. it just wasnt my type of udon. I've always seen other tables around me order the tempura udon for two dollars more and get a bowl of noodles and broth and a huge serving of tempura on the side.  this is where it gets dertay..

while waiting for my order, I thought to myself, damn eff this diet, I should have ordered the tempura udon. just as I thought this to myself and considering we had the table all the way in the back of the restaurant (which offers a view of the kitchen), I saw a big tray of assorted tempura just come off the stove. I told all my friends to look! mmmm we were so hungry...
one of the chefs was sorting them around for an order and a string bean tempura fell out of the tray and onto the ground. we all thought he was going to throw it away but NO! he picked it off the dirty gross rubber mat on the floor and threw it back on the tray and eventually used it for someone's order that night. Y U C K Y

I swear that story on my life! and here I thought this restaurant had high standards in cleanliness...

what I don't know won't kill me? yeah right
author: kathleen d.

description:
I seldom gave really low ratings but this unfortunately really had earned just 1 star. 

Came here around 9pm and as soon as we found out there were no sushi bars we knew it was bad news. They did not have toro and we were wondering if we should order. 

Well we did order the fire crackers, rainbow roll, unagi and 1 tuna nigiri. 

Fire crackers earned that star. The rest of the fish and rice were dry and they were pre-made and kept in the fridge for who knows how long. 

I left the place eating just 3 pieces of sushi and hungry.
author: T L.

description:
Unfortunately, I'm going to have to agree with Karen L, Amber R and Simone C. I really used to love this place, but it's truly become a hit or miss, more miss than hit. Yesterday, we experienced our "third-strike" trying to order take-out. We started our order-take-out-strategy to eliminate having to search for parking or wait for a table. Although, there never seems to be a long wait, not like they used to have a few years ago (that's probably a clue that this place isn't the same as it used to be). 

Last night was the third time we'd ordered take-out, and when we arrived home with our order, the sushi was missing! We'd already paid for everything too! The first time this happened, we accepted it as a simple mistake. The second time this happened, we gave them the benefit of the doubt, maybe someone's just having an off day... But, after last night's fiasco, I think it's time we find a new place to patron. When we called the restaurant to let them know the sushi we had ordered, and paid for, was missing from our bag, the woman asked if we would come back to pick up the sushi. I told her, we didn't really have a choice, since we paid cash, she couldn't credit us back. So much for saving time, and now, doubling the cost of gas. To top it all off, when we got back to the restaurant, instead of an apology, or offering us something for our trouble and inconvenience, the woman was scolding us for not checking our order! When we told her, it was their job to make sure the order is complete before they bag it up and give it to us, she just yelled at us more... repeating that it is our job to check our order and our bags before we leave the restaurant! Wow, so much for customer service.

So, if you're up for the gamble of a hit-or-miss, and do decide to patron this place, stay alert and double check your bill. They clearly won't hesitate to rip you off. And, apparently, if they do rip you off, it's your fault, not theirs.
author: Cster x.

description:
A few years ago, I would have given Kitaro five stars for the price/simplicity/service. After a few recent visits and many rounds of food poisoning, I cannot imagine going back.

I let them know that the spicy tuna I had may be causing the food poisoning (my wife and I both got sick after eating here). They asked if I was sure and I told them that I would never accuse them of this unless I knew for sure. Being that I LOVED Kitaro at the time, I would never have bused them out unless I knew. 

The person on the phone took a very defensive stance and said that food poisoning doesn't happen there - this is strange because you deal in raw food, especially fish. Unless there is some nuclear irradiation going on in the kitchen, food poisoning is a fact of life for sushi restaurants.

It used to be a great find...decent food and great prices. The prices are still good but read the other reviews...the quality has obviously slipped.
author: Mike K.

description: cheap and quick...and every time I've been there--really great! LOTS OF VEGETARIAN OPTIONS!
author: S S.

description:
Kitaro used to be my favorite sushi place, but now it's where I go for a quick fix. They do offer few selections on rolls. I usually go for the dinner combo where you can choose 2 items bento. Comes with miso soup and salad also for decent pricing. 

The servers here are very friendly and nice, and food is serve in a timely manner.
author: Jenny G.

description: I really like this place because it combines two things I like: eating sushi and not losing my shirt in the process.
author: Ignacio I.

description:
Ambiance: Very beautiful restaurant, nice intimate atmosphere (though we dined next to a really rude, obnoxiously loud group of late 20-year olds. sigh.)

Food: It wasn't bad at all, not generic. We ordered:

the deep fried clams (very tasty but portion size was pathetic and much smaller than shown on the menu)
16-piece sashimi (each piece was pretty small, about 2 inches long, and half an inch wide/deep)
beef yaki noodle (kind of like a stir-fried beef udon, sauce was very sweet so if you don't like your savory food sweet, steer away from this!)
a bento box with tonkatsu chicken (chicken was a bit dry). 

The complimentary salad that they serve is delicious, and the miso soup very watery. 

Overall, the food was good enough for me to come back again. My major complaint about the food is that it's not worth the price (my beef yaki noodle was $16, and I'm positive i could get something similar for ~$8,9 in Berkeley.)

Service: This is why I docked most of the stars. Although I understand the waitress may have been in a foul mood from the obnoxious group next to us, it carried over in her service to us. She was very absent-minded bordering clueless, rarely came to check up on things, and was extremely slow in dealing with the check. Multiple tables had to call for her multiple times. 

I hear the other Japanese stores just down the block are better.
author: C W.

description:
I do love this place despite whatever anyone else says. Cheap Japanese food and the quality is good for it's price. Lately I've been craving Japanese food and I can't seem to find any other place that fits my budget. This place is open late and fast in service. 

Good job kitaro, good job
author: Deanna W.

description: Kitaro is my go-to place for sushi and all things Japanese-American food.  I've been coming here for years and it has never disappointed.  This is a no frills place for good sushi and other JA dishes like teriyaki bento boxes and the spicy chicken udon.  Notice I didn't say great sushi, if you're into fine exotic Japanese sushi, this may not be the place to go.  Don't get me wrong, the quality of the food is really good but I'm not a raw fish sushi connoisseur.  I usually go with the different varieties of sushi rolls like the Dragon roll, Firecracker roll, 49er roll etc. many that usually involve some kind of fried or cooked fish or seafood.  The prices are very reasonable and if look online  you can even find a coupon for 15% off dine-in which makes the food taste even better.  Kitaro is a good place for a casual lunch or dinner, nothing fancy, just good food.  The place is kinda small but is worth trying out.  When you're in the neighborhood stop by.
author: Food R.

description:
BF brought me here the night he asked me out.

Good food for good prices. I stop by whenever I'm in the area and can find parking.
author: michelle h.

description: Prices are cheap here, but the taste of the food is average. Katsu is dry every time. Fried Shrimp (not tempura) is usually bland. The chicken karage isn't so bad. The service is also average.
author: Tracy F.

description:
Food is reasonably priced and not bad but somehow this place lost its luster.  Everything is average.  Priced for averageness (which is at least fair) but still average.  Sushi rolls are fine.  Won't blow your mind. 

If you go expecting greatness, you will be disappointed.  Not bad.  Not great.  Udon is average.  Most of the bento boxes are average.

Have you started seeing a theme?  Average...
author: Aron L.

description:
Kitaro is my favorite sushi restaurant! I always start with the Firecracker roll to get my taste buds fired up...WOO! 

Many of my co-workers and I stop here at least once a week to unwind from the stress of the week. We always have a blast.

You can also find convenient coupons on the back of Safeway's receipts!
author: Kayla W.

description:
food: 3/5
service: 5/5
decor/cleanliness: 4/5 typical asian place

Kitaro is a place which has been around for many years in Geary. I've eaten here a handful of times. This place has all the typical japanese dishes such as sushi plates, teriyaki, and noodles. This place doesn't ever disappoint but it doesn't wow me either. The staff is always nice here and try to serve in a timely manner even when it is busy. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but I won't mind if someone suggests it.
author: Cecile S.

description: Uninteresting.  My friend was excited to take me here when I came up to visit him.  As both of us were bargain hunters, he assured me that this place would be right for me.  You get what you pay for is not really a bargain you see.  Albeit the average price of the rolls here are cheaper than the rest of the sushi restaurants, the rolls are not interesting in terms of taste and look.  It is like forcing yourself to eat the last bits of food when you are satiated but obliged to not waste any food.  This review has to be cut short because there is nothing else to say about this restaurant.
author: Tommy D.

description:
What happened to this place? My boyfriend and I came here a few weeks ago, after a short hiatus from the restaurant, and could not believe how awful the food had become. 

Sure, Kitaro was never a five star restaurant, their rolls were always kind of messy and mediocre, but they were still a solid three stars in my book, because of the value.

Sadly, I can barely rate it a one star establishment anymore. The rolls were so, so dinky. I'd say the ratio was 90% rice and only 10% filling. Plus, the "Pink Dragon Roll" we ordered tasted like it had been sitting out for hours and reheated for us. In fact, the capers were a tell tale sign of reheating, they were shrunken and shriveled. The salmon that lay on top of the roll was dry and tasteless. My boyfriend and I were so offended by the quality of the food, we left a 6% tip or something equally atrocious. 

On the bright side, I guess we'll never have to worry about finding parking in this area again.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Went as part of a large group and they were very accommodating, The food came out fast and was delicious!
author: Sarah M.

description: I ordered my bento box with tuna and salmon sashimi. Now I know they don't have the freshest fish and what not , but what I got was terrible. My salmon was decent , but my tuna was hard , with a grainy texture . The worst I have ever had. The tuna literally made me sick after attempting to eat one. How can you serve this to your customers ?
author: Melody Q.

description:
Food: meh
Value: super
Service: fine

As other Yelpers have said, the quality is just so-so. The salmon, unagi, and hamachi were pretty good. The mackerel wasn't as fresh - smelled a little fishy. But at $2.69 for 2 pieces? Anywhere else the MINIMUM price would be $3.95 or $4.95 for 2 pieces of sushi. I was also pleasantly surprised at the size of the portion - ample.

Service was polite and efficient.
author: Francesca A.

description:
cheap sushi seems to be what ppl come here for. after a long day of driving and heading back to sf, we stopped here for a late lunch.

ordered a few rolls, and a bento box.

the rolls were okay, forget the chicken teriyaki roll, DRY and blah
the only one that was decent was the kamikaze? the spicy yellowtail one...
the beef teriyaki was good.
surprisingly the vegetable potato croquette was yummy, i thought i wouldn't like it but it was pretty good, crispy and there are veggies inside and had flavor.

overall cheap and parking wasn't too bad at 3pm on a saturday.
author: Christine M.

description:
I used to like this place a lot more before....but last few times I've been here everything tasted pretty bland.  The chicken terriyaki I had recently had no flavor whatsoever and same with the salad dressing. 

The portions are good size here for the price, and for the most part, prices are pretty cheap for japanese food.
author: Justin L.

description: my go-to neighbodrhood japanese restaurant. the food is always consistent and the prices are super reasonable. i love getting the beef udon (beef is really tender compared to most other restaurants' beef udon), the combo dinner boxes, and the sushi.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I would've given it a 3 star but the sushi is SOOOO fresh!!
it's not BAD service, but it's neglectful service.  We didn't even get water for the first 10 minutes, I had to ask her for water & tea.

But back to the food.  The sushi here was the freshest sushi I think i've ever ate.  We ordered the rainbow roll, 49er roll & some yellowtail roll. + tempura udon & miso soups.  MMM MMM MMM...
The sushi literally MELTS in your mouth...no joke~

Great prices for great sushi!! :)
author: Sarah L.

description:
Stop. 
This place smells like feet.
Can I get a side of Odor Eaters with my sashimi, please?
Any place with a bad smell is sure to make the food smell bad too.
author: Alex H.

description: Good if you are on a budget. My friend and I came here because little Tokyo was closed. It may be cheap, but the portions are small and the fish isn't very fresh. The service was good though.
author: Christina D.

description:
I've eaten at this restaurant when they were on Geary & 23rd.  I've never been back 'cuz it was always so crowded and they were very disorganized with the seating back then.  I thought I'd give this place another try today.  To my disappointment, it hasn't changed much.  The 'waiting' area (if you call it that) is so cramped; there isn't anywhere to stand; we had to keep shifting around to get out of either the waitresses or the customers way.

Price is right for what you get. The environment felt kinda "hole-in-the-wall" -ish.  If you're not looking for fancy and just want any ordinary bento box, this is the place to go.  ...so sad, I was looking forward to sukiyaki...not on the menu, so I settled with udon.  The fried tofu appetizer was tasty!
author: Alice C.

description: I'm not that into Japanese food (I know, I'm weird) so the fact that I come here on a regular basis says a lot. I always get the bento with tempura and chicken karaage. I dip the karaage in the spicy mayo it comes with and it's heaven in my mouth! I can't really speak on the freshness of the sushi cuz I'm no expert, but I've tried a couple of their rolls and they're all pretty tasty...the firecracker is a must when I come. Parking can be tough but the prices are very affordable and if you sign up for their mailing list you get 15% off cards in the mail.
author: Caralisa L.

description: Decent food with good prices.  I ordered to-go so cant really say anything about the service but the restaurant itself looked nice. Others say the rolls are pretty big but I felt it was in the wrong direction. The rolls were large in diameter, but it wasnt from there being more fish, it was pretty much from there being more rice around the roll than is standard. The quality seemed ok, but you do get less fish in your rolls for the lower price and rice seems to make up some of that difference. Overall not bad if youre craving sushi, arent looking to spend too much, and are ok with averagish quality.
author: Henry W.

description: The one place I go to for my everyday sushi eating , great prices always a good time when i eat here
author: Seaera T.

description:
