Speed of service 5 stars
Price 4 stars
variety and flavor 3 stars
This is a good place to take someone that isn't into different types of sushi.  They have some traditional and other types chicken sushi rolls to get a taste.  It was quick and fast.  I could have done without wind chill factor everytime the door was opened.  The curtain didn't help.  They just need to rethink the entrance a nice japanese panel or something please
author: Nikki W.

description:
Yes, Kitaro is affordable.
Yes, turnover is fast enough, that you shouldn't have to wait more than 45 minutes for a seat.  
Yes, you get good portions for the money.
No, my friends and I have never gotten sick from eating here.
Yes, this place is fine if you have indiscriminate kids.
No, it's not a magic trick when your tea pot slides across the table.

Regardless of what we order, everything has sort of the same taste.  It's not bad, mind you.  It's just not distinct or special.  And I hate the sauce used to spice up the "spicy tuna."

With so many sushi places in SF, I tend to pass on Kitaro.  Personally, I'd rather spend just a few more bucks elsewhere, and get better quality.  But if we're in the mood for cheap sushi that won't kill us, Kitaro is definitely an option.  2.5 stars.
author: John L.

description:
i like the pricing!
Quick.
Efficient.
 I don't know where i can get sushi at this price nowadays, really. although the food is not overly Fancy, it's good. it's a place i would go to, to just kick it or a simple lunch. 
parking around geary is usually tough though.
author: Veranna N.

description:
favorite place to go for mass quantities of sushi.  4 stars because food quality is decent but the prices are CHEAP!  usually order sushi platter special and then a bunch of rolls.  udon is mediocre.  teriyaki chicken is decent.  if you have non-West Coast visitors and want to treat them without breaking the bank, this is the place to go!

can get crowded during peak times.  parking is very scarce in the neighborhood.  bathroom is fairly clean.  service is pretty quick, even on busy nights
author: JL G.

description:
Kitaro has great sushi for the price.  I think they have great sushi period. 

You can taste the love in the Pink Dragon and the Godzilla roll is a must-order as well.
author: Matt O.

description:
Went tonight for the first time... The place is small, so if you're uncomfortable with having no privacy, stay away. There was less than 6" between our table and the next. Whatever.

A friend got the vegetable udon, she wasn't stoked on it, said it had too much melon. But really, I didn't come for soup.

The dynamite roll burned a hole in my mouth, but in a good way. Very good roll. We joked that it smelled like ketchup at first. And then it shut us up. Roll: 1, Us: 0. 

I don't remember the names of the other rolls but everything was good. It wasn't amazing, but the two of us ate for like $25.  Compared to the place next door, with the $60 sushi-for-two, I'd say it was decent. I'm sure the place has better fish, and you'd get more of it, but this wasn't a special occasion or anything, just a Tuesday.

Not amazing. But way cheap, and healthier than eating at Gordo.
author: jared c.

description: THIS PLACE ROCKS!!! Not only is the Sushi EXTREMELY Cheap but its Awesome! even for the non Seafood Sushi Lovers, get the Irish Roll Or Spicy Chicken Rolls Both are really Good
author: Chris H.

description:
On the frugal side in this economic mess?  Kitaro's the place to go to splurge on sushi in the richmond.

Rainbow, alaskan, hawaii, firecracker...rolls, just to name a few, along with chicken teriyaki, are enough to leave you bloated while keeping your pocket in tact.

We always dine for two (or pick up) and ordering all those rolls plus a few more just keeps the bill, with tip, at the 30 mark.  Not bad at all.
author: JC R.

description:
Been here a few times, dining in and ordering to go.  The food is good for the money.  You can rack up combos on the bento box menu for variety.  And they give you some good options.  So how's this place any different than the other places?  It's not really.  There's nothing here that stands out.  The food is good enough for me to keep going back, but I can't say I'm loyal to this place because the competition's so thick in these parts.

It's usually crowded and that's a good thing when it comes to food.  But I don't really like the dining experience because you sit pretty close to others and sometimes feel like asking them to pass the salt--I mean soy sauce.  For a busy place, they're efficient with take-outs.
author: optimus r.

description: Cheap. Semi crowded. Ok food. Good bento deals. Best to go with a maximum of 4. Gets your stomache satisfied.
author: Kelly H.

description:
This place is great for really cheap sushi, really fast.

Had the Kitaro roll, San Francisco roll, and Dynamite Roll. It all came out to be about $14 with tax and tip.

It was really decent. Nothing too fancy. The food comes out fast.
author: Angela A.

description: Cheap as heck and gets the job done. The chicken in the katsu could have been better quality. But, we ate like kings for $12. And, everything was tasty. Sad I found it right before leaving SF.
author: Andrew K.

description: I used to go here with friends during high school and have been there a few times after, but Kitaro has to be by far the worst and most UNAUTHENTIC tasting Japanese restaurant I've tried so far. Prices aren't exactly cheap and the service is pretty horrible and inattentive, and the food less than mediocre. There are better places in this city to try if you want Japanese in my opinion.
author: Petra S.

description:
KITARO. 

I simply MUST say something to all those who are seeing quality, high-end, sophisticated sushi here: DON'T.

This is not the place to seek such earthly delights. This is the place though to seek out fresh, cheap-ass discount sushi rolls if you are a student, low on funds, late on rent, are not pretentious, are not obsessed with genuine authenticity of Japanese cuisine for the sake of saving some cash for other things of value like beer and a movie and possible dinner tomorrow, or like me for computer repairs, utility bills, art supplies, etc. etc. This place will feed you well, If you cast aside your snotty attitude and notice how many Japanese students go here and do not mind it at all, how crowded it is every lunch time and night, and how actually fresh the rolls are. Yes, there is no need to even order Nigiri (note 3 and 4 dollar rolls and stick with them.) If you can despite all your bills afford something more, get Godzilla and Rainbow  rolls, and you will no go hungry. Hey, for these prices you can actually go home sated and not broke. 

God knows I love me real kick-ass sushi. You can go to Shimo on Clement, and it will be amazing, authentic, it will blow your hair back, melt your faces, whatever good stuff is supposed to do. But this isn't upscale shit right here. Its affordable, its as Americanized as a Teriyaki burger or a Breakfast Burrito, but its as delicious if you only get down from your cloud and join the real world. When I went to college my friends were Japanese students who would take me here all the time. Yes, they would snicker at California Rolls, obviously, they don't have them in Japan, obviously, it's a shameful concept.... but we all were students, all were broke, and it was healthy, tasty, and cheap,   as are crepe stands in Japantown.  I lived in Richmond next to this place for seven years, and this year I am back living two blocks away from it again, and boy did I miss its simple charm. 

So here, had to take a star off because it isn't a sushi place per se, but  otherwise, i have no problem with it at all.
author: Maria O.

description: I had to come and take off a star because they raised the prices. Not col Kitaro, you were my go to spot, I came here every week.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
This place is small, about 10 small tables, but worth a shot if you want fairly cheap sushi rolls. 

I dont recommend getting Nigiri as their fish is nothing to write home about - but the rolls are interesting. The Godzilla roll is pretty tasty and honestly I've never had a bad roll at Kitaro. They have a good verity of rolls and if you're not too picky about your sushi this place will be pretty good. 

I'll be the first to admit that when I am itching for some cheap party tray sushi take out - i give Kitaro a call.

I wasnt impressed by their katsu, and the Udon was very average. Hence the three stars. Given that parking in that part of Geary is a pain, I'd only recommend this place if you're already in the area and dont want to go out of your way for much better (but more expensive) sushi at Negano or Kabuto. 

The place next door - Little Tokyo, is pretty decent too. If its busy at Kitaro you'll be just as well of going next door.
author: Katya B.

description:
When I need a sushi fix and don't want to pay a lot...I come here b/c it's in my area. This place is pretty cheap, but the quality isn't that great either. Basically, you get what you pay for. This place is pretty spacious and accomodating. It's always filled with college students late at night.

I would recommend:

DYNAMITE ROLL: spicy tuna with tempura and spicy sauce

RAINBOW ROLL: I like getting this roll at all sushi places b/c it's a hodgepodge of stuff--crab, albacore, tuna, and salmon w/ avocado and tobiko sauce.

GOZILLA ROLL: tempura spicy tuna roll topped with a wasabi based sauce.

SPIDER ROLL: tempura soft shelled crab
author: Ivy L.

description:
Food is consider decent for the price you have to pay for Japanese food.  They accommodate groups too.  It's ok for a group of non-picky eaters. 
Service was nice and friendly.

Nothing stood out, just like most said: Mediocre is the name of the game here.
author: Vanna S.

description:
I would say if you have kids, then Kitaro is a good place to eat. It is cheap compared to other Japanese restaurants. The seating is very close to each other so if you feel claustrophobic, then this is not the place to be. 
This place has gone down since I last came here. The sushi does not taste good, but if you are hungry, and you don't have much cash, then it tastes pretty good. Some sushi rolls are as cheap as $3.99. 
Today I had the pink dragon roll with raw salmon, but the salmon was very thin that i barely tasted any.
The Godzilla roll was good too, but after two pieces, you would begin to feel like it is soggy and tastes too much like wasabi. And the tuna inside the Godzilla roll doesn't taste like anything at all.
The Spicy Udon was good, but if you get extra spicy, the soup will choke you mainly because the soup tastes like powder mixed with water. I'm not sure what the other choices of spicy tastes like, but I wouldn't choose super spicy again. 
Our waitress was nice to us, but it was hard to get her attention when we wanted something. There are however bad waitresses here also. I asked another lady for the check because our waitress was no where to be found, and she said she would come back with the check. talking to my boyfriend, i didn't know that 10 minutes had passed and still no check. It took us another 5 minutes to find our waitress and asked for the check again. 
Come here if you like, there is nothing wrong with the place, its just I've tasted better Japanese food.
author: Jenni W.

description:
You wonder how one block can have so many sushi places on it, on a street without much foot traffic.

My theory is that everyone goes for Kitaro, and then if they don't feel like waiting end up trying one of the other places.  Kitaro really needs to expand.

Cheap sushi, but good quality.  Many vegan sushi options (but no kampyo :(  Yes, I know I'm the only one who noticed).  Parking really sucks here.  The wait time can be annoying too, for a table and for some of the people in your group to get food.  For some reason the vegan rolls come the slowest.

And now I want some Sushi.  Dang it all.
author: Nessie V.

description:
For giving this place 3 stars, I come here a shameful amount of time. Anyhow, I'll list my cons first, because I always like good news last:

1) Bad parking
2) Bad parking
3) Waitstaff somehow makes me feel as little and unimportant as a loud, untipping teenager here.
4) Rather rushed service.
5) Sometimes forget items, such as tea or an order of sushi roll.
6) Sushi rolls are a slight step below Sushi Rock rolls.

Pros:

1) Bad parking forces one to walk off dinner.
2) One feels able to eat body weight in cheap sushi rolls because parked far, far away.
3) Can be on most casual behavior here. I take the opportunity to make tiny origami out of my chopstick wrapper and make wasabi volcanoes in soy sauce tray.
4) Super quick. And cheap.
5) If eyes are bigger than stomach, there's always possibility waiter/waitress forgot an item and you will be saved from your own gluttony.
6) Makes one appreciate the quality of a chain like Sushi Rock, and REALLY appreciate quality of places like Tataki.

Summary: No matter how you look at this place, whether positively or negatively, you cannot deny that this place is CHEAP and FAST. And no matter how much we may bash those qualities, I ask you people, what would the world be without CHEAP and FAST food for those lazy nights?
author: Anna S.

description: Even though over 600 reviews gave them 3 I give them 4 stars. I still like coming here esp if you can remember the old hole on the wall kitaro that was across the street with like 3 seats. Dynamite rolls are awesome...good portioned bentos...good tea...fast service and reasonable prices.Wish parking was better though.
author: Ro M.

description:
Bad...

Not very clean.

Chicken not cooked enough.

Sushi served warmer than room temperature.

Bad service.

Not real japanese sushi rice.

Tight seating.

Avoid.
author: Max L.

description:
In the general sushi world a 3 star, but for its very dialed in mainstream cafe style a 3.5-4. Friendly menu made it easy to tackle for many of the foreign travelers we were surrounded by. Shockingly low prices for the prep and food quality. I've had some pretty lousy food at other similar types of Japanese cafe places for much more in pricing. Some food leaned to the too sweet -- enough so, that our little one was going for mouthfuls of pickled ginger to get the teriyaki sugar taste out of her mouth!

The salmon that was covered in said sauce was a very handsome and perfectly cooked and prepped piece. 

Other bonuses: Extra friendly and helpful staff. Easy parking -- it's in the part of Geary in the avenues with many parking opps. Excellent nigiri quality especially considering pricing -- apparently they get so much consistent business they can get more high quality fish and go through it quickly...Get onto their mailing lists for great offers and notices...
author: Tanya P.

description: Where else can two people eat sushi or sashimi for a total of less than $30 - for two people?  I always get the Spider Roll and Rainbow Roll.  And, for those who do not like raw fish, their terraykied chicken is quite good - and reasonably priced.  I have just about always found the service excellent and the prices absolutely unbelievable - and I actually think the sushi is good. I take everything there I know who will eat raw fish.  another great aspect is the location - not that far from Cliff House - and the ocean.  Have a glass of wine at the Cliff House, go for a lovely walk, then go to Kitaros for dinner !  Ideal for out of town visitors.
author: Revere R.

description: The food was decent and cheap but the service was god awful. We were sat down and within 30 seconds asked for our order. Another 30 seconds goes by and there's a different waiter asking us again. This happens 2 more times until we finally decide. When my friend ordered mochi ice cream he was only allowed to order 1 serving. The waitress refused to give him 2!! It's his money what the heck?
author: Jacob T.

description:
Eating at Kitaro is like having the heavens open up and God smile down on me. It's cheap and yummy. The wait staff is pretty cool and i have never had to wait for a table for longer than 10 minutes. It's an ideal sushi place for anyone living in the Richmond and well worth it if you don't. I recommend Kitaro to all my friends and always bring my out of town friends here. 

Ps. Order the Firecracker roll, you wont be sorry.
author: Morgan E.

description:
First of all, I don't judge food based on the price.  But there is a reason why this place is cheap.

The first time I ate here the food was horrible (not to mention the service).  The sushi I tried tasted like the fish was over a day old, or atleast had sat out in the sun for that part of the day.  It was so bad that I didn't finish my tekka maki (which I ALWAYS finish).  

On top of that my soda was flat too.  I mean wtf, how can you have flat soda that came from a can? Perhaps it sat out in the sun just like the fish.

The only reason I give this place two stars is that one time I had their take out and I actually liked it.  But beyond that... I would not eat here again.
author: Serge S.

description:
For the price, you cant beat it.  Most people inside know not to order nigiri or sashimi.  Its all about the speical rolls for $3 to $5 or a bento/donburi bowl.   They have a bento lunch special thats pretty good.   my favorite roll:  The surfer roll has tuna poke and seaweed salad, or the one with spicy tuna then tempura fried with a sciracha sauce.
they have efficient service and acceptable everything, but this is a fast, eat station.  not fine dining.
i can usually fill up and be out of there for $15
author: Christian W.

description:
This place delivers you nice cheap sushi. If you don't know what sushi is, this is a good place to start. The prices are really reasonable. That way if you goto a better sushi joint, you wouldn't have that "ripped off" feeling. Someone that knows sushi would know that you can expect to pay a lot more for some pieces. I love my sushi, I would pay the extra bit for some quality. This place... doesn't do it for me
PS: I've seen coupons on the back of Ocean Beach Safeway receipts that gives your some decent discounts for Kitaro
author: Dao C.

description: A busy sushi spot where your palate does not have to be tied to your wallet. Simply the best sushi in the Richmond District, my usual is the combination sashimi that comes with a generous portion of salmon, tuna, octopus, and another fish. I also like their spicy tako roll, and my friend from the Richmond District had the Eel plate that's by far the most generous portion of eel I've seen. The fish is fresh and the service is fast and efficient. Ambiance is warm, festive, and simple, but the noise level can be high and distracting. If you're planning to make a trip out there, be sure to arrive early as it gets very crowded at lunch and dinner.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Really, if you think I come to Kitaro for their fresh sushi and good japanese food...psht..pleasseee! I'm there 'cause I have a 15% off coupon on the back of my local Safeway receipt! 

Where else can you get full off of Japanese food for $10 or $12 out the door at a place that's relatively decent compared to the two/three (subject to change every few years) other japanese restaurants on the block?!? Granted their sushi is not pulsating in raw, juicy freshness, Kitaro's does its job of fillin' me up...plus it's close by. This is really not a place for the food critic...

p.s., their take-out sushi platters are always a hit at potlucks too...and it's so easy.
author: Jeremy F.

description:
So i went here ealier today for lunch. 
decided to go to this one instead of the other sushi place cause i haven't tried this place. at noon there wasn't much action inside so i didn't have to wait. The service at that time was only 2 waiter (1 waiter is the hostess) With only 2 or 3 other people eating inside the service was decent. 

When i walked in here, my first impression was... "What's that smell...?"
To me it smelled like a public bathroom. Like the smell of pee mixed with cleaner. It wasn't really disturbing or really dank.. it was just unusual. The food tasted decent. ordered the assorted sashimi, yellowtail sashimi, and the tempura udon. the sashimi tasted pretty good, as well as the udon. The prices i guess seemed... normal? or i guess a little cheaper than average. the total was about 35~

Yes parking does suck, but i just happen to live close.

Maybe i'll come back..
author: Daniel H.

description:
Affordable, fresh, delicious sushi. It's really quite simple. They aren't fancy, but they provide an excellent meal. I love their specialty rolls, especially the alaska roll. They always have the best salmon. Also, all of their spicy style rolls are great, like the firecracker and the dynamite, and the pink dragon is very tasty (it comes very hot though, careful!!)

I can also recommend their unagi donburi highly, and I am a personal fan of their miso soup. There are four or so sushi places on that block, and out of them Kitaro's is my choice. I've found sushi comparable to theirs or as good, but not as good and at the right price as this restaurant provides.
author: Adam A.

description:
More like SH*TARO's!

I came here because my sister said it was similar to my favorite sushi joint in my hometown, Yo Sushi.  EEK!!  Methinks not!

Yes they're cheap and yes they're filling but I do not like filling my stomach with crap.  The inside is very cute and clever but those are the only nice things that I can say about Kitaro's.  The roll's arrived and they were all bland and tasteless.  I was seriously afraid to finish the rolls in fear of food poisoning or something like that.  I will never understand why there were so many people here for the less than mediocre sushi.  I think I would rather go to Sushi House than to here....OH MY!
author: Anna H.

description:
I  will not ever go here for raw fish.  I ONLY eat the cooked rolls.  They are not as neatly rolled as at other sushi restaurants -they come in all different sizes and sometimes fall apart even when you are careful in eating them.  Sometimes, avocado that is not yet ripe is used in the rolls.  

But, you can order a whole bunch of sushi for very little money, especially with the coupons that come in value packs and on the back of supermarket receipts.  Two people can eat a whole bunch of sushi for well under $20.
author: Cara C.

description:
Sushi is supposed to be:
So tasty and fresh, you should be able to taste the ocean.

Kitaro:
Lots of spicy tuna and fried rolls

Sushi101:
Spicy tuna and other heavily flavored raw fish sushi is a method for the restaurant to get rid of fish from earlier in the week (normal practice and is acceptable) or one way of having a lower food cost and therefore charge lower prices but sacrificing quality (shady and unacceptable).

Kitaro's rolls were mostly all spicy, or fried. There were barely any rolls with fresh fish. But then again, I don't expect good sushi in the Richmond.
author: benjamin c.

description:
If you're looking for cheap Japanese food, this is the place. The quality of the food isn't that bad also. I love coming here to eat because it doesn't kill my wallet or anything.

They have a good bento box selection. I usually order the Teriyaki Chicken & Shrimp Tempura. Pretty good. The Salmon Teriyaki is also good too.

I LOVE their Philadelphia Roll. I was a bit skeptic in the beginning because I never ate fish with cream cheese but now I'm hooked! 

One thing that sucks about this restaurant is the size. If you're planning on having a big birthday dinner here, good luck. It's usually pack (on weekends) and they don't do reservation.
author: Wilson Z.

description: I think it's hard for a really cheap place to be great. And this place is very very cheap. I brought my boyfriend here recently for lunch. It was a little after one, and there was no line. I had the spicy udon with the california roll, and my boyfriend had the philly roll and one of the rolls with tempura. I was disappointed by my california roll and his philly roll, which I thought were really skimpy. The spicy udon though was to die for. I must not have read the menu correctly because I didn't realize that it would be topped with onion rings and chicken. I couldn't stop eating it! My boyfriend was pretty happy with his food, especially the miso soup that he received, and best of all, the total for the bill was under $25.
author: Steph G.

description: Food is prepared well. Nicely priced to top it off. Wait staff is not really that bad, just don't expect a first class service. Remember, this is more of a hole in the wall spot than an upscale joint. They take to go orders too. Not a lot of Japanese sushi restaurants do.
author: Jai R.

description:
One Word: Cheap!
Kitaro is a pretty good place to go for satisfying sudden cravings of jap food in the afternoon. Though they dotn have many choices, the food really isnt that bad. i come here all the time to satisfy my chicken karaage needs.  
What dragged it down was... This one creepy waiter that always looked at us.... Every time we went!
Btw..The mochi is not worth it!
author: Lily X.

description:
Literally the cheapest Japanese food restaurant you can find in the city. Even though it may be cheap, the quality here can make you want to throw up. Why? Because twice in a row, I had food poison from this place. I honestly don't know why you would want to come here unless you want a cheap Japanese dinner. 

Be safe ~ and don't get FP like me
author: William C.

description: Has some cheap rolls. Foods ok. Probably the cheapest sushi in the city. Waiters will forget about you. better make that drink last.....
author: Tyler A.

description:
You want a cheap bento box that doesnt taste like sewer? Definately come here. For under 10 bux, a bento dinner box would fill you up....and I eat ALOT. I always order the chicken teriyaki with veggies and shrimp tempura. Thats the ONLY thing I would order from here though. 

The hostess and waitress here are really nice but arent so english-savvy.  I was trying to ask the waitress if I could just get pumpkin tempura instead of the typical brocoli, potatoe, carrots, etc tempura but apparently she doesnt even know what pumpkin is.  So I had to deal wit it and stick wit the mixed veggies tempura. That was my only gripe with this place.
author: Viet N.

description:
People seem to have a problem with this place for hiding their low-quality fish by covering it in sauces.

I say, as a broke college student who loves sushi... what more can one ask for? It's fish cheap enough to be affordable, that taste great thanks to all the great sauces, and doesn't make you sick! The presentation isn't spectacular, but hey, it all looks the same once it's in your mouth, so who cares?
author: A. A.

description:
Sushi is not suppose to leave a greasy film taste in your mouth. Waiters are not suppose to literally get in your face every 5 minutes and ask if I'm ready to order. Customers shouldn't have to sit at the table for 10 minutes before they get a menu, or tea. 

Also, waiters are not suppose to dig into the 1980's bin and wear their neon green hair clips on top of their heads. Okay, I know I know, I shouldn't base my review on one's fashion downfall but could we suck even more?

I walked by many sushi places on the way to this one wondering what makes this one so great. And well now I know, they excel in the subject of 'suck'. 

Though I did leave with a smile on my face knowing I'll finally get to write up a bad review to my normal list of 4's and 5's. Mmmm, this 1 star feels darn good.
author: Oz B.

description:
This place was introduced to me by my bf and from day one, we've been coming here. 
I personally enjoy their bento box, no rice extra salad with California roll. My bf, normally gets the bento box, karage with no rice extra salad and an order of dragon roll. this would get us filled up and satisfied for hours. the prices are reasonable and the service never fails us also. I guess maybe bc they see us so often they seem to know what we like already.
author: MC C.

description: It wasn't that bad for me. I went here for lunch. I have to take off one star for them not serving Asahi Beer though. Anyway, I ordered my usual chicken katasu which tasted great along with a two rolls. I know I've eaten good food when I'm full and to the point of food coma. They were playing "Girl From Impanema" when I was using the bathroom (which was neat and clean) which is quite relaxing to listen to when using the bathroom.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
If you're looking for cheap Japanese food, then this is the place to go.  I used to love this place when I was a kid (and they were still at their old location) but of course, my knowledge about sushi and Japanese food was close to nil at that time as well.  So nowadays, when I am looking for good quality rolls, I go a few doors down to Little Tokyo instead.

Don't get me wrong though, Kitaro still has it's perks.  I can always count on them for speedy service and who doesn't love their bento boxes?  They have some of the best tempuras - light and crunchy and their shrimps are huge as well.  Of course, a visit to Kitaro isn't complete with getting their Spicy Tako Roll and the Firecrackers - yum!
author: Katelynn L.

description:
Still a fan!

My typical lineup: Irish Roll ($3.29), Spicy Tuna or Negihama Maki ($3.19), salad ($1.50), and maybe some Firecrackers or Dynamite if I'm feeling hostile towards my digestive system.

I think that the chicken udon is swell, but would suggest avoiding it if unfamiliar chicken meat origins make you nervous.

Also, be sure to watch your pronunciations: One waiter interpreted "soup and salad" as "seaweed salad", and on another occasion "diet coke" became "dynamite roll." It's like playing telephone! They always clear it up straightaway though.
author: Alys D.

description:
Good sushi, good overall food.
Nice waiter.
Only difficult to find parking
author: fenny g.

description:
I must admit, I don't really eat "real sushi". I pretty much stick to California, tempura,spicy tuna sort of rolls. That being said, Kitaro is a great place for my boring ass pallate. If you're looking for really good fish...not so much. 
You do get a ridiculous amount of food for very cheap. Sushi is good, dinners are good, the udon broth is very tasty. 
Excellent place to go..if you're me.
author: Lauren T.

description: I guess people who come here pretty much knows what they'll be getting: cheap, no frills food.  We came here at around 3 this afternoon for a very early dinner after only a very light lunch earlier.  We had a number of appetizers: edamame, salmon & combination sashimi, tempura, grilled squid and fried oysters.  The edamame tasted very fresh, the octopus in the combination sashimi tasted newly thawed, the fried food were good but made us very thirsty, the squid was pleasantly chewy.  Our servers were both friendly enough.  All those plus an order of gyoza to go only set us back $53 with tip.  Where else can you get this much for so little?
author: Yvette F.

description: Kitaro isn't all that special, but it's a quick fix for anytime I'm craving sushi. For the right amount of money, you get the right amount of food. I usually go for the combo dinner bento box with grilled salmon and teriyaki chicken. Dinner order comes with a small side salad, miso soup, and rice. The portion is quite huge, so I always bring home some leftovers. The sushi is alright, and rolls start at $2.99. I recommend the Firecracker Roll and Spider Roll. Good for groups with 5+ people, but I wouldn't go here for a date. It gets way too busy during dinners and the seats aren't that cozy.
author: Linda T.

description:
hands down my favorite sushi in sf- the maki rolls are very creative and yummy- the prices are phenomenal too. It is not for ambience but for true
sushi enthusiasts
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Decent sushi at a decent price.  Fish SEEMS fresh. There's also a good selection of non-fish sushi for non-fish eating sushi people (like my girlfriend).  Vegetarian rolls a plenty at this spot.  The wait most nights are bearable (15 - 30 minutes).  The seating situation is pretty compacted.  So, be prepared to get snug with strangers and hear other peoples conversations.  Difficult parking. Serves more than sushi.

Final thought: "Large rolls for small money".
author: Darkie L.

description:
Cheap sushi, bad service. A couple of friends and I went here after work because we wanted sushi. We had just gotten in 45 minutes before closing so we figured we had enough time. We ordered and ate and was pretty much talking and finishing our drinks at this point...I guess they were in the process of closing, but that doesn't excuse them for what happened next.

Blame it on bad English skills if you must, this is what was said to me in the most Japanime voice ever. "Excuse me, but could you please pay us and leave?" She then smiles and let's out a Tee Hee and walks away before I could say anything. My friends are totally oblivious because they didn't even know she was there. I tipped, I left.....I haven't been back since, I have no desire to return.
author: James J.

description:
- Everything taste the same.
- Everything look the same.
- Everything feels the same.
- Parking is insane.
- Service is mundane.
- Waiting is lame.
- Price is..... keep the change!
author: Gary T.

description: This place is a regular dinner spot for my family and I. Most recently, the service turned out to be really poor. We wrote our name down on the waiting list and one of the waiters skipped our name and gave another group our table. She didn't even apologize! So not what we're used to. Overall the food is good and reasonable. Service not as friendly.
author: Smart L.

description:
Long day of shopping...
so our friend, the local, suggested this place because he said its cheap.
and we love cheap.
yes, it was cheap so the food was worth the price.
decent but it was not to my liking at all.
I ordered the dinner combo with salmon shio and salmon sashimi.
i love salmon.
and they overcooked mine so it was really dry and barely flavored.
I needed to add tons of extra salt on it but it was so dry it didn't absorb my extra seasoning.
I was surprised the salmon sashimi was edible.
I totally expected that raw, fishy aftertaste in old, frozen fish after I tried my salmon shio but it was fresh.
My friends got the chicken katsu dinner, salmon shio + tempura dinner, and california + sf rolls which all looked mediocre also.
author: Lisa N.

description:
1) If there's a wait, its not so long.
2) Sushi is so cheap, its ridiculous.
3) Food comes within 20 min., well cooked too.
4) Staff is "friendly", they're suppose to be since we're the customers, and customers are always right.
5) Parking sucks -,-.
author: Csndra L.

description:
Kitaro is crowded but that's because people love inexpensive sushi.  The cooked foods here are rubbery.  The fish is huge, the rice nuggets are huge.  There's no elegant way to eat one of their nigiri without gagging.

Do come here if you want to binge on cheap sushi that won't make you sick.  Don't come here if you want anything good.

Kitaro gets one star (from a base of three) because life is too short to eat non-great sushi.
author: Amanibhavam K.

description:
Why do I go there?  To be honest, because it's cheap and big portion.  What else?  Nothing!!  Totally NOTHING!!

I think I know little bit of Japanese food ('cuase I lived there more than 20 years), but sometimes I don't care about quality and I just want to eat Japanese food.  And I don't wanna cook.

The food they have is eatable.  It's almost same as sushi from Safeway or put a teriyaki sauce from a bottle onto your pan-fried chicken.

The service?  They don't have A service.  They don't give a f**k.  

When you come in.  They don't greet.  
They just ask you "How many?"  
When they bring your food, they just mention the name of the menu.  
They don't say "Enjoy the meal" or anything. 
Nobody come to you to ask "How's the meal?" or "How's everything?"  
Even asking them for more water is very hard.  
Because they don't care!! 
You eat, pay, and leave.  That's it!!   
Occasionally, I hear "Thank you."  Yes, very, very occasionally.

They don't have decent courtesy.  Maybe they don't have courtesy at all.

But hey, it's cheap and it's big.
They don't care and I don't care.
They are cheap and I'm cheap too.  
I'll go there again.
author: Mike N.

description: I love kitaro...Only spot in my opinon you can have a really good tasting Japanese lunch/dinner for a affordable price..I always get the chicken teriyaki lunch special with a side of dragon rolls.
author: Allen K.

description: Dunno what happened to my review. But I think this place is decent for the price and the quality. It's not the best place, but for cheap "Japanese" food it's okay.
author: Mandy D.

description: I come here for the bento boxes.  Their teriyaki chicken isn't bad and I feel they serve a decent amount in their bento box meal.  I especially like to order the fried tofu.  I don't really come here for sushi unless someone else I'm with orders any and they share with me.  This place gets pretty busy and is noisy, but it's cheap eats.  You'll have to not mind sitting so close to the others at the tables right next to you and the service is not the greatest either.  Very popular place for the young crowd.
author: Emy B.

description:
Kitaro was the first Japanese restaurant I've ever been to as a child growing up seemed much better when I was a kid.  Unfortunately, as an adult now and having tasted and trying so many other sushi places all over the bay area and so cal, Kitaro is definitely not at the top.

We ordered a teryiaki chicken bento and a few rolls, here's the breakdown.

The chicken was really fatty and not cooked all the way through.
The lettuce in the salad seemed old and they barely put any dressing on top.
The rice was ok, but how can you go wrong with steamed white rice?

The godzilla roll was not that great. It lacked flavor and the spicy tuna was not very spicy at all.

I forget the name of the roll but it had cooked salmon on top, which I thought would be really good being that it was the most expensive roll on the menu... and boy was I wrong. The salmon was very bland and did not have much flavor. There was no sweet or special house sauce that most other sushi restaurants use to drizzle over the rolls.

The only roll we ordered that I enjoyed was the fire cracker. Small portion sizes, but very tasty.

Overall, I was not impressed with the food here.  Although the prices were fairly cheap, I've tasted much better sushi.
author: M L.

description:
i am a big fan of sushi and after eating at so many different places, i consider myself somewhat of a "pro" at knowing which places are good and which arent.

Kitaro = not so great.

everything is really cheap here, so you definitely get what you pay for: rolls with massive amounts of rice and sashimi that is definitely not fresh.

the seating is somewhat tight..tables are really close to each other against the walls.. sorry but i dont really like someone else's booty up against my table while i'm having dinner.
author: M W.

description:
hellllllllla cheap.

got the udon after the big bay to breaker run. perfect way to get my salty back. sushi was not bad.
author: krys s.

description:
i ate here before the end of the summer.. so sorry for another late post.

i wasn't feeling too hungry, so i just had a simple udon noodle with wakame. it was good, nothing too special, and reasonably priced.

my friends ordered chicken katsu udon and the bento boxes and they were both full afterwards.

come if you're in the area, but if not, there are better japanese places to eat in sf!
author: Diane L.

description:
I love Kitaro. For vegetarians and vegans, this is the sushi place for you. They have above average veggie options and the price is more than right. I like the Pumpkin maki, sweet potato maki and don't forget to get a veggie Mexican roll. YUM. 

Parking can be painful on the weekends and there is often a wait. The longest I've waited is about 20 minutes. Service is generally good but people do not get their food at the same time. There can be a 10 minute time difference.
author: Laura V.

description:
Keep in mind that this place is not Japanese owned.  If you're looking for good quality sashimi or sushi, walk away.  If you want the fancy stuff like toro, mirugai, uni, then you're definitely not going to find it here.  BUT... if you want super cheap rolls that leave you satisfied, then it's definitely worth a try.

They have a huge list of rolls, and a wide variety of bento boxes as well.  I typically order the 49er, Kamikaze, and Alaskan.  The rolls here are huge and very very cheap, so 2 rolls are plenty for me!  The bento boxes are also very worth it and the chicken karaage is actually quite good.

The main reason why I come here is because it's CHEAP...and far better than shoving greasy fast food down my throat.
author: Mai S.

description:
I remember this place from when it was the hole-in-the-wall joint across the street.  I rarely go here anymore, but now I think of it as the place where the tea cups roam the table on their own.  Kinda spooky, but when the table is wet from all the tea I've spilled on the table, those tea cups slide across.  

Anyway, I came recently and ordered the assorted sashimi and my husband ordered the assorted hamachi, plus the rock 'n roll and alaskan roll.  We thought the hamachi tasted pretty decent.  I love yellow tail.  Sure, it wasn't the greatest, but for the money, you get 8 hearty-sized pieces with a giant scoop of rice.  It's not the best quality, but I think at Kitaro, we go for quantity and not quality.  Come on people.  It's cheap eats.  As for the rest of my assorted sashimi - tuna, mackerel and salmon, well it wasn't as good as the hamachi.  Plus our extra rolls were full of rice.  I hate when they stuff you with rice.  My stomach just gets bloated.  

I gave it a 4, but it's more like a 3 1/2.  As long as I don't get sick off the sashimi, for that price, it's good enough for me.
author: Stacey C.

description:
I dunno if it's because there's  sushi joint on every corner of Geary, but this place was super cheap!

Greta seaweed salad, spicy tuna roll, tempura roll, sprider roll, and Philadelphia rolls. 

Quick (cold) service, and a mellow, date-place atmosphere.
author: Lauren S.

description: Sister-location of Kiki's sushi makes it a easy transition for whoever is used to their menu.  Kitaro is a little smaller but they do pack people in quite easily.  The service is good but can be a little pushy when the place gets full.  The food is good for the price and ordering takeout is quicker than any other sushi place I've tried. Alaskan and 49er roll are my favs.
author: Jesse C.

description: I'm a regular here - my friends and I love this place. Its very affordable sushi, good service, consistent quality, convenient location - what else could you ask for? A real "bang for your buck" type of place.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Kitaro definitely deserves higher ratings.  Maybe the service and food is different everytime but my friends and i had a great meal here.  The prices are great and its not premium sushi but you're not paying a premium sushi price.
Kiki's has higher ratings but if you get to choose between Kitaro and Kikis definitely go with Kitaro, they give you more for the exact same price and tastier.
author: Shelley T.

description:
During the day when its not busy the servers generally tolerate customers a little more than at dinnertime. It can get crowded during dinner rush, but finding a table never seems to be the problem. 

Their food is fast and cheap. Sushi here is not to die for but will fix a sushi craving.
author: Jane N.

description:
Just because you can put some fish on a lump of rice doesn't make you a sushi joint. It's cheap, yes, but it's not all that, and you do get what you pay for. Cutting corners for sushi is like cutting corners on freakin' everything that demands quality. Well, if you're down for that, so be it, but I'd rather go to Godzila or Ebisu and pay a little extra for something that doesn't make me feel queasy.

Oh yah, and what's that weird second floor thing? It bugs the CRAP out of me.
author: Charlene L.

description:
Do you like horrible sushi? If so, you've found your Mecca. Go west, young (wo)man!

Seriously, Safeway sushi is better than this.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
I went there from after someone recommended it.  Thinking back, I should never have gone since she made a point of how "cheap" it is.  That is not a selling point for me when it comes to food, especially sushi. 
The place has no ambiance, there were many big groups with kids, it was loud and chaotic. Plus the parking in that neighborhood is horrible. 
The food was ok at best, well, maybe not even ok.  I was a little hesitant to order raw fish since the place is kind of gross.  I don't remember what I ate...some gyoza or a bento something or other...very forgettable.  
Oh yeah, cheap it is.  Who cares.
author: Nilu r.

description:
I've never really enjoyed sushi until my friend took me to Kitaro. I also had a party of 20+ there for my birthday. I thought it'd be a hassle since they don't take reservations but it was pretty convenient.
Gotta LOVE their 'PINK DRAGON ROLL' - absolutely delish.
Their 'FIREFRACKER' is a kick too.
Parking is a bit hard to find when it's busy and sometimes the staff will be too busy but overall, it's good, cheap sushi!
author: Jenny Y.

description: Their food is pretty good. I used to come here with my friends all the time because the food was cheap. I love the spider roll! They put RICE in their green tea that gives it a little different taste, sometimes I like it but sometimes it just taste weird. I haven't been here in a while, I hope to go back soon. On their website you can sign up for their so called 'prize' in which they will send you a 10% coupon.
author: Janet Z.

description:
Good thing I don't like raw stuff except uni yumm.. Well I give this place 4 stars because of the price and the sushi they have, except sashimi aka raw fish!

My friend order the bento or combo ?? I'm not sure what it's called but they serve you on square box with divider... something like that hehehe... It's cheap! $5 for salad, miso, rolls, rice and dish that you ordered whether  chicken, tempura or beef?? I don't usually order this but my friend satisfied with it. 

I always get uni, spider roll and dragon roll! 

Parking... humm you need to be patient to find parking there because its hard to find parking except you are lucky.

well bottom line... Don't except the sushi will be spectacular but it's good enough for the price that they offer. If you want to find spectacular sushi especially raw stuff then don't be so cheap.
author: Fenny G.

description: I dont like Kitaro just because Japanese food is my second favorite food. The service there is really great. whenever i go there, there is never one time that my water glass was empty. The prices there are extremely reasonable. my friend and i were expecting to be short on mula but we ended up having a surplus. the food there is great. i kept ordering and ordering until i was satysfied, which was 6 orders.
author: Terrance Z.

description: You know, this place is pretty damn good. It's cheap. It's fresh. The service was pretty good. I will definitely be back!
author: Lauren S.

description:
It gets two stars for being cheap and edible. It hasn't made me sick and I don't end up spending $12 on a roll.

The service is mediocre at best. Every single time I have ordered miso soup I have to ASK for a spoon! The food is okay.
author: Val V.

description:
It's cheap and won't make you sick (unlike every chinese run FUNE-style joint where they leave the pieces going around the conveyor for HOURS until they are dry like a piece of wax).

The only positive thing I can say about Kitaro is that it's the cheapest acceptable sushi in the City.  Do yourself a favor and go two doors down to Sushi Tomo.  You'll spend a few bucks more but get considerably better fish.
author: Eric X.

description:
The food here is cheap and is relatively fresh. They let you eat in peace even though they are crowded. The staff is not too friendly and the service is not that great. This is a good place for some cheap and quick food. 

I would recommend this place as long as your expectations are realistic.
author: Amlan S.

description:
Question for the fellow Yelpers, how many of ya'll remember when this place was across the street?  Didn't think so.  

This place has been around for as long as the non-traditional sushi craze has been around.  I used the come here all the time, but then I learned I was freaking allergic to seafood!  Why, o why hath yee cursed me allergies, to what I love!  

Hey I live 'round here and parking is a pain in the @$$, so its always a nice half mile jaunt over here.
author: patrick o.

description:
Not the best sushi place in the bay area.  You can find cheap japanese food here, even cheaper if you have a coupon.  I was always against coming to Kitaro because it is not good, it is not authentic, and it's stuffy in there.  I do come here because it's close to my house or if I do feel like cheap sushi roll, I will come here.  I only eat rolls here because the sashimi is not fresh and I wouldn't pay the price for it.  Not a great place but decent for ppl who wants cheap sushi.  Good place for sushi platters since you're feeding other people. 

If you want good sushi, go to Kabuto couple of blocks down Geary.
author: Kapo T.

description:
Decent for for cheap sushi that won't make you sick. The tuna sashimi is the best thing to get here! Its 12 bucks for what looked like 10 generous slices of fresh Maguro. I even dug the poor man's lettuce that came on the side. 
Service is fast and efficent, so its my choice for a quick eat ijn the hood.
author: Stacy T.

description:
Yeah, I tried and tried, but I just can't help it. I do like Kitaro. 

I like them so much that I have them on speed dial on my cell phone and probably order take-out from them once a week! I have found myself calling them when I am on the bus and swinging by to pick my order up before I get home. 

I'll admit...it's not the best quality of sushi. But their rolls are pretty decent and the price is dirt cheap. I usually order 1 godzilla roll, 1 rainbow roll, 1 philly roll, and if i want to splurge, I also get 1 spider roll.
 
Fast, Easy, Cheap and Convenient. Can't get better than that.
author: Jan Z.

description:
This is my go-to sushi place. Not because it is authentic. Because it is cheap. And their secret sauce is white-man's drug: mayonnaise. 

It's in every roll, just about.

Their specialty rolls are great: Pink Dragon, Godzilla, Dynamite Roll, ooohhhh and Fire Cracker.

This is great for groups. Order plenty of beer.
author: Valerie V.

description:
Everybody I know loves (or at least likes) this place, which makes me think I'm uber picky (which I'm not).

I've been here twice and had bad experiences with the "fried stuff" both times (fool me once...)
author: Tony L.

description:
BEST SUSHI AND CHEAP!

I absolutely love this place. I'm from Los Angeles, but I went to school up north and was introduced to Kitaro. I fell in love with the place. I ate here all the time while I was up north. When I moved back to LA, I kept thinking of it and I always eat there on my visits to SF. Its a small and simple place, but always very busy. Service is great and fast. Even if its busy, you won't have to wait long. The sushi is very good and they have all kinds for you to choose from. Price is excellent. Very cheap for the quality and service. They make their rolls so nicely. Yummm...I'm drooling over here in LA just thinking about that place.
author: Carol T.

description: Kitaro is one of those generic American/Chinese styled Japanese restaurants and if that's what you are craving, it's a perfectly good spot to go to.  It is not somewhere you want to go if you want to have good quality sushi.  Items like their chicken katsu however and well fried and comes in a nice healthy portion.  You can get those Americanized sushi rolls and if that's what you crave, you should generally enjoy them.  They probably won't knock your socks off or anything.  And to top it off, the prices are really good so you get good value for this place.  If you live in the neighborhood, are a student, or just happen to be in the area (maybe you were hanging out in GGP?) and want to get a simple "Japanese" dinner, this might be the place for you.  i keep referring to this placeas an American styled Japanese restaurant and suddenly can't get that celebrity jeopardy joke from SNL.  "I'll take Jap anus relations for 400 Alex!" "That's Japan US relations, Mr Connery."  but I digress.  3 stars.
author: Nat L.

description: This is the place for good and inexpensive Japanese food on Geary and 22nd ave. Keep your Safeway receipts because there's usually a coupon for 15% off at Kitaro. Mmm I was in the mood for noodles. While my boyfriend and his sister got bento boxes with teriyaki beef, kaki fry (fried oysters YUM), and tempura, I got the chicken katsu curry udon, their "Today's Special" which is basically their special everyday. The curry soup is alright, spicy but a little too salty. I liked their chicken katsu and udon, although I wouldn't mind the chicken katsu in a separate dish so it wouldn't get sogged up by the curry soup. Overall, yummm! Filled my belly.
author: Linda L.

description:
Food: My favorites are the curry tonkatsu and the godzilla roll. The tonkatsu's perfectly crunchy texture goes so well with their curry sauce. So good over rice! The godzilla roll is so flavorful for the mouth. I think I'm hungry.

Service: Could be better. They are cheap on giving you napkins. Message to the waiters, more napkins mean more tip from me!

Atmosphere: Fairly clean place. The decor makes it look like you're in Japan.
author: Presh J.

description:
I'm a little mad.  I put 50 minutes into the meter and I only used 30 while eating lunch here.  I can't get those 2 quarters back.  Damn.  

This place is quick.  Which is usually a good thing.  They don't rush you, they just serve the food really fast.  

We had the chicken kaarage, tempura and some rolls.  The kaarage is pretty decent, good size chunks of dark meat.  Comes with two dipping sauces.  The tempura isn't bad and the shrimp are on the small side.  But the lunch combo is around $8.  Super cheap and ok food equal 3 stars.

The rolls weren't bad.  Some are pretty similar as my wife and I ordered rolls that were pretty much the same, by accident.  Fish quality is fine, no off smells or textures.  Though the roll that had no raw fish did have a off taste.  It was the fried tempura and eel roll.  Hmm, must be the eel.  

I don't think I'd visit as much if it weren't for the prices.  I wouldn't wait in line for this place.  Nor would I take anyone here that I'm trying to impress.  But for a quick bite that won't damage your wallet as badly, come here.
author: Bruce B.

description:
I don't know what's more delicious, the sushi rolls or the prices. They have a lot of cute/fun/creative rolls here as well as helllla cheap makimono and nigiri. Combo meals are also a good deal. And I love anything they do with salmon, it always tastes super fresh and scrumptious. 

I have probably been to Kitaro more times than I've been to any other SF restaurant and I've never, ever had even a less-than-pleasant experience. It's always hopping (a good sign in general, but even better for a sushi joint, right?) but I've never really had to wait for a table. Staff is always attentive and friendly, willing to accommodate us as we order second and third rounds of food. The atmosphere is fun in an understated kind of way--the kind of place where I don't mind rubbing elbows with the strangers on the bench next to me. Plus, it's a reliable place to take visitors. I got my out-of-town friend, who's not even that into sushi, hooked on the firecrackers. And there was plenty on the menu to satisfy my vegetarian friend. I just wish I could go up in the mini-upstairs area. I think that would be fun. 

It's good for non-sushi items, too. The special when I went today was an extra-spicy curry udon noodle soup with chicken katsu. Possibly the best noodle soup I've ever had at a Japanese restaurant. It would become a regular meal for me if it was a regular menu item. Someone from the kitchen even came out to ask me how I liked it. I said "very much."
author: anne s.

description: This isn't one of my favorite Japanese places to eat at. The sushi is very inexpensive but that's because the portions are tiny. The cooked food taste alright but i've had better. This place is just good to eat at when all the other Japanese restaurants are closed.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This is another one of those Japanese places run by Chinese people. Hey, if it works, keep doing it. The prices are okay and the food is pretty good. It really tastes like Chinese people making Japanese food, which isn't exactly a bad thing. As long as it's good, who cares?

*Don't get dessert though. (One mochi for 1.50, split for 4 people. Ridiculous.)
author: Alex Y.

description:
Okay so following up on my previous post regarding Kitaro, although they are not good in the restaurant. I have found what Kitaro is actually good for. 

UPDATE ORDER:
-Mixed sushi platter with loads of sushi, $25 with a safeway coupon

You can't beat that. But seriously, that's the only good thing about Kitaro. 

[APPROVED FOR TAKE OUT SUSHI MIXED PLATTER]
author: Eric T.

description: This place is just alright. The sushi you get is definitely the amount you pay for. The prices are really cheap and the sushi quality seems the same. I would not say this is the best sushi place ever because I have had way better. I guess if I'm low on money and craving sushi I would go here.
author: Katrina T.

description: I go to Ktiaro because the food is cheap and you leave with your tummy satisfied. The sushi is nothing over the top, just straight to the point. The only thing that is hit or miss here is the service. There are times that I've gone where I get my food in a quick fashion. Other times, I have waited for 45 minutes for a roll. I've heard that Kitaro is a good place to order take out from over dine-in. Either way...I still go back because it is good, cheap sushi.
author: Holly F.

description:
Okay...break down time

Service:  kinda sucks...my cup of water stayed empty for almost my whole time there...it was as if once they served u, they were done with u

Food:  tastes pretty damn good...sushi was pretty fresh and the chicken katsu was pretty damn tasty

Price:  pretty damn good, even outside of lunch time...

Parking:  there is none, shit took forever to find...

Overall, a pretty okay experience, good enough to get 4 stars from me...

This has been another Mike Vuong PSA!!
author: Mike V.

description:
I'm not into sushi, but my friends and family are. I can vouch for their chicken teriyaki being pretty good, even REALLY good if you consider the price ($6 - included rice, salad and miso soup). My family seemed to enjoy the various rolls and things that they ordered, but who knows what they really thought. I'm sure someone would have said something if it needed to be said.

Look, maybe this place isn't the best, but all I'm saying is that I've paid literally three times as much for the same food of equal or lesser caliber elsewhere. Japanese food is the biggest fucking ripoff, anyway.

Like fellow yelper, P.C. said, if you're complaining about this place, you're most likely a pompous fuck who dishonestly critiques things based on their apparent hip quotient. Fine. Be that way. Go pay through the nose at some yuppie approved place... just keep convincing yourself that you're THAT fucking great.
author: Alex C.

description:
Don't be fooled by the cool logo design. THE FISH ISN'T FRESH.

For that reason alone, you should really take your money elsewhere. You're on Geary. Drive up or down either direction and I'm sure you'll be able to find a better sushi restaurant. It'll probably be average price, but Kitaro's cheapness extends to the kind of raw materials they use.
author: Le V.

description:
I usually come here just to eat certain dishes like their unagi donburi and their dragon roll sushi. But I was really disappointed by their chicken teriyaki which is dry beyond belief.  And usually smothered by it's own sauce but still can't hide its dryness from my tongue.

Mom loves it here because it's just a convenient place to get her Japanese hit...the green tea is very good...but I think the quality of their food has went down a bit.
author: Pauline L.

description:
1. Food: The food was really good, the chicken katsu was good and so was the unagi. A definite plus. The lunch was really filling, with a big heaping of rice, five unagi rolls, and two large chicken katsu pieces all with dipping sauce and salad. I also had some mochi balls with my friend. Really good for desert. +

2. Price: For two people, 20.78. 10 bucks for two people. Definitely a good place especially for japanese boxes at lunch time. +

3. Venue: I like the theme they set up for this place, it is not too dark, but definitely not like the outside, dim in a way, but not dingy. There's a wierd crawl space over the kitchen, which I thought at first was a karaoke lounge since I saw speakers. And then I figured it was too small. +

4. Location: It's Richmond, and if you've ever been to the Richmond, you know this place is the hardest place to find parking. I drove around the block at least 10 times. 3 times I ended up at a broken meter, and then the last time I found parking RIGHT in front. It's not really Kitaro's fault about the whole parking situation, so I can't blame them. However, as it is in the Richmond, it is EASILY accessible in many fashions of public transportation, so a definite +.

5. Overall: I was satisfied with my first trip at Kitaro. I give it a four because I had a pleasant experience, good food, all at an affordable price for lunch. Plus I went out with a good friend. Always a plus indeed. However, it missed a five because the staff seemed vacant half the time, and sometimes I'm looking for a bit of authenticity, not a bunch of girls from Guangzhou serving me Japanese food. Oh well, what are you gonna do right?
author: Michael C.

description:
My girlfriend loves this place because it's pretty good and cheap.  I like this place because it's cheap.

The food is pretty ok.  I'm a fairly picky eater, so whenever I go Japanese, it's always between the chicken teriyaki, or the tonkatsu.  I've tried the teriyaki a few times here, and each time, the serving has been a little dry.  The tonkatsu is pretty good.  I used to just eat it plain (I'm a plain kinda guy who eats vanilla ice cream), however, my taste buds soon became accustomed to the bitterness.  Anyhow, my gf likes the sushi, so I assume it's decent.

Now for the useful info.  It's usually pretty crowded on weekends during dinner time (i.e. you have to wait), and not too crowded during the week around dinner (i.e. you don't have to wait).  Here folks, ends another review by Captian Obvious.
author: Casey F.

description:
It is really cheap Japanese food.
It is not good Japanese food.
Remember you go for the price, not the food.
author: Erica B.

description:
Pretty much your average sushi restaurant. Cheap prices, friendly servers & okay-looking decor. Good location, also. Right smack in the middle of the richmond district on geary street. Probably explains why I'm so used to seeing people waiting outside in line.

I always order the bento box special whenever I go there, because I know for sure I'm gonna be full when I walk out the door. It's about $7-$10, depending on what two items you ordered. Dinner's the same, but just a few dollars more expensive. It comes with a bowl of miso soup, a cup of rice & a small salad with dressing. I stick with the CALIFORNIA rolls & CHICKEN TERIYAKI. Yum.
author: Annie S.

description:
It's CHEAP and it's GOOD! Gotta love it for those two reasons.
I've had sushi, saba, salmon, chicken teriyaki at other restaurant for double the price and it tastes the same as Kitaro's. I am going here now because it's CHEAP!!!!

My friend had sashimi and she said it was fresh and delicious.

4-star because it's not Japanese restaurant.
author: Chatree T.

description:
Great sushi place for the following reasons:

1. Super cheap!!  Average price for rolls is like....$6!!!  possibly even less
2. Big portions......and seems more so for the price
3. Creative rolls.  Yes, this is not a place for the REAL sushi enthusiasts.  This is like what McDonalds is for real American food.

Downside to this place is quality isn't that great.  I dont' mean quality sucks, but just don't expect the best.  Good enough though.
author: Tadd L.

description:
Not really the best sushi place ever, but not really that bad IMO. 

I usually don't order bento boxes anymore. If I do, it'll be the Salmon (always overcooked...boo!!!) teriyaki or Beef teriyaki with Salmon/Tuna/Yellowtail sashimi. I normally stick to sushi rolls and occasionally sneak a bite quickstyl from the boyfriend's bento box. I regularly order the Pink Dragon, Tiger, Rock n' Roll and Surfer roll. I always avoid tempura since I'm not a big fan of the deep fried stuff and always find myself scrapping off as much of the batter as I can.

Fish obviously isn't 'fresh', service is quick, food is inexpensive, but don't expect super-duper-melt-in-your-mouth-and-knock-you-into-a-food-coma sushi. If you want that, go somewhere else. Only come here if you want cheap, decent, edible, fill-up-your-hunger sushi....or food.
author: Serena W.

description:
Who would've thought "good sushi" and "inexpensive sushi" can be put in the same sentence? Kitaro makes it possible. They have everything that a good sushi restaurants offer, without the big price tag that comes along with it! Rolls, sashimi, bento boxes, udon, sake, beer, the whole she-bang (did I spell that right?)! They're usually very crowded since they're popular with the locals but they manage to squeeze people with not having to wait too long. If you have a big group, it's a different story though so come early.

Why do I give it a 4-star then? Because the key is "good" vs. "great" sushi. The sashimi is definitely not the catch of the day but they do taste delicious overall. Plus, at $6 for a Rainbow Roll, I'd say it's very reasonable.  

Recommendation: Firecracker appetizers. You can't have just one!
author: My V.

description:
Kitaro is not my favorite sushi restaurant by any means.  But because of their location and the fact that they have decent sushi at cheap prices, we go there at least twice a month.  Why?  Because I am a lazy mom that prefers to pick up to-go rather than cooking on the days we don't go to my parents house for dinner.  On the days that it is just my 5 year old and I and leftovers for my baby's daddy (who I swear must of been japanese in another lifetime) and though his son did not inherit his looks has inherited the same love for japanese food.  

Okay, back to Kitaro...decent food, cheap prices, and you will often find a 15% coupon on the back of the local Richmond Safeway receipt and Fulton Lucky Supermarket receipt.
author: Stella C.

description:
The value of good food and great taste. I love going to Kitaro's for the fact the bento boxes are a great value, and is good quality food. Not that it's a Michelin Star sort of joint, but for a good meal and a great value, you should go here. 

The only issue I see with eating here is the parking. Most times I luck out, but going here imeans you might have to walk a few blocks. But definitely remember to bring quarters for the meter. 

so go here and eat...so tasty...
author: robert b.

description:
YUM!!!!!!!

Try their chicken kaarage...they're little fried chicken things....really yummy!

I pretty much always get the same thing anytime I'm with my friends and we all share the rolls...the price is decent.

Sushi rolls:
-Tiger roll (avocado and eel topped on rice and shrimp tempura)
-Rock 'n roll
-spicy chicken roll
-dynamite roll
-firecracker balls
-kitaro roll
-kamikaze roll

If you sign up to win a prize on their website, once you use the 10% off coupon, you get a 15% coupon mailed to you every month.

Parking sucks though!
author: V M.

description:
Wow, okay, some mixed reviews...I have to say I was completely blown away by Kitaro.

Perhaps I have grown accustomed to over-priced sushi restaurants where the scene takes center stage and no one really notices the actual food. I do love Japanese food, and discovering Kitaro was like discovering a little piece of sushi heaven. Here's why:

It is so incredibly cheap. We're talking $2 rolls, $1 soup, etc etc. Maybe it's not the best sushi I've ever had, but it certainly hits the spot. One of the most affordable meals I've ever had in SF.

I would definitely recommend Kitaro to anyone wanting to order a ton of sushi without a massive bill. On the contrary, Kitaro shocked me with its incredibly low prices and good sushi. Maybe not everyone agrees, but it's certainly worth a chance.
author: Sophie D.

description:
Cheap, delicious, good sushi!! 

Service is friendly and fast, always in and out, never any rush or wait.

Mostly cooked sushi, amount is good for 2-3 people (if you're all getting at least roll each).

parking is hard to find around the area.
author: Cecilia B.

description:
The menu has alot of selection. At first glance prices are quite cheap - never would I be able to get rolls for $4 - and I would say, to a great degree, you get what you pay for. 

Service was relatively quick. Even the miso soup and salad (that came with the sushi platters we ordered) was mediocre. The sushi/sashimi wasn't terrible but it wasn't great either. Someone ordered terriyaki chicken and I was surprised to taste real bourbon in the sauce. The terriyaki was probably more a hit than the sushi. 

Again, bottom line: you get what you pay for.
author: wheatberry s.

description:
I like this place a lot. The rolls are cheap and yummy, and this is a great place to get a lot of decent sushi without trashing your bank account. I've been going here for years, and I've never had a bad experience. 

They make a tasty spider roll! The tea is a little bland, but they always keep your pot full.
author: elizabeth d.

description:
I don't know what the hype is about. The sheet to sign up to eat there with your party. It's not all that great. The lunch/dinner combos are the only things worth it there.

The mochi is small and not worth it. Buy it in Jtown.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Ok, so this restaurant has been a staple on Geary for years. I remember in high school coming here for cheap good sushi.
The sushi is good, not traditional at any sense, but better than most sushi chains floating around now a days. The place down the street on the corner can't compare but the prices are about half as expensive. 
The restaurant itself is nice, not the best but pretty. 
The food, albeit kinda expensive, is good. Not drop dead tell your self to buy stocks later good, but you'll have a good time.
I'd rather go to Sushi Boom with a large group of friends, because you'd probably wait for an hour. 
There usually is a line out the door on the weekends, but if you really want the sushi u can wait.
author: Eric A.

description:
Kitaro's is your everyday average sushi place.   Their prices are cheap, but you get what you pay for.

It's my go-to place for quick affordable sushi.

If you're looking for an experience and high-quality fish, this is not the place for you.  If you need a place to go with a bunch of friends on a budget, this place kicks ass.
author: Gavin S.

description:
Sushi is my favorite food and I use to work at a Sushi Restaurant back home in Salinas, so it was really difficult to find another sushi restaurant that i like. I tried Kitaro Sushi because my room mate had recommended it to my boyfriend and I. I had ordered the sushi TOGO which was a really good idea and from now on I will be ordering it to go. 

I give 3 stars because 2 stars go to food and the price. I love finding yummy sushi for a reasonable price. 1 star goes to the customer service. Although it was my first time actually being inside, it was the worst customer service I got from a Sushi Restaurant, well at least from the server I had. The other guy was nice and decent about saying hello, thank you, take your time. UNLIKE the other lady... UHM... yah thats why i would never eat inside. I think its wrong just to hand you the sushi rolls and place it on the table without telling you which is which. I mean i know i should know which is which by reading the details, but damn isnt that what servers are for? And they shouldnt be just slamming the plate on the table. GEES! and she never came to ask us if we were okay. And she seemed like she was in a rush all the time, PLUS they were not even busy. I know busy I use to work at a Restaurant. I never complain about customer service BUT this was the worst... So from now on, I am ordering the Sushi TO GO... MAYBE ill give it a try eating there, thats if shes not there again.
author: Janice B.

description:
If you want cheap sushi and rolls, this is the place.  The portions are generous and there's a good variety.  My favorite is the Garlic Albacore nigiri, I usually start and finish my meal with it.

The service is super quick but they tend to hover around to get you in and out of the place.  The parking in this area is super tough and could send you elsewhere.
author: danny m.

description:
no frills.  this place is great when "you just wanna bento box combo for a good price kinda place"...although in recent years they've gotten a bit skimpy on their sashimi.

my bento box had a small fresh salad with their signature sesame dressing, crispy chicken katsu (crispy on the outside, tender on the inside) and salmon sashimi.

i give an extra star to this place for using a really good katsu sauce.  most places just water it down...kitaro gives you the real deal.  i remember the salmon sashimi from previous visits to be as thick as my pinky finger...the ones i had today were paper thin...

would i go back?  i always have...so i probably will.

should you go there?  only if you're not looking for anything fancy, but just a good place to grab a quick bite to eat.
author: Rochelle D.

description: Not the highest quality but it's decent and cheap. Some of the specialty rolls look kind of weird but unique. Yummy rainbow roll.
author: Maren A.

description: Kitaro is great for the price! I got a Kitaro Roll (teriyaki chicken and avocado) plus a glass of wine for about $7. It's great for groups and last-minute-dinners. Plus, it accepts credit cards!
author: Teresa G.

description: Fairly Unimpressed.  Service was good; but it's basically a Japanese place run by Chinese people.  The food is average, unauthentic and somewhat commercial.  Prices were reasonable though; if you're looking for some redeeming value in the place.
author: Larry W.

description: I know there are tons of sushi places in the city, but this place rocks my socks! The sushi is cheap, the service is a-ok, and the food comes out really quick. If you want best bang for your buck, come here! I always order the sashimi platter that comes with rice, salad, & soup. I substitute the rice with double salad. If you shop at the Safeway nearby, the receipts have a coupon on the back so for two, it comes out to be around $20 more or less. What a deal!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Honestly, I loved kitaro back in the day. I think the quality of the food and service has declined over the years but for the most part, it's still pretty damn good and affordable. Great place to go with a group of people.
author: Ezo W.

description: I have been going here for years. It is a favorite with my kids, I had lunch with a friend recently, and since she was pressed for time, I suggested Kitaro.. We got a table right away, the place was packed. We sat 20 min before anyone even came over with menus. They took  orders at many other tables before ours and we were there first ! I finally flagged down someone and they got someone else and placed our order. We ate in a hurry and the food was just sort of dumped down on the table... I was so disapppointed in the service.. I will go back, and I am hoping it was just a hectic, short handed day. I like the place and it is near my home, but not sure why the decline of service lately...
author: Linda A.

description: Good price decent food. Really fast!
author: Ms F.

description:
i love that this place is not a traditional japanese restaurant since they have creative rolls.  i remember when this place was a small hole-in-the-wall across the street!
everytime i come here, i order some combination of these rolls: kamikaze, spider, mexican, spicy chicken, and godzilla roll.  the garlic albacore is also very good.  given that i order this many rolls, you'd think that i would pay a lot but i don't.  their prices are that great!  their bento boxes are great and appropriately proportioned.    
service is always pretty attentive but there's a wait if you go on weekend nights.  parking can be daunting also, often resulting having to walk at least 2 blocks.
author: Serena L.

description:
I was originally going to the sushi boat place next door, but the wait was like 40min or some non-sense. so I took them to Kitaro- I had had lunch here once before and i remember it being really cheap, filling and pretty darn good- well again I was not let down- my table of 6 all had different rolls and soups and really seemed to enjoy their food- I had veggie tempura and salmon sashimi the temupra was great, but the sashimi wow! huge slices and plenty of them I was shocked, I usually compare everything to Miyabi on church but the quality, portions and price can't be beat! not to mention they sat us in 30 sec. upon arriving!

I will mos def  be back in the future
author: A. Gun n.

description:
Best Value for the monies for sushi and funky ones at it.  Kitaro specializes in the non-traditional sushi. Godzilla rolls, 49er rolls, Dragon Rolls etc are their best. Sure they have the udon, bento boxes, and standard maki rolls but i'm down with their out of the box stuff.

If ya eat dinner early (5-6pm) then service is right on. If it involves any time on the waiting list then service gets boggled down due to all the hungry folk who want their sushi on!

A pretty packed house means the food is either a) worth it, b) yummy or c) all of the above.

Oh ya, good luck on parking!
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
My favorite sushi restaurant.

Note the line outside of Kitaro. This despite the fact there are TWO other sushi restaurants on either side of it.

Why the line? Good affordable sushi. Even the more elaborate rolls are below $10 and for someone who likes the unagi and tempura rolls that's a plus.

Food has always been consistently good here. If I go out for sushi, I'll trek from my neighborhood out here (I live in the Mission).
author: M O.

description:
Kitaro is one of the most affordable good sushi in the city.  I love the rolls, I love my fat wallet after the bill comes, I love the fact that it takes almost an hour to find even metered parking.

Sushi is good 2-4 dollars for normal 6piece rolls
