Miso soup is plain and delicious
Dynamite roll is the only reason this place has my stars so high
The lunch combo is unbeatable for the price/amount you get
Their research and development crew conceived many new rolls over the years
Coke is canned =)
This is the one place I can go all out on sushi and not get a hefty bill

The only negative is their angry looking workers... and inattentive staff.
Its hard for me to debate whether to take away another star for that...
I will update when I go visit them again.. hopefully they will shape up that poor service.
author: Benny S.

description:
Not as bad as alot of reviews make it seem. The rolls are hella cheap! The spider roll was a little better than mediocre. The pink dragon roll was overcooked, I prefer my salmon to be on the slightly cooked to raw side. The kamikaze and the 49er roll were basically the same thing except white tuna in one and pink tuna in the other. Oh and don't order the firecracker! I wouldn't even call that roll sushi. 

You get what you pay for, but if you're in a sushi roll mood, why not.
author: Sara D.

description:
Restaurant is clean well lighted and service fast.  Inexpensive Japanese food.  Good for fast take out and for lunch.  Not really a great Sushi place but it will do when your in a hurry and just want to chill and talk.  Parking is on the street, parking lot across the street. 
Friendly staff.
author: Susie S.

description:
When I'm craving for cheap but good sushi place, KITARO is the place.
Service is always friendly and fast. And they have decent Sake too. 

I tried to avoid going there though during weekend because of the line and hard to find parking.
author: jubi l.

description:
Can you talk about UN-Authentic japanese food? Want japanese fast food? Then come here. ALSO! Why does all the japanese foods taste the damn same?! TELL ME WHY!

1. The waiters and waitress suck! They all work at a rushy and impatient pace of speed. They also want enormous tips from teenagers. ( I would know, they chased me out the door in order to get tips. ) This man with glasses that work there is so bitchy...
2. The sushi there all taste the same. The fish there is not fresh whatsoever, it is probably baught in bulk at costco! You can taste the unfreshness. Well, what do you expect when everything is so cheap?
3. This place is somewhere I would go whenever i'm feeling cheap.
author: Johnny T.

description:
I always like this place because first and for most...its super cheap. I think the customer service could be a little better, but for the prices..i guess you have to lose something somewhere, and it just happen to be the customer service. 

Its pretty crowded after like 7-8pm sometimes on the weekdays but definitely on the weekends.  I gave it three stars because i think the food is good but i went there lastnight and my tempura was kind of burnt. 

Kitaro is good if you want decent priced Japanese, with ok customer service.
author: Nia W.

description:
Cheap ok quality sushi. I'm sure there is supermarket sushi that is better quality than here. But then again, for the prices they charge, its not a bad place to come. Also, I'm waiting for them to create a hot tranny roll since they seem to have all kinds of funky rolls. And hot tranny roll will definitely had some crab in it. Maybe some cheese. Haha.

Parking kinda sucks around here and service was hit or miss that night.

Also, this place has the EXACT same menu as Mika Sushi in the Inner Sunset (plus more booze). Is there any correlations between the 2?
author: Rocky K.

description: Just like any other regular sushi joint. Nothing stupendous about it. Cheap sushi for your sushi craving.
author: Tam T.

description: Very dependable cheap sushi! not the best but very consistent and tastes what its worth. great for college students on a budget craving a sushi night!
author: Jerald B.

description: Spicy Tuna roll, Alaska roll w/ Lunch special vege tempura - $12 w/ %15 coupon. Worth it!
author: Vivian L.

description: This is my neighborhood sushi restaurant.  The food is decent and just what I need when I have a sushi craving.  If you shop at safeway, you can get a 10% off your entire bill.  The only thing is that service is not so great and if you go anytime after 6pm, expect a line....hey, at least you know that their food sells and therefore is fresh.  Give it a try if you haven't.
author: Kris H.

description: The price of the meal for two of us was $31 w/ tip.  The Value meals have so much food!  If you sign up for the monthly coupon you get another 15%.  Crazy.  Crazy Good though.
author: Jere C.

description: Kitaro is definitely not the place to go for quality sushi. However, if you are on a budget I would say this is decent for their prices. Their sushi rolls are average and so is their customer service. I'm not complaining because their is no one where in the city you can get a Bento Box with Sashimi for roughly $12-13...
author: Amber D.

description: This place was recommended to me by a couple of friends and it was pretty good. I went with 2 friends from Ensenada and they love sushi. Well it didn't let us down, We ordered a variety of sushi and other menu items. I must say we got a lot of bang for our buck, i will absolutely go back. So yea i am a fan.
author: Larry Y.

description: Their yelp website says they are open Sundays till 10. We parked right in front at 9:29 right as the "hostess" flipped over the "open" sign to it showed "closed". She was very rude when we asked her if we could eat if we ordered quickly since we drove all the way from the other side of town, and their yelp website says they are open until 10. She said No! So we walked right next door to "Little Tokyo" where the food was just as good, in fact fresher. They were friendly and polite even though they also closed at 10. In fact, they allowed people to come in until after 10! They also gave us free miso soup and a free roll! I enjoyed Kitaro many times before which is why I gave it an extra star, but will now be visiting Little Toyko instead. Bad business Kitaro!! Love your loyal customers!! Boo...
author: Jessica S.

description:
Kitaro Sushi, it's between love and hate. This place is inexpensive but food is just mediocre. Not to mention parking is awful beyond words. 
If you are craving for some sushi but on cash crunch, this place is perfect for you. However, if you are craving for some real good quality sushi, try another place, maybe kabuto on Geary.

Yeah they do have 15% discount coupons all over the place. Kiki restaurant is the sister restaurant of kitaro but kitaro is little bit better in terms of food. Kiki once sent me 50% discount and I brought 10 friends with me and we ended up paying only 30 bucks for the night..muahahaha!!!! Guess it won't happen again or else, you see them closing soon.
author: Amy Y.

description:
From the outside you'd expect this place to really deliver something, however it falls up short.  I've driven by this place many times and there always seems to be a wait, but after trying it, I can't really figure out why.

The prices are cheap that's for sure, but the food is very average.  in fact that might be being too nice.  if you're a sushi lover like myself, then this place is not for you.  The rolls are made quickly and didn't taste fresh at all, and it's reflected in the price tag.  I'm really one that believes in, "you get what you pay for".

The udon soup was better than the sushi, and they actually provided quite a bit of chicken in the soup as well.  It's a good amount of food for the price.  Maybe that's the reason why there's usually a wait.

If I was in the area and really needed a quick cheap fix for sushi, I'd go back, but there are so many other options within a one block radius, that chances are slim.
author: Yehoy L.

description:
This place use to be the place to go for cheap yet decent bento box lunch/dinner. Remember the days of having to wait out in the cold until your name was called from the clip board hanging by the door? Those days are gone with all the competition on the block this restaurant's located. 

This is one of my old favorites. The food here is decent - not the greatest if you want good tasting sushi. I come here only for the cooked food. I usually have the salmon and the tempura. They are starting to skimp on the veggies in the tempura. The pieces are getting smaller and less variety. The bento boxes are good for a hefty dinner. I don't like that they charge for tea. Overall, the environment is cool. The service is fast but the servers aren't too personable. They are there just to take orders and bring out your orders. I haven't seen anyone ask for recommendations.
author: Candace F.

description:
It's good not to be stuck in the past and just move on... this place used to be decent, but those days are long gone.
The story behind Kitaro goes like this:
They used to be good, and, as a result, got a lot of good business. Like one Yelper said, people used to line up outside in the cold and wait forever to eat there! But with all that good business, they eventually got complacent. The quality of their food suffered, the service... well, actually the service there always sucked.
But I say, try the other two restaurants flanking Kitaro... or try the many other, and much better Japanese restaurants all throughout the city--cause compared to these, Kitaro sucks!
author: Mike S.

description:
December 19, 2007

I go here often and I really like it because it is cheaper than most sushi restaurants. 

GF ordered:
Lunch Combo: $7.78
Chicken Teriyaki
Shrimp & Veggie Tempura

I ordered:
Lunch Combo: $8.48
Shrimp & Veggie Tempura
Rock & Roll: BBQ Eel and avocado sushi roll.

Lunch combo comes with a Miso soup, salad, and rice.I did not like the salad because it is just iceberg lettuce with their homemade salad dressing they make out of mayonaise. 

I enjoy what I order, but I do not like the seating arrangements. The seating seems so crowded and I do not like it that you have to sit really close to the tables of other people.

My credit card slip did not match my receipt, but they quickly corrected it for me. 

Food inspection grade: 99%

Parking is a pain in this neighborhood.
author: Joseph F.

description:
I mean, it was inexpensive but yea, there's a reason for that.

I needed more from them, more than what they had to offer.

I suppose I can be a very elitist consumer of food and suggest that my review for Hama-Ko Sushi Bar be read.
author: Thao T.

description:
Kitaro gets a major plus for the vast amount of poor college kids who love sushi and can't afford it! But, we also felt that the sushi was severely lacking... we ordered the house roll, and it was chicken teriyaki, we couldn't even EAT the chicken, it was so tough... I don't recommend it. The other complaint we had was, that the rolls were served room temperature: our hot rolls were lukewarm & the cold rolls weren't cold. I think that would have made SUCH a difference. No matter where you go, no matter how good the spider roll, its not so great if it isnt hot... Also, the customer service was adequate. They brought us our food, but were not friendly at all.

All in all, pretty good sushi for the price, but I'm not sure we would go again. I am glad though, that there are places out there, affordable enough that no one has to go WITHOUT sushi.
author: Krista H.

description:
What the hell happened??? This place use to be great!!! But they have fallen to the past success that they once had. The prices have gone up, up, and up... Staff turn over has not helped either. I still remember when they were accross the street and had better sushi for a 1/3 of the price... Everything was only $1.99.

Then they moved and tried to be a real sushi place and had great success in small plates, but the all hell broke loose. I guess all the other restaurants they opned took its' toll.

I guess it's still a good place for lunch, but if you were expecting a great deal for great food, this is not the place... The hamachi Kama is still good, but what happended to the yellowtail jaw bone... It shrank along with everything else...

Don't get me started in Kiki's...
author: robert C.

description:
The best thing about this place is the price.  The food is decent but not the best sushi I've ever had or anything!  Seating is really tight so if you don't mind listening to everyone else's conversations, then you're all SET!

The rolls are pretty big but I would suggest to sticking with cooked foods.  The sashimi was not as fresh as I prefer.  Also, parking can be difficult during "peak hours."
author: Candice M.

description:
They're good to me and my friends here. I've come here at least ten times, never had bad service, never had the kitchen run out of something, never found the bill to be too expensive, and never had anything I didn't like. I never feel bad giving anyone here a good tip, especially when it's busy. I've been here during a crowded house and our food still came within 20 minutes.

The quality of the food is probably not the best for a sushi restaurant in San Francisco, but it's very inexpensive and some of the special rolls are quite creative. I recommend the godzilla roll, pink salmon roll, and especially the shrimp tempura rolls. Some of the non-sushi items are good as well, including the fried tofu appetizer, the tempura/sushi bento boxes for lunch, and especially the miso soup. Great job!
author: Conrad C.

description: Dropped in here as me & my friend were about to go to Pho` Garden down on 25th but was closed on Tues. !Dropped in once and is now a regular customer. Really good affordable prices! food isn't especially extremely tasty but it's good enough for its price. $6 for a lunch special or rice, terriyaki, sushi, and salad? Score! Plenty enough to feed you for $5.95-$6. When most Japanese restaurants charge $7 for just plain california rolls. Also, kitaro always mails in coupons which makes things even cheaper than it already is. Sure the taste isn't extremely good, but it's satisfying enough. Most sushi rolls are under $5 which is also a good deal. One of the cheapest japanese restaurants I've been to so far. Dropped in once and now, its my go to japanese place. Aside from sushi boats though.  Atmosphere is warm, good. Nice medium sized place with pretty good service and quick food delivery. If you're looking for a cheap affordable place, Kitaro is your go to place!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Kitaro is my favorite inexpensive Japanese/sushi restaurant around, but it definitely has its drawbacks.  I've been going for almost 7 years, and I still have yet to find a cheap place that beats it.

Kitaro is on Geary Street down by 20th...it's always a beast to find parking, but once that aggravating experience is over you get to wait (outside because they have no room inside) for a table...weekend nights are the worst, this place is always always always crowded (probably because the food is so cheap and decent).  You write your name on a list and they'll call you as soon as the table is available - what is most annoying is you have to have your entire party present before they seat you.  But once you are finally seated the evening will change for the better.  You've gotten all the negative experiences out of the way, bring on the tastiness!

This place has FAST service.  They depend on high turnaround, so they will serve you as quickly and efficiently as they can.  But you can take your time, they are quick without rushing you too badly.  The menu is extensive, with two large pages of hot food and bento boxes and two large pages of sushi rolls and also a page of specials.  They have great everything.  From the hot food items, their chicken or pork katsu are great, I looooove the sauces.  They also have a decent teryaki sauce, I like their salmon teryaki.  The dinners and bento boxes all come with miso soup, a salad, and loads of sticky rice.  For the bento boxes you can choose two main items from a list - and that includes sashimi!  I usually get a bento box with two of the four sashimi options - red tuna, salmon, albacore tuna, and yellowtail.  Their sashimi is really good grade, the fish melts in your mouth and has never had that iffy "fishy" taste - the fish is always super fresh and smooth.  A bento box will run you 9 - 14 bucks, that is damn cheap for the amount of food, we almost always have some leftovers.

The sushi here is awesome.  They have a roll for everyone...I especially like their Dynamite roll (spicy tuna roll that is deep fried and then has that  spicy red "rooster" sauce drizzled on top) and their Godzilla roll (tuna and crab roll also deep fried with a creamy wasabi sauce).  Try the lobster salad roll, you get two huge pieces of sushi heaped with delicious lobster in a creamy sauce with crab and shrimp meat, yum.  The firecrackers are also quite good, you get five pieces of deep fried yellowtail rolls that is covered with the katsu brown sauce and a zesty orange sauce.  Yum.  

They also cover all the basic rolls - shrimp tempura, rainbow roll, eel, soft crab, california roll, phillie roll (tuna with cream cheese), they even have two chicken rolls - baked, of course - available for those who don't really like raw fish but want to try sushi.   They also have nigiri and cut rolls - of the nigiri, the garlic albacore tuna is super.

Expect ridiculously fast service - like I said, they depend on high turnaround since so many people generally like to eat here, so they will bring out your food asap.  Also expect to get a lot of good food for a little bit of money.  I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is under 16 bucks...and most of it is in the 9-12 dollar range.  The rolls are all under 9 bucks, I'm pretty sure most of them are around 6 dollars.  That is a good price these days when I see other sushi places serving a roll of eight pieces for like 14 bucks.  

Try it for yourself - yes, there are way better sushi restaurants in the city - but do you really want to spend an arm and a leg for some raw fish and rice when you can get super tasty and good combinations for way less?  I ALMOST FORGOT!  If you shop at Safeway, check out the back of your receipt - Kitaro has 20% off coupons on the back of Safeway receipts, so your meal can be even cheaper!
author: Marie B.

description: Kitaro is definitely my all-time favorite Japanese restaurant. I think their prices are reasonable and their entire menu is just tasteful. I always come for their sushi and bento. They're not the best, but they won't disappoint you. Lunch is much cheaper, of course!
author: Chau T.

description:
If you are looking for cheap sushi you dont need to look any further. Get a spicy tuna roll for 3.5 and a spider roll for 5 dollars. Prefer your rolls inside out, they'll do it (after you goad them into doing so). This is the type of sushi joint where three people can eat for 30 bucks.

Quality isnt top notch, but it is tasty enough and they'll modify stuff for you. The last time i asked for the spicy tuna roll, extra spicy, one of my compatriots couldnt handle it.

Id go back, but only when in need of a sushi fix and in the mood to spend bottom dollar.
author: H B.

description: Cheapest sushi you can find that is decent and pretty generous with their portions. Service is ehh, but hey.. the cheap sushi makes up for it. I should really give them 3 stars because i found a huge bone in my salmon sashimi that pierced through my gums this one time! OUCH!, BUT... that IS only one time out the many times i come here. SoOo, you're lucky that you have cheap decent sushi in the city Kitaro! or else i would have sued!
author: maggie w.

description: so i came here with a friend for dinner. the maki's were smaller than i expected, but since it came out with 8 pieces per order, besides the tempura roll, i was satisfied. however, the "single ingredient" makis are a bit plain. i prefer there to be more than 1 ingredient in my makis, unless the rolls are big enough to hold more of the "filling," cuz obviously, the size of these maki's didn't give off much flavor, besides the ones with the sauce drizzled on top. well, for the price, i guess it's worth a quick fix to satisfy some sushi craving when i'm on a budget.
author: Elise C.

description:
Cheap and good sushi usually don't go together.  But, Kitaro is SO CHEAP that the sushi tastes that good.  

Frankly, Kitaro could raise their prices by 40%, and the sushi still tastes good.  

I generally just go their for the Hamachi lunch.  Their salads have really good house sauce too.  Agedashi tofu there is excellent.
author: Jacob J.

description:
I Love this Spot!  I've been eating at Kitaro since 2003!  

Cheap eats, fast service...good for a quick meal with a few friends ...

Favorite dish:  CHICKEN KARAAGE!
(Ask for extra Miso Spicey Sauce... its the orange one...)

For those who don't know what Chicken Karaage is, its spicey, boneless, fried chicken.  Its basically like Chicken nuggets or strips, but better.  Its COMFORT FOOD!  YUM!  
Great with rice (meals come with rice, salad, & soup...the usual bento style)  

Its a lot of Food Too!  
So... be careful when ordering appetizers if you go with the bentos.  You might be asking for a to-go box...



The only things that causes you trouble is :
The Parking...
...but, you might as well park a block away so you can walk after you eat the great food!   Don't be lazy!  :)

The crowds of people...
it gets crowded in there, which shows how popular the place is... so if its your first time trying this place, try to make it a lunch time visit... less crowded.

But, for a 2-4 person night-time visit, it can still work....
author: Samurai J.

description:
This is where I go when I want reliable sushi at an even more reliable price. Stick with their specialty rolls and take out only. Well, dining in is nice if you're blessed for finding a parking spot.

Notable rolls: Godzilla, firecracker and rainbow roll. Their salmon sashimi is worth your time. Their salads are definitely worth the dollar and change.

Mass ordering: their party trays are perfect for entertaining both of your friends (assuming you have at least that). Kitaros keeps it cheap and serves it fresh.

Parking tip:  Try double parking with your right turn signal on. Stay far enough to the right so you don't block traffic. Then wait and pray. Even if you don't believe in a GOD, at least believe in a parking GOD - or else the wrath of the ticket ninjas will be felt $75 each time.
author: Randall B.

description:
Great place for cheap sushi, but be prepared for long lines on Fridays and Saturday nights. The food comes so fast that it's amazing that it still tastes fresh. 

I know this isn't the best sushi joint in town, but it's pretty good for the price...
author: J K.

description: Good to go during weekdays. It's fast, cheap, and good portion. It's not a fancy place and their sushi taste ok.
author: Dasisters D.

description: I love Kitaro. This is my fave Japanese restaurant of all time!! I always get the bento box special, Chicken Teriyaki, California Rolls, and on the side an order of Philadelphia Rolls.  It is so cheap and totally worth it!! I do not live near Kitaro at all, I have to take 2 buses to come here, but I would come here and take the 55 min bus ride just for Kitaro :]
author: Melissa G.

description: Kitaro is great. Sure, it's maybe not the best quality sushi around, but it's good enough that you can't believe they charge so little for it. This is THE best value you can find for sushi. They're also a well run restaurant: service is quick and friendly, and the food (in case you were wondering, because of the price) is totally safe.
author: Rob G.

description: The price is right at this place.  We sometimes drive across town from North Beach to go there.  The service is also pretty fast.
author: David H.

description: Im gonna have to say that I used to love this place but the last two times we ate here both me and my man had mud butt the whole next day. Whats up Kitaro? How you gonna do me like that??
author: M K.

description: Kitaro is a family friendly and affordable sushi restaurant.  We've been there multiple times for dinner and the food has always been tasty and good quality.  We enjoy their rolls such as the rainbow roll, gozilla roll, tiger roll, and asparagus roll.  Our children like the rib eye beef bento or udon.  Keep an eye out for 15% coupons from Valpak or Safeway.
author: Raymond L.

description: Not the greatest rolls in the world - can be small on size.  But the value of this place for us penny pinchers is unmeasurable.  Fast service, consistent quality rolls and great tasting salads.  Totally worth it if you want quick easy sushi.  Plus I hear they have coupons for even more great deals!
author: Mark J.

description: This place was surprisingly really cheap for sushi. Immediately when I saw the menu I was amazed. The food was alright. It wasn't terrific, but what do you expect from a cheap sushi place. However, there were some dishes that were really good, which is why I am ranking this place as a 4 star. Some of the dishes are mediocre, but the others are quite up there like the Fire Crackers. Give this place a try if you are low on cash and wanting some sushi.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
okay first of all for everyone writing reviews about Kitaro's food that doesn't include the sushi......you are all retarded.  

Kitaro's isn't popular for their regular menu food......they are popular for the cheap sushi. 

The sashimi quality isn't the best but the only reason this place earns 4 stars is because of their inventive rolls that are far from traditional but make sushi eating a bit more interesting.  Of course now that it is a trend to create rolls that mimic this style it hardly seems original anymore.  Now I have more authentic establishments i frequent but when I am craving a non-traditional platter of rolls I COME TO KITARO....get it? got it? good.  

Get a clue.
Kitaro's never claims to be authentic Japanese food you crazies. 

do NOT go expecting the world with their sashimi (which still is priced well and decent quality) or judge Kitaro's based on their regular entree menu.....go for the cheap special rolls.  

i can say no more....

sorry if that was harsh but it had to be done!!
author: Crista Y.

description: This place is the McDonald's of Sushi.  Other than ordering their party platters on occasion (parties, get together, etc), I would not go out of my way to eat here.
author: S F.

description:
I am not one to eat sushi if I don't know about it before, bad things happen with bad fish...so I am happy to say that you don't have to worry about this one!

Kitaro has great sushi at unbelievable prices. The ambiance is not much to speak of but really not so important when you are eating cheap good food.

My favorites are the rainbow roll, which is huge and about half the price of every other sushi place in the city. The spicy tuna roll is yummy, and you can't go wrong with any of the sashimi or nigiri. I say yay to Kitaro
author: Lauren H.

description:
Everything here is just so-so. It's def. not the best place for sushi but they do have a lot of different rolls to choose from. I like how they are pictured so I get an idea of how they look like. 

I usually get the bento box with chicken teriyaki with salmon sashimi. Their portions are pretty big at a reasonable price. But the chicken is so bland and sometimes even burnt. The salmon sashimi isn't fresh. I've had better elsewhere. Ughh.. and their udon is just nasty. I can buy packaged udon from an asian market and make it myself which tastes a lot better for about 0.59 cents. I do like their salad though. The salad dressing is pretty good. 

The service isn't too friendly but I can't expect too much with there prices. Overall, it's better than sakana bune which is just next door.
author: Flora W.

description:
Its a cool place to have lunch or dinner with friends, but make sure you carpool together or you'll be spending the next 30 minutes looking for parking.

The tempura rolls are awesome though!
author: Tara B.

description:
There's nothing really bad about this place (well, the sushi really isn't the greatest as most probably have mentioned). For the prices they ask for there sushi rolls, you really can't complain.

It's cheap, and everyone knows it - it's gotta be the #1 reason why people go there - it is for me from time-to-time.

They have ample seating, but it gets packed quick, esp at night for dindin. 

I would strongly urge people to make sure they try proper sushi from a place that makes it 'fresh' with quality ingrediants and fish if you never have had sushi or have been afraid of it cos if this place is gonna be your first, you're gonna become a born-again-virgin.
author: M T.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday evening closer to 9 PM and was pleasantly surprised to see it somewhat crowded. There were plenty of diners enjoying rolls and main entrees. Who knew Geary had so many Japanese restaurants within a one to two block radius... I sure didn't.

The rolls ordered were pleasantly good and hit the spot as I was hungry like a wolf. Prices were decent and the portion of fresh fish was generous. I would definitely come back if I were in the neighborhood.
author: S L.

description: Not the best place for sushi, but for the price, you can't beat the value. Our go-to place if we are craving sushi but don't want to spend $$$. Plus, they always send us 15% off discounts in the mail every month.
author: E. L.

description: Inexpensive but high quality sushi.  I especially recommend the Dynamite Roll
author: Hillary W.

description:
i ordered the Shrimp & Vegetable Tempura for dinner today ..
it was pretty good for $7.99 ( plus tax? )

i would come here again as soon as i want sushi again =)
author: Eric W.

description: This place is horrible, never eat here.  The only people I see in here are college students who are too poor to eat anywhere else and people w/ no taste.  I came here and spit the food back out, literally.  I walked next door to Little Tokyo's and had a great dinner.  Avoid this place.
author: ElTiggerMalo M.

description:
Look, I know, how the heck am I giving this place three and a half stars when I give places like Ame four stars?  Well, to put it in context, this place is ridiculously cheap and fast!  At first I wasn't too keen on coming here because of all the so-so reviews but one of my friends swore by this place so the decision was made to come on a Saturday night.  Here's a tip.  Don't come on Saturday night.  The parking is INSANE!  We must have circled for about 30 minutes!  Not to mention that it's about a 25 minute drive from SOMA which is where we were.  If you must come for Saturday dinner, do not come at the peak times!  

That being said, the good news is that by the time we got to the restaurants our friends had not only gotten a table (there was a crowd waiting for tables by 6:30pm) but had ordered for us.  Great!  The food was not amazing but pretty good!  And once you factor in the price, it's a pretty darn good deal.  We got a salmon sashimi bento with rice, salad, soup and a huge helping of 6 salmon pieces for $12?  Damn!  And my friend swore that the prices had not increased since 2002.  The spider and godzilla rolls were both pretty good (but with lots of rice as to be expected at a place like this) and most of the rolls ranged from $3-$6.  Even the specialty ones!  We were in and out in about 30 minutes.  The negative is that service is pretty darn bad.  They dont' care.  Why should they?  They are the best deal in town! (or richmond).  I don't mind.  If I need a cheapo Japanese fix and am in the area, you can find me here!
author: Susan L.

description: This place is great because you can always find a coupon for it.  But their food is just average.  Nothing bad but nothing great.  More of a bento and noodle house more than the sushi.  Fast and simple service, though I wish their English was a little better for communication.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Not eating dinner til 10:30pm, Kitaro was near by I so ordered take-out. An order of the hamachi sashimi, spider roll, and a seaweed salad. The fish was not fresh and the spider roll was mushy. The only thing right was the seaweed salad. That's pretty sad, right?. I remember eating here before and I didn't think they were too bad. Either their quality got really bad or my taste got better. Whatever the reason--I'm not coming back again, ever!
author: Kim D.

description: Good, cheap and clean. We usually get out paying about $35 bucks for 2, that's with the %15 coupons they give. I always get the combo plate and a roll and I'm full.
author: Craig G.

description: The best deal you will ever find for decent, basic and fresh sushi.  There is no sushi bar to sit at and the seating is a bit awkward (but hey, it's SF where isn't it?)  and sometimes the service is disjointed, but you cannot beat the prices. Seriously. They have the best salad dressing ever, also veggie dishes and bento boxes.
author: Robynne W.

description: So I went w/ the boyfriend because we got recommended by a friend. We were shocked by prices. SUPER CHEAP. When we go the rollls we found out why KINDA SMALL. The flavor made up for the small size. The wait staff was ok nothing that made me wana scream but my water was empty forever. overall it was just what you paid for
author: Angel J.

description:
Not the best sushi place i have ever eaten, yet I still manage to find myself eating here close to once a week.

L-O-V-E the godzilla roll, and the Philidelphia roll is amazing (add avacado for even more yummyness). The hawaii roll is good too (Tuna and Avacado), ask to sub spicy tuna in for the regular tuna and it becomes even more amazing.

Can't beat the prices, and being able to pick it up and enjoy my favorite rolls in the privacy of my own home cannot be beaten.
author: Landon M.

description:
I used to love this place because the sushi was good and the prices unbeatable. Something changed a couple of months ago: the fish is not as fresh as it used to be. The rolls are huge!!  Way too much rice and only little fish.
Another thing I need to criticize: the smell in this place. I don't know what it is, but it ruins my appetite the moment I enter.
I do like their seaweed salad and the firecracker rolls.
author: Iphigenie S.

description:
Food below average and service is not that great. 
Their rolls are cheap and taste cheap, I think the rolls are overpriced for what you get.  

I ordered their donbori tonkatsu(miss spelled?). I was disappointed, expecting the tonkatsu to nice and crispy. I was wrong, the tonkatsu was soggy and it was rubbery. I think they microwaved the tonkatsu and fried an egg over it. Nothing special about this dish, and i would not recommend this dish at all. I could have made a better donbori than this garbage. 

I will not be going here again.
author: Eric N.

description:
Kitaro is delicious. The Chicken Udon, Katsu Don, and Beef and Chicken Teriyaki are some of the best you'll find in this part of the Richmond. 

I was hoping for cute Japanese girls working here but that wasn't the case.
author: I Like Food, Food Taste Good ..

description:
Kitaro Sushi? Sushi? Is that what it's called? I never understood what's so good about this place? Its usually packed with a wait outside. Okay, they serve Sushi. Not great, Not good, Not decent, Just okay. Why the wait? If you are waiting for your table, if you decide to go; cross the street and check out Purple Skunk. It's a great neighborhood store that carries skate and snow wear. 

No joking aside, I wouldn't go to the other sushi restaurant on the corner from Kitaro either. Ebisu anyone?
author: C L.

description:
Been coming here for a good cheap lunch for a couple of years.  Even cheaper with the discount coupon that is given on the back of my Safeway receipt.  However, I've noticed that the last three or four times I've eaten here that the Sashimi (yellow tail and salmon) has not been that good.  The slices were thinner,  the quality of the fish has gone down hill and once it even seemed old.

I do not plan on going back here any longer to eat Sashimi and only give it two star since then were a great deal and had decent cooked food in the past.  

I'm hoping that they read this and improve on the quality of their fish.
author: heavy h.

description: The food is decent and cheap but the service borders on terrible. The might do better to have a window to order from rather than have bored looking servers wandering around trying not to make eye contact. If you get take out - definitely check your order before you leave. They won't stand by their mistakes.
author: Julie C.

description: All of the complaining about the fish not being quality is ridiculous... Here's the deal... you want cheap, decent,  American-ized sushi, you come to Kitaro. You want authentic, "quality," sushi, you go elsewhere. During these hard financial times, you might want a cheap bite to eat, and Kitaro gets you in and out quickly, while filling your belly without breaking your pocket.
author: Kirsti P.

description: This is my go-to sushi place when I'm craving cheap sushi. It's not the best but I do love their firecracker roll and godzilla roll. Their selection is cheap and you get good portions for what you pay for. They have a combo where you get three different types of sushis for under $7-8. It fills me up quick. You get california roll, tempura, and I believe unagi roll. There's no substitutions.
author: Connie C.

description: This place isn't amazing, but the Firecracker's are.  I'm coming back here just for those little beauties, and at like $2.99 each, I'm getting like 10 orders.
author: Rachelle P.

description: One star for being CHEAP.  You definitely get what you paid. The sushi rice is not well cooked and the fish isn't fresh. If you're constipated, eating here will solve that problem.
author: Vinh T.

description: The fastest and cheapest sushi you can find!!! Long live the Godzilla Roll!!!
author: Todd C.

description: this place is pretty good, they got good bento lunches, and the sushi is pretty good. not too expensive but its a close location for me. service here is good, the place is pretty big. overall its a pretty good place and you will not regret trying this place.
author: Nevin T.

description: Look, if your rolling in the Benjamins go somewhere else. If your best friend is currently Lincoln and Jackson like mine are, by all means, eat here. I have been to some shiteous cheap sushi joints and this place is not one of them.
author: Rebecca S.

description: This place is good if you want cheap sushi.  I usually get the pink dragon  roll and a bento box. Their menu is basic and their portions are pretty good. I believe the owner also owns Kiki's in sunset so their menus are pretty much the same.
author: Juliana L.

description: Not the best in town- cheap sushi for Japanese food cravings and fix.
author: Brock L.

description: I came here to have lunch with a friend during a weekday afternoon. There was not much of a crowd so we had our pick of seating. I love sushi but was more in the mood for udon so I went ahead and ordered their chicken katsu curry udon lunch special, which was about $7. It was good but because half my mouth was numb from getting a cavity filled earlier in the day, I was not able to enjoy it as much as I would have liked. My friend ordered hamachi sashmi and three different rolls. I only tried one of her rolls but I really liked it and regretted ordering the special. The staff was very accommodating, especially with my friend's frequent requests. Our bill came out to be about $32, which was a bargain to me. I will definitely be back to try some of their rolls and possibly more of their lunch specials.
author: Maggie L.

description: great proportions and excellent food. i ordered a california roll and a super dynamite roll. It was GOOD. I tried my friend's chicken katsu and it was awesome, though i feel bad that I ate 1/3 of her chicken......but the price was reasonable and cheap for a japanese restuarant. I am most definately coming back here!
author: aryana c.

description: Great fast, cheap sushi!  I am hooked
author: Mark W.

description: Come here all the time. Love the dynamite roll. Service is ok but they're a bit stingy on the portions. Place sometimes gets packed, parking is a beeyotch. Nice place, nothing extraordinary *yawn*
author: Eddie 'bhong' V.

description: I had lunch at noon today. No lines no wait. Oh terriyaki chicken lunch special. Plus spider roll. 14 dollars.  Spider was awesome!
author: Stanley L.

description: Cheap n good. Kitaro/Kiki are sister sushi spots in Frisko and I always went to both. Depending how crowded it was. Kitaro is in the usf/panhandle district and Kiki's is more in the haight district. I think I tried everything on the menu but my fav. is the spicy tuna roll. I could eat it for days. These two by far are my favorite sushi joints in SF..
author: Criselle O.

description: Cheap sushi, fast service and super tasty!  They get my thumbs up.
author: Raychul M.

description: yeah, its cheap.  but the sushi is very average, the rice that is in the rolls is still warm...which makes the rolls kinds gross and mushy.... the service is hurried- they are in such a rush to get you in and out that it feels like a fast food joint.  For very little more $$, go to one of the 100's of other decent places in this neighborhood.
author: Ali M.

description: I am fat so I was elated when 6 rolls and tonkatsu was only $40!  This is a very good place if you are craving for hoards of sushi but dont want to pay a fatty arm or leg.  This is obviously not a Tsunami on Fulton or any other high end sushi restaurant.  You get what you pay for.  I would probably stick to the rolls and the hot food.  Eventhough I didnt order sashimi I am sure its not very good.  If you go at night time when all the fat, ugly people like me eat parking is easy.
author: Fatty A.

description: I'm here practically every other week, though sometimes I wonder why. It's just so quick and convenient and cheap and not bad tasting at all! Yeah... that's it. Well, go here, enjoy sitting practically on the laps of your neighbors, get the firecracker appetizer, some chicken karaage, vegetable tempura, and pay next to nothing. Not bad, eh?
author: Patrick G.

description: Kitaro isn't overly fancy, rather it, like Kiki, is a source of a range of sushi rolls at a very reasonable price.  Lots of roll options, most under $5, that may not be the most exotic items you will ever eat but that are competently prepared and served quickly.   A nice place to grab a quick meal, or to grab lunch and sit drinking tea for an hour on those rare days when Muni got me somewhere 45 minutes earlier than I expected.
author: Alured P.

description: Large quantities of edible fish with incredible pricing, but nothing spectacular. Let's be honest -- unlike in New York, you can't really screw up fresh fish on the West Coast unless you really desperately try to.
author: Audrey J.

description: The Japanese food here are tasty! Also wouldn't burn a hole in your wallet.  Yay!
author: Thanh L.

description: I'd have to give it a 3. This was a favorite stop for us back when we were in college. I remember it tasting a lot better and receiving better service. We may have to take this off our rotation and just make our way to Japantown.
author: Joie G.

description:
i can't say that kitaro is the best sushi restaurant in sf; but i can say that the sushi is better than average, and the prices are low enough to keep the place busy. i used to dine here weekly my first year in sf. i like this place a lot. the service is fast, yet avoids making you feel rushed.

my recommendations: kamikazi roll, godzilla roll, and anything else with yellowtail. mmm, yellowtail.
author: jason p.

description: Im sorry but this place is a sad excuse for Japanese food!!! Its the worst sushi place i have ever been too and i have been to a lot of different ones. It might be cheap, but you get what you pay for.
author: Lena F.

description: This is my absolute favorite place in the city for Japanese food. The food is not expensive and it's delicious! I've never ordered something from here that I didn't like. The vegetable tempura here is the best I've had anywhere. This particular restaurant is really ideal for locals. If you don't live nearby, you will more than likely get very frustrated trying to get here. Your parking experience will be very difficult unless you park in a garage.
author: Alano T.

description: The best in quality, service and surroundings. The food is good and cheap. The Godzilla rolls are good and you really can't beat the $2.00 rolls on the back of the menus. The chicken and crab are good. Quick bite s and yummy!
author: Stanley K.

description: A quick downhill slide...Kitaro has noticeably gone for the worse, which is disappointing.  The combination boxes have empty spaces - not cool. There are no more extra garnishing in the boxes and they switched the rice location with the salad so now you have rice in the middle of a big box and salad in a tiny one.  Service was bad.   My mom's entree came out 10 minutes before mine because they probably forgot - didn't get an apology while i was sitting there. The rolls were ok but nothing impressive. All in all, not worth it. I understand the economy is bad, but they should've raised prices not skimp on the food. It's all about quality and it used to be better in every category. Now they have even skimped on quantity besides quality.  Shame on you!
author: Natalie S.

description: The sushi here is Ok for passing by. But do you think it is authentic japanese food, Me think not but for the price because if you had cheap japanese this is not the place. Go to San Bruno called AKAGI's they are truly owned by a japanese family and the quality is excellent for the price that you pay.
author: jacqueline c.

description:
i went here today to eat with my family and we had...

pink dragon roll
beef terriyaki
grilled squid
unagi maki
yellowtail maki
tiger roll
sushi combo

this totaled to around $52 minus tips.

the food is good and cheap and FAST!!, but i'd say that the rolls are a little small.
author: Patty O.

description:
don't expect more if u pay a lower price.

kitaro offers fine but not traditional Japanese food

I like their lunch special, two choices from the menu starting from $5.99

It is Californian-Japanese style food, even the environments

Never try the dinner, so don't know how it tastes like.
author: Sue S.

description:
parking is a bitch, be prepared to wait after 7pm, tables are very close together (in other words, expect to be able to closely inspect the hottie that's trying to squeeze into the table next to you), but the service is fast

just disappointing not to see the chef who's preparing your food.
author: Alex O.

description: I give it Four Stars because it's so darn cheap and the sushi is actually ok.  Their salmon is steadily very tasty and the godzilla rolls are spicy and tempura battered.  It's scary when you order cheap sushi but not at Kitaro.
author: Dave L.

description: Kitaro is my favorite sushi place in the city, mainly because I only eat "fake" sushi. And this place has a great menu for us "fake" sushi eaters! Gotta try the California roll (the King of all "fake" sushi eaters) and the Kitaro roll is great too (basically a California roll with teriyaki chicken instead of the crab). And the sushi slices aren't too huge, so you don't end up looking like a rabid chipmunk when you eat it. Score!
author: Nilam P.

description: This used to be a weekly lunch for me and my friends way back when because Kitaro's had decent sushi at decent prices. Granted you could tell the sashimi wasn't of great quality, the rolls and bento boxes made up for it. They were both plentiful and good to the taste buds. But over the years the overall quality of the food took a dive and the prices went for a climb. On a recent journey there I found myself in awe of the bland rolls. Yeah, I've never had a sushi roll that I thought was bland. Kitaro used to be old dependable, but not anymore.
author: Al L.

description: Dirt cheap, quickly made sushi that's pretty good as long as you don't go with anything fancy.   Stopping for lunch, you can get 3 rolls for under $15 and have it ready in 5 - 10 minutes.  Not bad at all.
author: John H.

description: Same owner and style as Kiki's but for some reason (maybe parking) alot busier.  I think they need to bring the crunchy snowball to Kitaro.  Prices are still very cheap and reasonable.  However, just remember you get what you pay for.  Check on their website for discounts!!!  I usually get 15% off when I go there.  No it is not real Japanese, No it is not good Japanese, but it's darn cheap Japanese.  Students/minimum wage blue collar workers this is the spot for you!
author: Cory C.

description: I dig this place. I am pretty straight forward boring when it comes to my sushi. Don't like all the fancy rolls. There are two things that I like and I order them every time. They are so simple that it pains me to pay an absurd amount for something so simple. Here's where Kitaro steps in. It's not the best ,but it's cheap, tastes good, and I have never gotten sick here. What more could you ask for?
author: malarky j.

description: Came here for dinner one night around 8 and found that the restaurant was full. There was still a wait outside. I am a big fan of sushi..most especially unagi  and salmon rolls and was quite impressed with their sushi. Although it was not the best I've had, you get more than what you pay for. Sushi is cheap, presentable, and delicious! Every time I drive by this place, there is always a line extending out to the street...
author: Jennifer C.

description: My experience here, like the food, was good but nothing special.  The food was pretty cheap.  For example, a fried California roll (" Hot Dog") was only like $4. I had a teriyaki chicken plate which was pretty tender and yummy.  However, my sister's beef udon was the opposite.  The beef was totally dry.  In addition, the service was ok but they kinda just dump the food on the table. Overall, if you want some cheap decent sushi then come here.
author: Kevin L.

description: Me and the bf usually come here cause theyre cheap and decent. The service whenever we go is usually fast. Last night we went and ordered about 6 rolls, 2 misos, and 2 cokes between the two of us. The bill came to less than 40 dollars. Not bad.
author: Heather S.

description: Sushi is very reasonable and not bad at all.  If you lean towards the cook stuff, Kitaro is great!  They are sister restaurant to Kiki in the inner Sunset side of the Park.  Parking is a bear here too!
author: Kmaintl L.

description: this is my goto japanese place for lunch.  good prices good food.  good service.
author: john u.

description:
This place is good for a few things.

Before I get into the good, let me clarify that a satisfactory sushi meal is not one of the good things.

The good:

1.  If you like to frequent a place several times a week and NEVER get any smidgen of respect and or recognition that you are a repeat customer this place rules.

2,  If you like miniscule shavings of what must be nuclear cold fish over rice this is your spot.  It excels in this vain.

3.  If you a midget or dwarf or little person ( to be pc) I think you may have a shot at convincing the owners to turn the upstairs into an exclusive after hours midget disco.  Shit could be hot fire.  Invite Vern Troyer to opening night to really put it on the map.  The upstairs space is yearning for a real little people jump off spot.
author: Papandreou A.

description: A decent spot to get your sushi fix.  The quality is good, the portions are about average, the service is good, but the best part is the pricing and value.  Their selection of rolls range from $3 for a California roll to $8-$10 for the more extravagant rolls (i.e. Spider, Rainbow, etc.).  Nigiri pricing ranges from $2-$4.  My friend comes here a lot when he's looking to satisfy a sushi craving and not make a big dent on the wallet.  There's plenty of seating inside, but the limited street parking outside can be difficult.  I've had better sushi elsewhere, but for the price, it's hard to beat this place.
author: Mike M.

description:
kitaro is nice for a quick, cheap bite to eat. the quality of the food is pretty basic - they do a great tempura, but the sashimi... i'd say pass on that unless it is in a roll. 
the chicken teriyaki is cooked tenderly, but is a bit on the really sweet side. 
and the udon.... i found a piece of plastic in my udon. like plastic packaging. when i brough it up to our server, they basically said, oh do you want more? uh no, i don't. and instead of comping my udon, they were going to give us a discount off the bill.. but since we had a coupon, they "couldn't" give us an additional discount. so they told me that the next time i come back, they'll give me a free udon. a plain udon, not tempura udon like i originally had. so cheap. 
moral: eat here if you are poor, but don't expect anything fantastic.
author: Aletheia W.

description:
for the price you pay, this place is excellent for fairly good Japanese. not the best sushi, but it is very far from bad and the portions are healthy. expect a long wait on weekends, and even the weekday evenings are tough if you're hungry.

pink dragon roll = the win.
author: Darrell L.

description: For the price, it is perfect. They have a huge variety and you can have lots and lots of food and still come out paying a fraction of what you would pay anywhere else. I have been going here for so long and so often I should get frequent flier miles out of eating here. It is always nice to go where they know your name ;-) Word of caution: It can get very busy duing dinner time, but you can put your name on a list and they will seat you as soon as they can... your whole party needs to be there.
author: Amelia M.

description: Kitaro is one of Japanese lunch spots in the city. I usually get a bento box special because the portions are generous (the rolls are pretty big too) and the price is reasonable. The food is pretty tasty but the restaurant is really cramp. The tables are really close together and parking can be really difficult at times. However, the food does compensate for all of this. They have a decent variety of rolls and a little bit of flare to their menu. I have not been there recently so I do not know if things have changed.. but hopefully my schedule will die down and I can make a sushi trip out there.
author: Rochelle F.

description: Mediocre sushi for relatively cheap, but not worth the cost.   I ordered a cocktail, and it tasted like it came from the bottom of the shelf.  We ordered 5 different rolls for about $25, but I don't think we'll be going back.  You can find better sushi for just a little bit more.
author: Angel S.

description: Let's see...I love sushi...plain and simple.  They usually have fresh sushi, and sashimi.  Their rolls are really inexpensive and are really good.  I love the sashimi dinners and the fried tofu.  I just love this place.
author: Philip L.

description: Maybe I'm missing something here but the sushi is cheap and not disgusting at the same time!! Is it the best sushi I've ever had? No, definitely not. It is a dope aplace to go if you're broke and want to get a sushi fix. Everything I've tried here has been good so far. Thanks Kitaro for reminding me that I can walk into a sushi joint with 20 bucks, have a beer with my meal and get full.
author: Tommy P.

description: The sushi rolls are delicious and great for satisfying your cravings, but you can also tell that the quality isn't as great. If anything, just barely fair. It is a spot that I go on the regular to fulfill my sushi cravings because it's nearby. The atmosphere and service are just fine. I would recommend the dynamite and the godzilla roll. The katsu ramen fills you up and is the reason why I am going to change my three star review to four :)
author: Haven L.

description: This place is a great place to eat. For one, the prices are excellent. This place, as many reviews say, has the best bang for the buck for a sushi place. I have eaten here dozens of times and have never left unsatisfied with my meal. The quality of sushi might not be as good as in some other places, but it's good enough to taste fresh and yummy. The lines and waitlist can get big sometimes, but that's always a good sign. Plus they always got those 15% off your bill coupons in local papers and on back of Safeway receipts! So if yo are craving sushi, but don't wanna empty your wallet and still be able to get full, come to Kitaro.
author: Aleksey Z.

description: Pretty inexensive sushi.  The only rolls I like are the pink dragon roll (raw) and the alaska roll.
author: JACOB L.

description: Super good rolls at AMAZING prices.  Wow!  We felt like we were stealing!  Give it a shot.
author: Chantel Y.

description: Curry noodle vomit bowl. My girlfriend spit it out. I couldn't finish it. The "you get what you pay for" rule is in full effect here, and in this case, buying Alpo and spaghetti is a better bet. Steer clear.
author: Eric N.

description: I have been a fan of this restaraunt since we first discovered it about seven years ago, and it was delicious! But after about a year of not coming here, we decided to have dinner at Kitaro on Saturday. It's hard to find parking here, so keep that in mind.. Their portions have gotten much smaller over the years, too. I'm going to try the floating boat sushi place a block down from here next time.. it was crowded when we walked by. I also love browsing down the streets of Geary! They have many Russian markets and bakeries, AND there's this one irish bakery (john campbells' irish bakery ) and it's DELICIOUS!
author: Chantel Y.

description: I used to love this place... Until I found other sushi restaurants that are WAY better than this. I only loved this place because it was super cheap. The only rolls I like here is the Tiger Roll and Firecrackers. Other than that, the rest are just okay. If you order the Chicken Teriyaki boxes, they give you a large amount of them for around $7 I believe. Like I said, very cheap, but nothing to rave about. On the weekends, it's usually packed because I guess people want some cheap sushi... Service is fast also. But overall, it's just okay.
author: Vivian L.

description: This place is fine when you are craving somewhat cheap, Americanized Japanese food run by Chinese.  They have fast service when it comes to the food, but the service by the wait staff is horrible.
author: Cass J.

description: Great Place for sushi beginners but if you are a novice or expert....stay away! They use the lowest quality fish you can use and still serve it raw. If you have ever had top grade tuna, you will know what I mean
author: John D.

description: Good sushi, quick and especially cheap. The Philly rolls are good. Check out this place if you are in the area.
author: Shana G.

description: I ate here for lunch yesterday with a colleague.  The sushi was very standard, though the rock n' roll was pretty tasty.  The griled mackerel was also quite nice.  I would say you get a lot for your dollar here, especially at lunchtime.  So you can carb-up for an afternoon of trying to work hard with a food coma!
author: Erica H.

description: A little difficult to find parking. When you get there, theres usually a bit of a wait but they try to get you in fast. It's usually packed so you have to squeeze in. the food's pretty good though. I say try it once at least. It's not THAT special, but it's pretty good.
author: Lucky N.

description: Good place to eat sushi on a weekday. 15% off coupon from albertson's helps too. Love those $2 firecracker rolls
author: Michael N.

description: I've never had a bad meal at kitaro. The food is served quickly and the staff is friendly. Not to mention the prices are pretty cheap compared to other places. Its the sushi place to go on a regular day...me likes.
author: Maya L.

description: It's inexpensive, it's good, food comes out fast. You're in, you're fed, you're happy...or at least I usually am. No gripes.
author: Dolores L.

description: Mediocre sushi ... inexpensive but you get what you pay for.  The portions are on the small side and the fish tastes a little too fishy.  The service is fast and pretty friendly though.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description: I love, love, love Kitaro! Great place to get good sushi that's super cheap! You might want to get there early on Fri. and Sat. nights, as there is usually a crowd and parking really sucks, but its totally worth it. I highly recommend the Firecracker roll and the Dynamite roll. They can be a bit spicy, but melt in your mouth. Amazing. And the mango mochi for dessert? Awesome. And hey, if you don't want to drive around looking for a spot all night, you can call in and get a to go order and just double park while you wait for it, so much easier.
author: Anastasia V.

description:
Kitaro is my favorite inexpensive Japanese/sushi restaurant around, but it definitely has its drawbacks.  

Kitaro is on Geary Street down by 20th...it's always a beast to find parking, but once that aggravating experience is over you get to wait (outside because they have no room inside) for a table...weekend nights are the worst, this place is always always always crowded (probably because the food is so cheap and decent).  You write your name on a list and they'll call you as soon as the table is available - what is most annoying is you have to have your entire party present before they seat you.  But once you are finally seated the evening will change for the better.  You've gotten all the negative experiences out of the way, bring on the tastiness!

This place has FAST service.  They depend on high turnaround, so they will serve you as quickly and efficiently as they can.  But you can take your time, they are quick without rushing you too badly.  The menu is extensive, with two large pages of hot food and bento boxes and two large pages of sushi rolls and also a page of specials.  They have great everything.  From the hot food items, their chicken or pork katsu are great, I looooove the sauces.  They also have a decent teryaki sauce, I like their salmon teryaki.  The dinners and bento boxes all come with miso soup, a salad, and loads of sticky rice.  For the bento boxes you can choose two main items from a list - and that includes sashimi!  I usually get a bento box with two of the four sashimi options - red tuna, salmon, albacore tuna, and yellowtail.  Their sashimi is really good grade, the fish melts in your mouth and has never had that iffy "fishy" taste - the fish is always super fresh and smooth.  A bento box will run you 9 - 14 bucks, that is damn cheap for the amount of food, we almost always have some leftovers.

The sushi here is awesome.  They have a roll for everyone...I especially like their Dynamite roll (spicy tuna roll that is deep fried and then has that  spicy red "rooster" sauce drizzled on top) and their Godzilla roll (tuna and crab roll also deep fried with a creamy wasabi sauce).  Try the lobster salad roll, you get two huge pieces of sushi heaped with delicious lobster in a creamy sauce with crab and shrimp meat, yum.  The firecrackers are also quite good, you get five pieces of deep fried yellowtail rolls that is covered with the katsu brown sauce and a zesty orange sauce.  Yum.  

They also cover all the basic rolls - shrimp tempura, rainbow roll, eel, soft crab, california roll, phillie roll (tuna with cream cheese), they even have two chicken rolls - baked, of course - available for those who don't really like raw fish but want to try sushi.   They also have nigiri and cut rolls - of the nigiri, the garlic albacore tuna is super.

Expect ridiculously fast service - like I said, they depend on high turnaround since so many people generally like to eat here, so they will bring out your food asap.  Also expect to get a lot of good food for a little bit of money.  I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is under 16 bucks...and most of it is in the 9-12 dollar range.  The rolls are all under 9 bucks, I'm pretty sure most of them are around 6 dollars.  That is a good price these days when I see other sushi places serving a roll of eight pieces for like 14 bucks.  

Try it for yourself - yes, there are way better sushi restaurants in the city - but do you really want to spend an arm and a leg for some raw fish and rice when you can get super tasty and good combinations for way less?  I ALMOST FORGOT!  If you shop at Safeway, check out the back of your receipt - Kitaro has 20% off coupons on the back of Safeway receipts, so your meal can be even cheaper!
author: Marie R.

description:
So this place use to be a chinese restaurant.  And guess what? It still smells like it.  There is no ventilation in this place.  Better hope the front door is open, cause that's the only air flow.  It's so stuffy at Kitaro and small tables.  

Sushi is sub-par at best.  People just like fancy sushi rolls and the pictures on the menu.
author: Jen C.

description: If youre in the mood for Cheap Sake bombs and cheap sushi...Kitaro is perfect for you. If youre looking for the best tasting sushi, this is not the place to go.
author: Christy B.

description: I come here to eat sushi. I've been here probably countless times and tried every single sushi roll that's on the menu. Let me just say that they're all pretty awesome. This place has the most reasonable price's I've ever seen for a sushi restaurant. I've ordered sushi platters and they're awesome for any parties you might be throwing.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: I know a lot of people hate on this place...but admittedly I am no sushi expert, nor am I any kind of sushi snob.  We picked up a couple trays of sushi platters for a potluck and they were A-okay in my book!  They only cost about $25 for 50 pieces of all cooked sushi...and they don't need much notice.
author: Judy K.

description:
Dude, I dont know why I keep coming back here...
I feel like the chick who tries to leave her abusive boyfriend but realize she misses him and comes back for more punches...
Why do I keep doing this to my self!?
Is it because its one of the few places that serve awesome Spider Rolls and Soft Shell Crab for 5 bucks? That itself is worth 2 stars. But the rest of the food is terrible, ever heard of mass produced California Rolls? I have cuz I think I have seen the machines that make them. I always end up on the toilet after a trip to Kitaro, and I hate sitting so close to strangers! I can't have a perfectly fine conversation with my girlfriend without offending someone or hearing another white guy try to 'impress' his asian girlfriend with his "knowledge" of asian culture. Stay away and if you must eat here stay away from raw sushi or tuna or else your new buddy will be the toilet!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Harry B.

description: This was one of my favorite sushi places in the city when I was living in the Richmond.  It's totally a neighborhood hot spot with lines out the door starting at 6pm on any given night.  We used to call in our order and pick up.  I love their Pink Dragon Roll - basically a California roll with more imitation crab in it and cooked salmon on top with a special sauce.  Of course there are much better Japanese restaurants in the city, but Kitaro is cheap, with quick service.  Do not expect top notch - but for a neighborhood restaurant that won't break your bank, it's worth a try.
author: Denise M.

description: Dammit... I guess I should've tried their sushi. Well, I had the tempura udon, and it was VERY good too. :)  I was amazed at how cheap it is there, and the quality of the food is really good too. Very fresh, and the service is unbelievably fast.
author: Marina K.

description: If you're lookin for a laid back, fast service, cheap and yummy sushi restaurant, this is a place to die for. I specifically like the chicken karaage, fried tofu in soy sauce, spider, tempura and unagi rolls. Also, if you're out with a friend who doesn't eat raw fish, you have plenty of other selections to choose from the menu. Despite this is a chinese owns japanese restaurant, the food still tastes utterly delicious. They prove that good japanese food doesn't have to come in big $$.
author: Michael K.

description: Hit or miss, went tonight and the tuna wasnt fresh, also the miso soup doesnt have tofu in it, kinda something that is expected in miso. Only sure fire thing is the california roll and tempura.
author: Simone C.

description: Very nice Japanese Restaurant.   It's good for lunch.   Not expensive.  Not very fancy.   Not that great, but good sushi.  We enjoyed it.
author: Leon P.

description:
clean place with above average service, cheap eats and above mediocre sushi/food, imho.

but yeah, parking is savage! i had to stalk a couple from geary to california. i think i scared them because they walked a ladder-like route, not stopping, instead of the 90 degree thing. i should've known better, with their irritated head turning. kinda reminiscent of when someone kicks your seat repeatedly at a movie theater. the "you're so annoying! quit it! get the picture! arrghhh!" head whip. i didn't care. 

i was like some sort of social deviant: the more they entertain me with their head movements, the more i derived pleasure from it.
author: Vanessa D.

description: If you are looking for quality sushi this is not the place to go to, but dam the food is really a bargain.  My mom and I had four rolls and a bento box for $23.  We received an extra 15%  from a coupon that they  always send out in the mail.  You can't argue the price.  I've had crappier sushi from more expensive places.  Oh and their bento boxes have a unique ordering system, they are all individually priced and you get to choose your own combination.  This way you will get what you want.  Why can't all restaurants do this?
author: Ben M.

description: My in-laws go to Kitaro for lunch sometimes, but we ordered take out from there last night and it was GREAT. Sometimes Japanese take out can get pretty terrible steaming away in those boxes but everything stayed great -- sushi was cold and good; tonkatsu, tempura, and chicken karage was still crispy! It was shocking actually. The portions were good sized too and it was quite reasonably priced -- we ate everything. The other great thing is that they use those biodegradable plastic take out boxes. We'll definitely do that again.
author: L. M.

description: Great rolls - particularly the Dynamite and the Godzilla - at great prices.  I wouldn't wander far from the rolls, though.  The katsudon was a little chewy and way too onion-y for my tastes.
author: Tim G.

description: They pressured us quite a bit and presented the bill befeore asking if we were finished--after we had ordered, re ordered, and ordered more in waves and clearly could potentially not be done. We had lots of beer and had a decent tab built up, and though the place is cheap and the fish is decent, I wouldn't go back because of the pushy service (it would seem attentive except that it was very unclear who our waiter was and no one looked very happy)...but why would I want to hang out in f'ing Richmond anyway?
author: Caroline C.

description: I love Kitaro! Their salmon sashimi is the best and it's really cheap. The service is always fast and prompt. I can always count on having good, cheap, quick sushi here and would recommend it to anyone.
author: Tula A.

description:
cheap cheap cheap

decent

its cheap sushi do you really expect much as far as quality?

i was stuffed only spent like $12

downside: it was kind of hot inside
author: Trent D.

description:
if you're looking for good japanese food, best not to come here lol but if you're looking for a japanese fix on a budget (esp. with the economy being so bad), then this is the place to go!

the thing is that japanese food is not cheap. you dont often find cheap japanese food, esp in restaurants. and if they are, they arent that great. 

i would go here simply for that. it's cheap and passes the tasting test.
author: Eliza C.

description: If I could give it a 0, I would. I only come here because my cheap ass friends likes it here. For some odd reason whatever I eat here, I end up in the bathroom. Seriously I know their food isn't fresh, but I can't believe they're willinging to sever expire food... If you want good food... you do not want to be here....
author: Will C.

description: If you are broke, a college student, or shop at the Safeway on 7th (look on the back of your receipt, there usually is a coupon for Kitaro) then, this place is for you. It isn't bad, and it isn't spectacular. However, it is super affordable sushi, and you won't get sick. There aren't any creative weird rolls, but they are generous with the sushi cuts.I like the dynamite roll, which is like a couple bucks, and I get the spicy tuna rolls, the Hawaii roll, kamikaze roll, and rainbow rolls. Stay away from the crispy salmon skin rolls..yuck! I have been there too many times to count. Service is not too good, but for some reason it doesn't bother me (probably because the sushi is so damn cheap!) Also I don't recommend any of the ramen dishes, it is rather tasteless. The Miso is okay.
author: Suzy M.

description: service is okay, at times really busy and slow. the rolls are okay, nothing extraordinary, i have had better rolls before. the bento box is worth it, you do get alot for a cheap price.
author: Stella J.

description: We really like this place. The food is reasonably priced and even better when you get the coupon from the valuepak that comes in the mail. Really like that they have a variety of non fish sushi such as teriyaki chicken, and lots of vegetable sushi. My son loves the unagi nigiri. The portion size is good to, as the the prices of the bento boxes. Can't beat their good, cheap, fresh Japanese food!!
author: S E.

description: cheap japanese sushi roll eats....but stick to the cooked stuff....when prices are this low..the quality has to be questionable.....but again..it's cheap cheap cheap cheap....under $10
author: Hen A.

description:
Kitaro. What more can I say about it that others haven't said already. Their food is pretty cheap for Japanese and I haven't been here for a good three years so I thought I'd order some food to-go.

Looking for parking is insane, as expected. Circled a bajillion times. Damn me for not remembering what they had on the menu so we couldn't order ahead of time. Finally, after 20 minutes of circling, a spot right in front opened up.

We can combine two entree into a combo? Alright! So I opted to try the Chicken Karaage & Tonkatsu. I remember the karaage used to be pretty good so I chose that. And it still is pretty good. One of the best compared to most mid-price Japanese restaurants. The tonkatsu, however, is a little dry and I could have done without it. The salad was a little bland/bitter.

Now onto the rolls. We ordered the Kamakaze, Philly, Alaskan and Tekka roll. For the price, they were pretty damn good. Sashimis were fresh and there was a good amount of it in the rolls so they didn't go skimp just because it was cheap.

I'd come here again whenever I feel like cheap sushi rolls or chicken karaage.
author: Jimmy N.

description: if you want high quality sushi, this is not your place.  but bang for the buck-wise, this place is GREAT!  The best deal is if you bring a coupon (they have them in the local Valu-pak mailings).   most of the basic rolls are fine.  i'm not really a fan of anything with the crab in it.  i seem to recall the chicken teriyaki was pretty solid.   i always seem to order the seaweed salad.  service is fast and attentive.
author: Yvette H.

description:
fast service, cheap food, pretty good for groups 10 and under.

decor is whatever, its pretty messy,, and crowded. this is good place for a quick meal. def wouldn't come here to eat straight up sashimi, but for bento boxes and rolls. i would come here for sheer quantity, not quality. but you get what your pay for. good for casual eats w/ close buddies.

came here w/ a big group, they really cranked it out even though there were other people.
author: Irene C.

description: This place was SOOOO good when I first started going there, but I guess eventually I tried more places that was definitely comparable to Kitaro and above. Try their PINK DRAGON ROLL, its really good! Their teriyaki chicken/beef and basically bento boxes are HUGE! You most likely won't be able to finish it. Their sushi is not bad at all, and the prices are really reasonable for Japanese food. There used to a super long waits, but it has gone down throughout the years. However, don't expect to get a seat right away either. Oh yeah, their service kinda sucks.
author: Elaine H.

description: my friends like going here because this place is unbelievably cheap and quick. It's always busy at dinnertime, and parking is a bitch especially with all those damn double-parked cars in front of the place!
author: kristin e.

description: I'm not a big rolls fan, but despite what other people have said about the fish quality, I thought the salmon sashimi was pretty good.  It's not your typical place which only gives you 7pieces or so for dinner.  They give you double the amount.  It was more than filling.  Put your name on the list and expect to wait 15-20 min for a table, depending on the size of your group.  This place is always busy...so turnaround can't be that bad.  When you're looking for something cheap and plentiful, then try Kitaro.  If you want better quality fish, go elsewhere.
author: JeFF T.

description: Cheaper rolls but very crowded and a long wait time.  It's decent for the price.
author: Derrick V.

description: After driving around the block 20 times waiting for some to leave and I would park, we finally sat down to eat. Pricing were super cheap and the food wasnt that bad. Sashimi could have been a little fresher, but some of thier roll combinations were pretty good. FIRECRACKER roll was definately the best we ate. BUT the prices were super cheap and compared to other sushi places we eat at, it wasn't that bad.
author: Jamie K.

description: Cheap place for decent (not great) sushi given in generous portions. Nothing spectacular. Service is sometimes really slow and rude. We only eat here once in a while when we're in the area to pay a visit to our friends who live just around the corner. But they don't like this place, so we'll probably start trying out the neighboring Japanese restaurants per their recommendations.
author: Christine K.

description:
i have a question . . . if kitaro is a terrible as some of these review say, then why is it that it's always packed? yes, it's probably not the highest quality sushi but every time i go, it's generous, cheap, and fresh tasting . . .  not to mention that the staff is super nice.

the fact of the matter is that in japan, they don't eat sushi on the scale that we do. it's a novelty, it's an every now and then thing, so saying it's unauthentic is bunk. the idea that we treat it like going out for pizza or grabbing a deli sandwich is.

i'm on a budget, i like good cheap food, i'm down with kitaro. if they only had any variety of ume rolls, i'd give it 5 stars . . .  but hey, pobody's nerfect.
author: Wendolyn A.
