description: Since sushi is so expensive in most Japanese restaurants, I usually come here to feed my sushi cravings.  It's cheap, fair, and they have lots of modern sushis.
author: Mellie P.

description: I like Kitaro... they're not fantastc or cutting edge, but the sushi is good, the service is good and the price is good.
author: Nicole L.

description: The rock and roll is good. Everything else is just standard. The service is mediocre and the portions are okay. My friends like to eat at this place because it's not too expensive and the food's decent. We get seated pretty fast because it's never packed. The bathroom is kind of dirty. Overall, not a bad place if you get the valpack coupons in the mail every month for this place. And honestly, this place is not as cheap as it seems.
author: Shizuka L.

description: When I crave sushi, Kitaro's is the ONLY place I want to go to. I love the masks on the wall and how their lit. The environment is very welcoming and increases appetite! The sushi is made fresh every time I go. It's inexpensive, the service is great, and I'm always satisfied when I leave...sometimes too satisfied haha!
author: Joshua C.

description: You get what you pay for.  It is cheap and so is the quality of the food, but you should know that already before you go.  I wouldn't trust the raw fish here.  If you want a mountain of meat, get any of the teriyaki dishes and ask for extra rice.  Quick service and crowded.   Couple your food with Sake bombs for an added effect!
author: Jason A.

description: Yes, its true, it is very cheap, but the quality isn't all that bad. the service i give 3 stars too as well, but they're still helpful and mostly attentive. Some of their sushi is very original, and some can make u happy for the moment. i'd still go there anytime that i can.
author: Janelle H.

description: 3 1/2. Kitaro is my neighbor restaurant for quick, fast, CHEAP, good sushi. Tonight we shared a bunch of rolls. The 49er is really good! Spicy tuna, crab, and avocado are rolled and topped with tobikko. We also had the Hawaii roll, which is tuna with avocado and the tiger roll: shrimp tempura with avocado and bbq eel. All were delicious. We also ordered an dinner entree of beef teriyaki. We were so stuffed by the sushi that we barely finished the beef. For all this and a side of edamane... our total came out to be $28 for 3 people!! Super cheap!!
author: Denise L.

description:
overrated. no good. i dont' see why people even bother to wait in line for this kind of japanese food. if you walk into any restaurant in j-town its better then this. even something that is chinese own japanese restaurant. the sushi boat next door (old one called sushi tomo, not new one) is better then this place.



__________________________________

edit on 2.13.07
took long for them to give us a table. we at down. blah blah... 
looked at the menu. ordered 2 rolls, 1 bowl of noodle, 1 12 piece yellow tail. the sushi was horrible. they need to REPLACE THEIR DAMN KNIFE so they can cut the sushi into pieces. each one we picked up by the chopstick were not cut precise and it was also stuck with the other piece. which damaged the whole piece of sushi. (don't get me wrong, i'm not american, i'm chinese and i know how to use my chopsticks!). also i took a look into the kitchen., GOD DAMN. GET THOSE NON-JAPANESE PEOPLE OUT OF THE KITCHEN. it was sad. the yellow tail was soon thin and small, i think if you take 6 pieces it would equal the thickness of any hard core sushi restaurant in SF. this place isn't worth it. they charge you .49 cents for TEA too.
author: Eric Y.

description:
deccent sushi at a deccent price. the fish is fresh and that's always a plus for me. when we get tired of eating at the usual sushi joints we head over to kitaro. 
it's got a cool decor with masks on the walls. I like to stare at them while i eat.
author: Bee C.

description: The four people in my party had each spent between one and two years in Japan recently and so mos def had something to compare this place to.  The lunch combos are huge and pretty good for non-sushi Japanese fare like tempura or karaage (fried chicken morsels).  If you're in the mood for American-style sushi - rolls and sauces - this place's prices probably can't be beat.  Some of the other reviewers have been a bit harsh in my opinion.  There's a market for cheap sushi joints, and there are certainly enough of them in Japan.  I'd come back here for lunch again when jonesing for a fix and not looking to spend too much money for a higher-end place.  The place is unassuming and did the job.
author: Paul C.

description: Yum city! Kitaro is right on my street so I'm always getting takeout- for how inexpensive everything it's superrr! I love the Mexican roll, Philly roll and surfer has seaweed salad on top
author: Dylan M.

description: Best sushi in town.  I ve been coming here for years and it is still the freshest in the city
author: Karen S.

description:
Kitaro is my favorite Japanese restaurant to go to when I'm craving for sushi!

The prices are wonderful! The food tastes great! I always leave satisfied and full. I mean 9 rolls of sushi for $40?! Can't get any better than that!

You get your food pretty quick and the servers are nice (sometimes).
author: Gayle L.

description: I live on the Peninsula but someone introduced me to this place a few years back and I occasionally make the trek to the City to eat here.  The food is inexpensive and good.  I always get the Chicken Teriyaki and Shrimp / Veggie Tempura.  Is it the best food in the world?  No, but it's straightforward good for a low cost, so I'm a fan.  Check it out if you are in the neighborhood.  Service is good too!  I went for lunch today and for a super bargain go for their lunch specials!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Kitaro has great sushi, but it's still not my favorite... The tempura is much better... Great prices, but it's always WAY TOO CROWDED... Every time I've been there, I've sat elbow to elbow with someone I didn't know and that was very very unfriendly...
author: Lindsey S.

description: Better than boat sushi but not anywhere close to Yum Yum fish sushi. Service was lackluster, food was okay to good but everything was convenient. Found parking quickly, got seated right away and food came fast. Perfect for a quick Monday night dinner out.
author: Amanda L.

description: I'm a big fan of this place--sushi is cheap cheap and good!!!  I'm not super adventurous when it comes to sushi, but I love spicy tuna and I think it's pretty darn good at Kitaro (nothing in the roll but the fatty tuna)...definitely gives me my sushi fix (for $2.99--good grief!).  I also enjoy the 49er roll (more spicy tuna!).  And, like others have said, I love their tempura...for the carnivores, their steak teriyaki is definitely worth trying.  And, I know the place is already cheap enough, but you can always get a coupon off of their website (or check the back of your Safeway receipt!).  Negatives--parking can be difficult (take-out is great), and I would NOT recommend their chicken udon (go with tempura, or go somewhere else for noodles).
author: Joyce L.

description: Very cheap sushi rolls. Decent priced bento box, not my favorite sushi place in the city but it's popular and often crowded.
author: Yan M.

description: I'm not too picky when it comes to my Sushi restaurants.  Kitaro is trendy, in the neighborhood, inexpensive and tastes good.  A good place to go before or after a show with friends, or for a first date.
author: Gail O.

description:
for what you pay for, you get your money's worth. it's not the ideal place for sashimi, but their specialty rolls are great. they have vegetarian rolls and you can make your orders spicier upon request. the most expensive roll is about $5, so $10 will get you far and full! if sushi isnt your forte, create a bento box. have some fun and do some sake bombs too. their unfiltered sake isnt half bad either. 

unfortunately, the wait is long and parking is difficult. on busy times, have someone put your name down on the waiting list while someone finds parking.
author: marlene m.

description: I love this place!! The food is inexpensive and really good!! Whenever we come here, we get seated right away! The sushi is fresh, and the tempura and deep fried oysters are good and crispy!  You can basically create your own bento box for a fraction of the price compare to other sushi restaurants in that area! My bf and I order tons of food and we never leave there with a check more than $35 including tip!!
author: Lissie B.

description: Come for fast, but not particularly good service.  Run-of-the-mill menu items, always seems fresh. Generally good value for money, easy to get used to this place if you eat out often and don't need to be wowed by the experience. Usually a short wait if you arrive after 7:30PM.  If you order take out combo meal (bento box) they do not serve the soup you'd get if you dined-in.  I guess that doesn't say much for miso if it's less expensive than styrofoam.
author: Ken B.

description: I must say that I had some pretty bad experiences with the food at Kitaro before, but the last time I went, I was pleasantly surprised by the improvement!  I'll go back there again and see if the quality is consistent, but I must say, the prices are irresistible!  If you are going there at night on Fri or Sat, good luck with parking!!!!
author: Karina L.

description: Kitaro used to be one of my favorite sushi restaurants a few years ago. Quantity and quality used to be close to 5 stars, but has dramatically decline in recent years. I am sad to give it three stars, but I've been disappointed with Kitaro more than a handful of times in the last 4 years. The fish doesn't taste as fresh as it used to. Instead, there's an iciness to the fish (overly icy where you'd crunch on it) leaving me to think that it has been frozen for a while. The rolls are still good, but not as stellar as it used to be. I don't mind paying more if I was getting the same quality from Kitaro's glory days (at the old location).
author: Teresa Y.

description: I have been going to Kitaro for years now and I believe they have the best sushi and the most reasonable prices. They have a very freindly staff and I have never had any problems with the sushi. The sushi is always fresh and great. BEST SUSHI PLACE!!!!
author: Nikita K.

description: Great place for a quick lunch.  I love the grilled whole squid!  And the sushi is really fresh!
author: Chai S.

description: Now here is a safe and predictable place to dine.  It's not fancy and great but it's not bad at all either.  The service is quite fast and the food is very edible.  You know exactly what yuo're gonna get when you order your food.  For staters I had the Spicy tuna roll and my friends had some other rolls.  For entree I had the Combo Dinner with Shrimp Tempura & Beef Teriyaki and came with Miso Soup, salad and rice.  Everything was good and we walked away satisfied and full.
author: gordon g.

description:
I love Kitaro. It's my fall-back Japanese Restaurant.. take out food place. It's great for people that live in the neighborhood. It's not the most amazing, absolutely special Japanese food, but I always enjoy myself here and I do love the food. 

I especially love the coupons they send out in the mail. For business meetings or gatherings, I always use the coupons [can find on the website too] to purchase the party trays. In fact now that I think of it, whenever I need to bring food for a meeting, I always get it from Kitaro. 

I haven't actually eatten at Kitaro in a while. I remember it being a great place to go eat in the early afternoons for lunch as there wasn't much of a wait for a table. I do remember it being frustrating on the weekend nights because of the wait. 

It's definitely great for take out and great for meetings. It's reasonably priced and everyone is very friendly. I'd say friendly but not quite enough to be memorable as I cannot remember one single person who works there, nor their face. But I do not have any complaints to the service what so ever.
author: nightlife i.

description: This is the place to go for cheap, average Japanese food--nothing out special really. Service feels rushed, for the second I finished, they swept my plates away.
author: Kannika L.

description: The food deserves 5 stars but the service was CRAP!!!! If you don't mind having to wait a long time for your right order to come to the table and if you have a lot of time to spare come to this restaurant.  The food is great, I love the variety of sushi they have.  But the service was unprofessional.
author: Aileen D.

description: I was going to give this place three stars, but they get one star for deception.  I only went here because I got a 15% off coupon in the mail and who wouldn't want to take advantage of a little discount?  I ordered food to go and the whole process felt very rushed.  I didn't know what I wanted yet and the waitress literally stared at me for two minutes while I made up my mind.  It was really awkward and I felt really pressured to order as soon as possible.  The food came around pretty fast as well, but I felt like something was missing.  I ordered a chicken teriyaki dinner and an assorted sashimi dinner to go, both of which come with rice, salad, and soup.  When I got home, I noticed that the soup was missing, which is a huge bummer because I ordered for my grandmother and she likes soup a lot (must be an old person thing; I don't know).   I called to ask them if I could just swing by and pick up two orders of soup, and the lady said that to go orders don't come with it, even though the menu online and the takeout menu at the restaurant both say that the dinners come with rice, salad, and soup.  I could understand if somewhere on the menu it stated that soup wasn't included and I was in the wrong here, but it doesn't say that anywhere.  Such a disappointment.  I would not come back here.  The food was just okay, and the lady on the phone made no effort to ameliorate the situation when I was clearly disappointed.
author: k h.

description: I remember when Kitaro used to be on 23rd-24th n Geary in this little hole in the wall.  Then when it made it's move over to 22nd-23rd n Geary, the clientele just grew!   The portions are more than you expect from a japanese resturant.  Costs: $8-10 for the entree/bento/donburi/udon.  Rolls: $3-8 depends what type you get.  Usually have to ask for a doggie bag.  Only problem is: no reservations, you must write your name on the board outside and wait to be called.  I recommend going during off-peak hours to avoid crowds.  Lunch is ideal b/c it's a bit cheaper for the same food served at dinner.
author: Christi S.

description: Kitaro is one of my favorite places to get sushi!  My boyfriend (half Japanese boyfriend, I might add.  If anyone knows sushi- it's him.  His mother makes it herself!) and I are there at least one night a week to chow down on all the nigiri we can get!  It is super cheap, and really, really good.  The nigiri is ALWAYS fresh, soft, and tender, and the Spicy Tako nigiri (octopus) is to die for!  The cheap, fruity sake cocktails are a great pick-me-up, and their main courses are very good, BUT not amazing.  Anyone who I have brought here loves it- especially the price!
author: Melissa R.

description: Kitaro is a cute Japanese restaurant in the Richmond and it has a good variety of rolls and sushi. We got a table for 3 on a Friday night very quickly. The wait staff is also very attentive. Try the 49er roll!
author: Patricia M.

description: This is your basic cheap Americanized Japanese restaurant.  I won't review on the sushi since I've never tried it, but the bento boxes aren't bad at all.  I've come here on numerous occassions with friends and the food is consistent, service is fast, and meals very affordable (dinner bentos are around $8 for miso soup, rice, salad, and entree).  I've come to really like their chicken karaage, which are like chicken nuggets but better.  Though this hasn't struck me as a oh-my-gosh-now-this-is-what-you-call-japanese-food kind of place, I still give it three stars for value and consistency.  Plus, they always have coupons on the back of Safeway receipts and in the Valu-Paks in the mail.
author: Swirls L.

description: Read my review on Kiki's and remove all the flaws, except for the parking issue. Kitaro's will always hold a special place in my heart. Their rolls always blow me away. So yummy. They had one w/ kiwi before that made me smile from cheek to cheek. That's amazing, especially since I don't even know what that cliche refers to. Anways, go plenty early to find parking and to sign up for a seat. There's ALWAYS a wait. And please please please, fight the temptation to give up and just eat at another Japanese place close by. I've done it before, and regretted it.
author: Axel G.

description: I consider myself a "sushi connoisseur" and have spent a small fortune on discovering what makes great sushi. The two basic ingredients are 1.) fresh HIGH quality fish, and 2.) is HIGH quality well-made rice. This place lacks in both. Yes I agree Kitaro has the cheapest sushi in San Francisco  but their sushi is gross. It smells and taste fishy, and the fish appears to be low in quality and days old.
author: Kat F.

description: This is by far the cheapest and great tasting sushi place I have been to in a long long time. A group of us had just come from wine tasting in Napa and we stopped by this place because one of the girls we went with used to come to this restaurant all of the time. We had two plates of sashimi, 5 combination rolls, a combo bento box and two bottles of sake...all for $70. The fish was fresh had great flavor. It was grrrr-eat!
author: Verissa S.

description: This place is expensive for it's inexpensive quality food. I wouldn't pay this much for this type of generic Japanese food. It's gotten worse and worse over the years... The place does not seat comfortably since the seats are all really close together. I can't say this place is worth my penny anymore... do some homework if you want generic japanese food.
author: Wil M.

description: This place was ok.  My tempura was nice and crispy.  You'll find all the normal Japanese dishes here.
author: Alan T.

description: 3.5 stars. Cheap, cheap sushi perfect for poor, poor college students Yes, nothing mind-blowing, but this was the perfect stand-by for awhile for big rowdy group dinners during my grad school years.
author: Kimi W.

description:
come here if you're looking for quick cheap sushi.  quality is mediocre/poor.  their salmon sashimi was strange and fibrous, i lost my appetite!! you'll be semi-satisfied with the prices and service. i've had better sushi for the same prices.  coupons/discounts are also easy to come by (look behind your safeway/lucky's receipts)/google before going in.  the spicy firecracker whatevers are tasty otherwise everything else is eh .. don't get the fried katsu shrimp (tastes fresh out of the freezer).

been here a few times in the past but decide to come here recently to give it another chance and because little tokyo was closed for mid-day ... what a very sad day that was.
author: Amanda N.

description: Parking is TERRIBLE!  On a Friday night, when you crave some Japanese food and you're hungry there is almost NO parking.  You usually have to end up parking a lot of blocks away just to get there.  There's this really cocky waiter there, I don't like him.  Haha.  Food is great, it could be better but I'm not complaining.  I'm absolutely in love with the katsu-don donburi.  Oh, btw, you can get 15% coupons on their website or on the back of some safeway receipts.
author: Tina L.

description: I actually like Kitaro (not like a lot of people here) 'cuz I go here not really expecting bomb-ass sushi. I'm expecting fat rolls of w/e faux sushi my hungry stomach wants to take down. It reminds me somewhat of Sushi Deli in SD just because you aren't always ordering nigiri or hand rolls but you're hitting up the ~4 dollar Mexican rolls. I kind of just ignore everything else on the menu usually. Eat 'till your stomach hurts (which costs me about 16 bucks usually).
author: Andrew N.

description: Had my first date with my hubby there many many years ago.  We had been coming back ever since.  It always seems to be crowded...the price is cheap the food is good.  They have a lot of cooked sushi options which is great for  a preggy person like me.
author: Sheenie L.

description: Pretty solid Japanese restaurant. Everything is very cheap and reasonable. I usually over order here because everything is so cheap. Try their seafood salad. It is a salad with shrimp, crab salad, and seaweed. Delicious. Workers are usually pretty nice and attentive.  Rolls might not be of the highest caliber, but for the price, definitely gets me my sushi fix on the cheap.
author: Can L.

description: I don't know if something happened to the staff or if my taste has become more particular, but man, does their food suck now. I loved the rice when I  first ate here two or three years ago. Now, it's just blah. The tempura? Blah. Oily and kinda soggy. The meat doesn't taste good either. The service has never been very good, but the food used to be all right. It gets packed all the time, there's usually a bit of a line at around 7:00pm on the weekends.
author: Anna Y.

description: I think i can understand why there are so many bad reviews but I would like to say that where else can you get such good price and the food is acually i would say average to above.  The gyoza is kinda soggy.  but the salmon sashimi is pretty good.  Its as good a cheap japanese owned by chinese can be lol.
author: Stevezee C.

description: If you ever ate at Kiki's on Irving and 9th, Kitaro is the EXACT same restaurant (probably same owners). Just like Kiki's, there's a large array of rolls to choose from and great bento combos. Their fish isn't too bad either. The rolls are kind of "stuffed" as they are larger than they should be. The prices are decent for the portions. Overall, decent but not the greatest.
author: Julie L.

description:
I second Ben C.'s recent review.  

Kitaro is the place to go for cheap cheap sushi.  The prices here are really good but you really get what you pay for.  

The fish quality isn't good but it's edible.  I'd come here if I need something quick and cheap but otherwise, if I want really good sushi, I'll go elsewhere. 

Expect this place to be packed though because of the price.
author: Scott L.

description:
it's not the best quality but for the price its pretty damn good and you cant get mad at yourself. i always come here for cheap sushi!
i love their spider roll. we always get lots of rolls and spend very little. one time we bought nine rolls + soup and salad and spent $45! 
the only thing is that the tables are very close together.
author: emily p.

description: This is like, the grossest sushi ever.  I mean, there's nothing bad about it and I've never gotten sick, but its like fast food sushi.  And the prices are worthy of the food.  So its a great way to eat a lot of American sushi for less than $7.   I keep going back;  I just always wonder why I do.
author: Nora B.

description: Cheap sushi, handrolls and bento. It is not the best japanese food in the city but it is easy on the bank account. The restaurant was kinda packed on a friday night but they move the people in and out pretty fast. The green tea was bland...barely could taste any hint of tea at all. We tried the godzilla roll - fried spicy tuna roll I believe...it was not too bad but a little oily. The fillings for the handrolls for the salmon skin and spicy tuna was generous but then again it did not taste the freshest. Oh well...you pay for what u get!
author: Topazskye L.

description: Kitaro is your average sushi place, there's no surprises because you get what you pay for.  If it looks crowded from the outside, expect the same when you get inside.  It's not the best sushi place you can go to or order from, but it's not the worst either.  There's always a lot of customers so the fish stays fresh and there's a bunch of vegetarian items on the menus too.  You'd think that I'd have a bias for this place because it's my ex-employer, and my mom used to be a sushi chef there, but I don't.  This place is average and I won't lie about it, I've seen every little inch of this place, there's no sanitation issues, the food is properly prepared and stored, and nothing is served that the owners themselves wouldn't eat (btw, it is Japanese owned... just don't expect the servers to be).  If you think that this is Japanese fast-food, you're right.
author: Lu G.

description: This place is decent.  I used to come here with my friends about once a week for a couple months at one point while we were preparing for a big presentation in a high school competition.  (And no, none of us are fat.  :D)  If you're looking for really good Japanese food, Kitaro is definitely not the place.  If you're looking for decent, just okay, relatively cheap for the price food, then you're in the right place.  I advise not getting sushi, and sticking with the regular dinners.
author: Keegan Q.

description:
"review way overdue"

yes i'm definitely a fan of this place. the wait time can get a bit extreme, but for the price one shouldn't have much to complain about.

so, if you're looking for affordability and decent sushi, this is the spot. for good service?.. you might wanna look else where.
author: Hong T.

description: One of my favorite japanese palces.  Used to go here when it was across the street in a smaller spot.  It's kind of crowded and it's not super "clean' feeling, but the rolls are great, and the pricing is excellent.  I wouldn't trust the sashimi here, and it's not exactly a date place, but if one's hungry and needs decent plus food, this is the place to go.
author: Joe T. C.

description: The best cheap sushi I have ever had.  When i crave sushi and don't want to spend a lot of money Kitaro is my spot.
author: Hannah S.

description: For a sushi restaurant, this place is cheap. I usually come in and carry their 15% discount. I always get a tempura udon and order a few dishes of sushi. The beef terriyaki is tasty but a bit hard to chew for me. I always wanted to try their strawberry smiles for dessert but always end up being too full. I never finish what I order here so there's always leftover for a midnight snack =]. The service here is alright, could be a little slow sometimes. Bad thing, there is no way there' A/C in there. Freaking hot in there ='[
author: Audrey M.

description: This is my most visited Japanese Restaurant. I love love love their Dynamite Roll which I get every time I come here. Service is decent and so is the price. The location is easy to find since it is right on Geary but it is very hard to find parking.
author: Yuki H.

description: This place is not very good. Sure, it's cheap, but I think Kiki's is better (its sister restaurant) for the same price, but on the other side of the park. Lots of veggie rolls, tis true, but if you want REAL sushi with RAW FISH, go somewhere else. Blue Fin is in the neighborhood.. and that is the best sushi in the city in my opinion. Spend the money, eat good sushi!
author: O K.

description: Hands down, this is the best affordable sushi roll restaurant in The City.  My personal favorite is the Godzilla roll.  I have to admit that the rolls with the raw sushi are the polar opposite of spectacular, but you get what you pay for.  Sushi aside, this place offers a variety of different rolls. This is the only place that offers chicken sushi-style, so for that fact alone, it's a goto place.  The bento boxes are reasonably priced, and the chicken kara-age is better than most places in the San Leandro area.  A can't miss for sushi lovers who have to dine with friends who are sushi-phobic.
author: brenda b.

description: Kitaro may not be the best place for authentic Japanese food. But if you're looking for non-traditional rolls such as the philli roll and rock n roll, this is the place to go!  I usually get the Spider Roll, Philadephia roll, and Rock n Roll roll. Love it!  Very very affordable.
author: Lily T.

description:
Great sushi?  Heck No.

Good sushi?  *sigh* Still.. No.

Cheap sushi?  Damn straight!

People who eat at Kitaro should know this place isn't the greatest.. But it'll get you more bang for the buck than any place I know, except for Nippon's in Pacifica (but that story can be written for another day).  Unfortunately, I can't afford to eat at Ebisu's every time I have a sushi craving.. So this place will have to do from time to time.  

But at least the service is good enough that they get the food to your table quickly and so they can usher in the next waiting crowd to fill your table.  I'm not very fond of the family style bench seating.  You can't really get very comfortable sitting down because you'll probably be bumping elbows with the table next to you.  I figure they made it like that so they can get more turnaround on a busy evening.  It kinda goes to show you get what you pay for.
author: A. H.

description: Man, 3 stars is about right for the food, but for the price? You can't beat the party platters! 127 for 50 bucks, c'mon, I must be dreaming! Haha, in any case. I personally like the food, but I do realize it's not fantastic. Good place to go if you plan on heading to the Sutro Baths afterwards...
author: Simon L.

description: This place is about as mediocre as it gets. Cookie cutter menu, food that sits on the border between good and bad. Service and atmosphere that does the same.
author: Eater S.

description:
update:

i went again and it was even better! my standard meal cost $25 less than it does everywhere else!

----------

i went with a group of 6 people on a saturday night and they were able to seat us with no problem (they were busy but not jam packed). once we ordered our food came amazingly fast (within 5min) and they remade a roll at no charge for my vegan friend who didn't realize the roll she'd ordered had a non-vegan sauce. i'd go back again for sure!
author: lisa w.

description: Cheap Japanese food, but all reflected in the portion you get. The sashimi that is given with the combo meal is sliced a little flimsy. Can't really enjoy it with it sliced about 1/5 of an inch or about half a centimeter. I enjoyed the teriyaki sauce and the rolls, but other than cheap, it's not my ideal choice to enjoy one of my favorite cuisines.
author: Eva L.

description: Super cheap.  You can always find coupons for this place.  That probably explains the crowds.  Not the best quality or the biggest portions, but what can you expect.
author: Blu n.

description: Ordered take-out dinner set plates for my small group here a few weeks ago. Everyone enjoyed it. The only thing though was they really pack on the rice portions. As if the deep-fried battered tempura, tonkatsu, and chicken cutlets weren't heavy enough, the sauces and toppings are lavishly dressed on everything. They certainly don't skimp when it comes to feeling like you've had enough for what you've paid. Surely it was a good place the money I put down. But, do I have to feel gross when I leave?
author: Jj H.

description: I remember coming here regularly a couple of years ago. This is where I learned to love and adore philly rolls. Great place to take someone to start eating sushi if they've never been to. However the wait can take a while on busy weekend nights, so come here during the day when the sun is still out. Nothing noteworthy except that this is a solid, decent sushi joint in the Richmond. There are however places better and worst.
author: Clinton L.

description: BEST SUSHI IN THE CITY!  I'm getting hungry just writing this :)  Wonderful service, they are very quick, helpful and our food comes out within minutes of ordering.  Now this place is no where near where we live BUT we make a special outing to go there as often as we can (once a week usually)!  It's very inexpensive and they even send 15% coupons in the mail...I have not found another sushi place in SF that even compares and I don't want to!
author: B P.

description:
Favorite sushi restaurant, by far! 

I normally prefer to go to the sushi restaurants that have boats.. I used to go to a place down the block until I discovered that they close for lunch.. As a result, I discovered this gem!

The service is friendly. The rolls are delicious and really cheap. I have broadened my sushi horizons since I have started coming here. At this point I've tried nearly every sushi roll they offer and I honestly have no complaints.   Especially for someone that is an extremely picky eater, the fact that they offer chicken teriyaki rolls helps those who aren't fish friendly. 

 I recommend the dynomite roll! It's dy-no-mite! :)
author: Alex K.

description:
Chicken Katsu - weird feel and taste; lacked texture and left a greasy aftertaste. 
Tempura - Small shrimp heavily coated to appear large.  Again, greasy aftertaste.
Tea ($.50 extra) and rice were fine.
Salad greens were fresh, but drenched in a watery mayo dressing.

I wish restaurants were required to indicate plainly either Japanese food (prepared by Japanese cooks) or Japanese-style food (all others).  The only Japanese-style restaurant  that I've found that is low priced and fairly good tasting (though not authentic) is Spiral Japanese (style) restaurant in San Bruno, near El Camino and San Bruno Avenue.
author: George O.

description:
My friends wanted to eat Japanese on a Friday night so we decided to come to the cheapest place we know: Kitaro.

We weren't expecting the food to be super good or anything but the food and service we received was terrible.  I ordered their so-called "vegetable udon" which is supposed to be plain udon with vegetable tempura.  However, when my food came, it was a bowl of udon with what looked like an orgy of leftover vegetables from earlier in the week.  I also ordered a spicy chicken roll which was ok.

My friends both ordered a rainbow roll which is supposed to come with different fish pieces as well as one avacado piece.  It didn't come with all the kinds of fish as described in their menu.  They left out the unagi and avacado pieces.  The only reasonable explanation for this is the same as my vegetable udon: they wanted to get rid of the fish from the beginning of the week.

So to sum it up in one simple sentence: They ripped us off.  I asked one of the waiters and they told me in a very rude tone that there was nothing wrong with our orders.

This place used to be good;  now they just don't really care about the customers since people will come here anyway.
author: Jeffrey L.

description: Kitaro has a great selection of veggie sushi rolls with such fine choices as pumpkin, shitaki mushrooms and sweet potatoes.  Their Rolls are amazing especially if you like spicy tuna I  Recommend the Dynamite roll.
author: octavia h.

description: Sure this place may not serve the freshest seafood but it's still a hell of a bargain.  This place gets 4 stars for the soft shell crab alone!  Try it!
author: Doogie H.

description:
Ok, so the sushi isn't the greatest . . . but the price, you can't beat that! Sushi and sake here atleast twice a month, but I keep coming back even when the sushi is just average. You definitly get what you pay for, but when I'm hungry and broke, Kitaro hits home.

Btw, parking is a bitch almost anywhere in the city. So come on folks, what do you expect? especially on Geary?
author: Ro F.

description: I feel kind of weird giving this place three stars when it should probably only get one or two. But the thing is, sometimes you want to eat a quick sushi meal but don't want to break the bank. And the thing is, the food isn't so bad. For the high-class sushi connoisseur, don't go here. But for a decent, cheap meal, it's fine. At least it's better than those packaged take-out rolls at Trader Joes or Albertsons! Speaking of Albertsons, check the back of your latest grocery receipt. Chances are there is an ad for 15% off Kitaro sushi--even more savings!
author: A Y.

description: I give Kitaro a 3.5. The prices are great, and considering its so cheap the food is really good. I usually just go to Kiki's instead because its closer to me, but I like Kitaro's set-up better.
author: Katrina C.

description: Gonna give out 3 stars to this joint because they do have inexpensive sushi. I usually opt for the chicken teriyaki n after reading some other reviews I think I'm gonna agree w/ the rubber feeling when eating it. It tends to get crowded here almost everyday n esp on the weekends. I'd suggest ordering ahead of time n pickin it up. They are fast when it comes to that, n the service inside aint too bad either. Another little tid is the close proximity when it comes to eating here. By the end of your meal you'll be suffering from food coma, asking your friend how they liked the food and laughing at the joke the guy next to you told to his table..but you overheard it...listening in rocks!
author: Nick A.

description: This place is around the corner from my flat, so I'm biased in terms of availabilty to sushi. Kitaro is really affordable, and while I would agree it's not the "best sushi ever," it provides the best opportunity to try a lot of sushi and has a great variety (Philly-style, spicy, mango). The guava juice and the appetizers I don't think are as ordered as much, but is totally worth it! Also, the waits tend to be extremely short, even when packed on a Saturday night - I think the longest I've had to wait was 15 minutes.
author: Jenz y.

description: Cheap sushi for a night out with friends. Not really a date spot, but cool if you want to save cash, but wind up full at the end of the night.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I don't know why people complain about the quality.  Look at the prices.  It's pretty damn good for what you pay, but the servers are pretty rude though.
author: A L.

description: Food is avg if not just barely above. Nothing too special. it's a decent place to visit on a regular basis if you're just lookin' for a casual place to eat Jap food. Prices are reasonable.
author: Tech G.

description: This is a good place if you just want to have some yummy/cheap Japanese food.  The service is OK...but the food is pretty good.  Trying to find parking is the hardest thing to do around there.  Sometimes we have to circle the blocks 5 times or more before we can find a spot!  I recommend going there on Saturday/Sunday right when they open!
author: JenJen W.

description: The sushi is pretty good, but the line is always crazy.  The prices are reasonable and its a great place to eat. Parking is not too easy to find but hey if there is a spot to park its a great place for a meal.
author: Nancy W.

description: Been here a few times, I think the service is not that great as it could be, but I understand they do get crowded.  The sushi is good, teriyaki chicken, is okay, but not the best.  I would come back, because I have eaten at a lot of worst places.
author: Steven L.

description: The best thing about this place is the prices the bad thing is the rushed service. Luckily we did not get served any sort of rotten fish or it would have gone back immediately. Definitely not the best spot for fresh fish but it is decent. We got 6 different types of rolls a few appetizers and a bottle of Sake and still managed to get out of there in under $40...good deal. I probably won't go back for a visit because it was not the best and it is far in the inner Richmond- a long way to go for a girl from Nob Hill. For the best sushi any day but Kitaro my friend you just didn't make the cut.
author: Sugey G.

description:
i've been a kitaro fan since they had their smaller place further down geary, and since then they have expanded the menu to the max. they have unique rolls like fire crackers (salmon and albacore sushi tempura with spicy sauce). 

this place has diverse dishes, whether you want the typical california rolls or something adventurous like a pink salmon roll. parking is horrible, but if you have good karma you might get lucky.
author: selma s.

description: I only has takeout for this place but when I went to pick it up it was packed! I only imagine that means the food was good but my platter (sounds bad) of sushi was alright. i admit i had a coupon for it because i was really poor that week but i had this one roll that was a cucumber and rice, wtf? i have to say i cant fully review this place because i didnt get something better but they took a coupon that was expired so kudos to them and my wallet. go down the street to hana sushi bang instead. less crowded and nice rolls.
author: andree t.

description: I agree with the other posts. This place is like a mirror image to Kiki's in the Sunset District. Good for either lunch or dinner, your choice.
author: Candace H.

description:
My sister and I come here at least once a month, for a late lunch or early dinner when there is no line.  Not for the great sushi -- it ain't.  For example, the tuna tastes fresh enough but really has very little flavor.   But it's fast and cheap and very edible, especially if you like rolls*.  We usually fill up for about $23.  

*I would avoid anything with spicy tuna (or any other spicy fish).  I suspect restaurants pass off less than fresh fish by drenching it in spicy sauce.
author: Rina R.

description:
I used to live up the block from this place and hit this place up on a weekly basis.  There are 2 other sushi restaurants on the next door to this, but Kitaro is the only one with a waiting list, draw your own conclusions. 

The food is cheap, but it is of better-than-usual quality.  I'm not going to say something ridiculous like "best sushi in SF", but for a cheap little sushi joint, they blow most other places away.   

The only downsides I can think of are: 
the service used to be spotty, but has been better lately
the Udon is pretty bland
author: eamon g.

description:
Why do you need 4 sushi places on one block?  

I used to live near the Kitaro on Geary Street, and it would be a regular for take-out or in-restaurant dining.  

The restaurant in nothing fancy.  Bright lights, packed tables, not much ambiance.  It's ALWAYS full.  Seriously - anytime of day, there are people in this place.  
 
Can't go wrong with take-out.

I've been going for years and I have always thought the fish was fresh, and they have *some* different, creative rolls on the menu.  But really, this isn't "fine dining".  If you're looking for the BEST sushi in SF, this isn't it.  But if you want good, fresh sushi at a great price, Kitaro is my fave!
author: Sharon P.

description: Cheap, grubbin and fantastic selection.  Still, at the moment in the South bay so not here enough.
author: M T.

description:
10 years ago, this place use to be really good. Nowadays, this place is just average. The quality has gone down dramatically due to (what I believe) too many customers. They shuffle customers in and out so fast that their quality has suffered. 

Still one of the cheapest Japanese restaurants in  San Francisco.
author: Anita T.

description: kitaro used to be a pretty hot spot. you knew you were gonna wait forever to be seated. but kitaro was so good, that it didnt matter. i dont know what happened to that kitaro. cause i went recently, and it's just not the same. it wasn't crowded. and honestly. the sushi and the dinner plates weren't all that special. granted, it was super cheap, both sushi and the dinner meals. someone ordered the chicken teriyaki. and it was like double the portion from any where i've been to. i dont know if it was just that day, and they were trying to get ride of their chicken. but hey, if you're looking for cheap japanese food and huge portion of chicken teriyaki, why not.
author: Natalie B.

description: Fish was rotten.  Sorry.  Thank god I had enough beer to wash it down.
author: mike p.

description: Cheap decent sushi. Thats all I can really say. I mean, its not great, but its a lot better than what you would expect for paying $2.99 for a roll.
author: Adam L.

description:
The one dish I had at Kitaro was the Chicken Teriyaki, and it only takes one word to describe it - gross. Rubbery chicken drenched in a sickly sweet sauce. 

I won't even try the sushi. One look and you can tell it's food for the masses. The sushi is slapped together into a mish-mash that barely holds together. The words "cheap" and "sushi" probably shouldn't be used in the same sentence. People rave about the freshness. It's fresh because there's high turn over from the crowds of teenagers who haunt the place. Remember: fresh does not necessarily equal tasty.

For the more sophisticated, I would highly recommend Tanuki down the street (6th & California). It's reasonably priced and the sushi chefs are very inventive. Kitaro is not a bargain if you end up not enjoying what you eat!

Note: I did go back and try the Sushi. Yuk! The seaweed is so cheap that you have to chew it for a month before it goes down. They use the cheapest cuts of fish and even resort to what tastes like canned salmon in some of their rolls. Truly not a place for those who love sushi.
author: Holly G.

description: I'm just getting into sushi so I am NOT an expert but I was actually pleasantly surprised by Kitaro. It tastes pretty fresh, seems to be made decently, and it's tough to argue with the prices. I felt a little bad about going in when there were other (probably better) restaurants nearby but  I couldn't resist given the price.
author: Rachael E.

description:
Cheap, good food.  We ordered dinner plates, and the portions were excellent.  

Unfortunately, there was this fat, ugly, filiempeno lady sitting right next to us.  She needs to shut up.  She was just complaining how awful her orders were, which was funny, since she was pretty awful looking and smelly herself.  

So in conclusion, cocaine is one helluva drug.
author: Matthew G.

description: Decent sushi, I reccomend firecrackers and a godzilla roll MmmMmm ... but i must say they don't have to give you nasty tap water to drink... and parking sucks major balls.
author: Maurice T.

description: what would bring me back here was the affordability compared to most sf sushi. we got tuna and salmon sashimi along with a variety of rolls which were all good, pretty standard menu and straight forward preparation. its a very relaxed and casual atmosphere for a mellow and quick meal.
author: Barbara C.

description: Overall experience was horrible! The waitress was very short with us and didnt make eye contact. She spilled miso on the table and then spilled salad on the floor. The miso was great thankfully since its hard to mess up. I ordered their roll lunch special and didnt even want to eat. Every roll was falling apart and you couldnt even see any meat. Tasted like gooey rice balls. The edamame was sub par and barely warm. The teriyaki chicken was bland. Im suprised to see such great reviews because I did not enjoy my dining experience! And to top it off no one said goodbye or thank you upon leaving, when japanese sushi places are infamously known for greeting their customers.
author: Amber S.

description: I like Kitaro - especially for those evenings when I'm in a hurry.  Plus the price is right.  I especially like the Hawaii roll.
author: Methanie D.

description: Kitaro is a great place for certain things, not so great for others. Their tempura is decent, the grilled saba is a great deal... pumpkin nigiri is delish. They have a great vegetarian selection. It is definitely good for when you don't have a lot of cash and are hungry for some basic sushi or bento box.
author: Reviewchick C.

description: If you want a fast and filling meal, this is the place to go.  They are really into the quick turnaround.  You can feed a family of 5 for around $40.  The sushi is not that great, but the bento boxes are decent.  Parking is hard to find in this area.
author: chris c.

description: I always order their lunch specials. It is a good deal. But when u dine, u don't free endame, salad, or fish heads. The one on geary blvd. and third ave. does called icharaku. Fast pace restaurant.
author: Cor N.

description: The restaurant has a nice look to it and the food is actually not bad.  The tempura nice and crispy and the sushi is fresh.  I place is always crowded and that's why the food is fresh.  It doesn't have time to sit.
author: Susan W.

description:
Kitaro is not the best place for sushi, but you can get basically a bucket of sushi for dirt cheap. Other places that charge you double and give you half the amount of food really disappoints me. That probably why I love this place.

Service is fast and the only thing that does faster is how the food disappears from the plate. I could spend $40.00 here and feed 3 people. For sushi that is pretty damn good. 

The decore isn't high class as some other places, but there are other sushi places on either side of Kitaro, even on the same block that can give you decor if you want that kinda thing. 

The only time we didn't get sushi and got the box dinner, it was hugh. Couldnt even finish it. Great great food for the price. 

One star off because they tend to leave the door open or close as people come in and it gets cold. So get a table away from the door if it  is cold. Plus parking is crappy here. It is on Geary, so I can understand, but I HATE to look for parking.
author: mark h.

description: Cheap and not so authentic Japanese food...cant complain...it gets me full for a decent price...pretty good variety...3 STARS!!!!
author: william w.

description: This is place is probably the cheapest sushi place I have ever been to. I ordered the Firecracker which is actually good. Doesn't look like the picture because in the picture, the rolls are big, but when you recieve it, they're small. The price is reasonable! It is 2.99 I think for the Firecracker? If I come back here, that's probably the only sushi I'll be ordering. Edamame was warm and I like it that way and the miso soup was like any other. I also ordered the dynamite roll and I think it was the most expensive roll which is 5.99. They put their own special wasabi sauce. If you like the wasabi flavor then  you'll like this. I wasn't a big fan and I'll never try that again. So, if you want a cheap place to eat sushi, try it here. Warning: not many sushi rolls on the menu.
author: Men A.

description: Great neighborhood place to eat! This is my fall back japanese restaurant. The food is delicious and at a great price!! It can get really busy at night, but the wait is never too long. TAke out here is good, as well. Speedy service all around...!
author: crystle w.

description:
Cheap, and pretty okay food. Only problems are they don't deliver, and there's always a LOT of people standing outside of the doorway not letting anyone in. 

Try the sushi boat place down the street instead, very fun.
author: John H.

description:
I've been to Kitaro a couple times, but I had a particularly good experience yesterday. My friend and I ordered 4 rolls, and an assortment of 12 piece sashimi + frozen yogurt and... i believe it added up to about $40-45. 

The Alaska Roll and Kamikaze Roll were pretty good. So if you want to have acceptable sushi quality for a decent price, this is the place to go! The service is ehh ok but you get what you pay for. 

Parking is a bitch though, but the blueberry frozen yogurt is really good!
author: tianyu c.

description:
For the price, travel all the way down to SLO and go to Shin's. Anyone who went to Cal Poly knows the difference between pretty awesome sushi at any of the Japanese/Korean sushi houses in town, and Shin's, which is the "college-student-on-loan" alternative. 

And that's where Kitaro comes in - now that I live in the Bay Area, I have my list of good, great, awesome, and entertaining Japanese sushi places, and Kitaro will fit a step under "good." It's that place in SF that gets a lot of student foot-traffic. What struck me as weird was not the relatively low priced rolls, (we did yelp it before we went) but it was the fact that:

1) the maguro was chopped up like ground beef inside one roll
2) salmon salad tasted like chicken
3) seaweed salad was WAY obviously old (it was rubbery, and not crisp - and I've never experienced rubbery seaweed salad before)
4) during my first bite of the hamachi roll, a bone emerged and freaked my bf out.  He actually stopped eating soon after (which is rare!)
5) sushi chefs worked in a back kitchen!  How many sushi joints have you been to where you never saw your chef(s) or the fish he was picking from in the display?

Now, neither of us got sick - thank the lord - however, unless we lost our jobs and were seriously craving sushi, I wouldn't consider going back. 

+1 star for pretty decent sushi rice.
+1 star for an early sunday dinner for 2 under $15.
author: Shatin S.

description: Good sushi at cheap prices... funny how the waitors and waitresses were all Chinese at one point.  Shouldn't it be Japanese? You know because I think the last I checked Kitaro was a Japanese restaurant.  Either way Chinese or Japanese they are good and they wont come out serving your food in those funktified valet vested uniforms.
author: Diana T.

description: eww. i found a little tiny baby roach crawling on the appitizer plate they gave me. after trying to flag the waitress down for what seemed like forever, she came and whisked the plate away. the whole time the only thing i'm wondering is if that was a baby where are the big one's? ewwwwwww. i'm sad cuz i really loved this place! the tab comes back with a 10% off discount. then some complementary ice cream. but that just can't make up for.. ewww.. then the same server girl who took the baby roach away tried to offer us someone elses strawberry smiles (little ice cream filled frozen strawberries. right when i had wiped the confused look off my face, shrugged and reached out to take them her manager walks over and points to the table that originally ordered them. so dissapointing.... why kitaro? why?
author: maria p.

description: went here long ago and i think we vowed to never come back...but we went back last night because someone wanted it.  the sushi was ok and cheap, ordered the tiger roll and alaska, pretty good. but the bento box was horrible, the chicken teriyaki was the worst thing ever..it tasted as if they boiled it then slightly charred it on the grill. everyone at our table said it was nasty. my friend ate some of my food cause he didnt want to finish his box. not only that when we got in the place was hot as a sauna even wiht the front door open! it was stuffy and we felt we couldnt breathe. we went to kiki their sister location in the sunset last week. we will be going there instead from now on. this time we are sticking to our word and NO MORE KITARO.
author: Linda L.

description: This is basically what you would call sushi for beginners. It's good but a lot of it is cooked sushi. It's not what I would call "real" sushi. I love the raw stuff. The udon soup is good and I like their non fried sushi. Their fried sushi seems too oily to me and so does their tempura. The dinner salad has a really good dressing as well.
author: Erica K.

description: for low priced, good quality sushi, this is the place to go.  i always come here for sushi and bento boxes when i'm here in san francisco.  the place is almost always crowded, but the wait isn't too long.  my favorites are the 49er roll, spider roll and dragon roll.  the service is good, fast and efficient.  this place is not much for ambiance, it's a hole in the wall.  there's only street parking around so it is hard to find parking.  if you love sushi, you gotta try it out.
author: will m.

description: Okay, I keep going back to this place because I get coupons from them in the mail. Yea you may get more sashimi in their bento box than Little Tokyo, but does it matter if it's not as good? The sushi rolls are good, but there are better places than this, and surprisingly it's the same price. I am beginning to wonder it the coupons will be enough to keep coming back...The service is good though.
author: Alyse A.

description: I've been going to this place for easily a decade and recently took my fiancee there and we both loved it.  Not only is the food good but it's really unique (i.e. the rolls they have) and it's very cheap.  In fact if you go to the Safeway near Ocean Beach they have 15% off coupons available for this place.  If you are throwing a party, be sure to consider the sushi platters they have here.  Around $25.00 for 40 pieces - can't beat that!
author: Dan W.

description: fresh & cheap sushi is it possible?  yes at kitaro it is!!  i love this place, fresh sushi, fast service, nice portion, i am a sucker for kitaro.  it's no fancy joint, but you know what, if i can get fresh & affordable sushi, i am all in!  the other food like seaweed salad, curry katsu are good as well.  hey even my mom likes this place, and she's not a huge fan of japanese food, so that says a lot!
author: Teresa C.

description: someone please tell me why they keep coming here.  the server wasn't very nice, the sashimi was unceremoniously presented in one of those big boxes with the rice and salad and places in one two section and over the divider. the sashimi was not as fresh or good as i've had.  they don't even bring you tea unless you ask for it.  seating is practical, seems very americanized. spicy tuna roll was good, i guess, i don't even know i just wanted to leave.  i will only return if im with a bunch of people and they all want to go there.
author: Aristocles P.

description: I've been coming to this place for years and must say the quality has gone down a little bit, but nonetheless the place is still crazy packed on friday/saturday nights. One thing I hate is that your whole party has to be there in order to be seated even if it's a party of 10 and you're short 1 person, they won't seat you. It's a decent sushi place with a good variety to choose from whether you're craving sushi, udon, tempura, or their dinner box specials. Their sashimi isn't the freshest I've had, but for the prices they charge, it's reasonable. I always thought it was funny they have small signs posted that say you shouldn't eat the same fish too often because of mercury or whatever. I guess they are required to have those signs. Anyways, my favorite thing is getting the chicken teriyaki for lunch since it's the same portion as dinner but cost less for lunch. Also love their dynamite, godzilla, and fire cracker rolls. The dressing for their salad is awesome too. Great place for casual sushi dining at decent prices. Usually pretty fast service although not the most attentive. It's located on a busy street with tons of other restaurants so parking is usually bad especially on weekend nights, but I think it's worth the 20 mins of circling around looking for parking. Also love their other location Keke in the inner sunset area.
author: Linda C.

description: For quick, cheap sushi this is the place to go, but you get what you pay for. The fish is disgustingly stale and tastes like it's been sitting around for at least 3 days. You're better off going to Sakane-Bune, the sushi boat on the corner, 3 stores down with dishes as low as $1.50 each and fresh fish... I can usually get a decent sushi lunch there for about $10.
author: Amy L.

description: this place was better when it was across the street and in that tiny restaurant. too bad
author: Nida O.

description: Good service, good quality food, both sushi and hot. Not the cheapest, but not too expensive. Street parking's a bitch.
author: Matt G.

description: This is one of the worst Japanese restaurants ever.  And, it's not just because I'm Japanese and have lived in Japan. The cooked dishes are basically microwaved, the sushi is toxic and the only good thing I have to say is that none of us apparently suffered food poisoning. Walk on by!
author: LY G.

description: um... i spent $15 on 4 freakin rolls plus edimame plus tea. including tip.  and i'm not talking about no bitty cucumber rolls...i got a fire cracker roll, hawaiian roll...and two other fancy ones i don't remember. shit was hella good, and silly cheap. no atmosphere, its always busy, but they're SUPA quick, 10 min. wait for food max. geez
author: Hella M.

description: it's not your authentic japanese sushi house.  they have more innovative rolls that use many american ingredients.  but the food is just fine, and in comparison to other sushi places the prices are quite low.  sushi for the budget conscious.
author: Sheri N.

description: Decent sushi, parking sucks.  The wait staff is decent, the place is incredibly small and usually crowded.  The tables are way too close together, once I actually knocked someone's tea to the floor while I was trying to sit in the booth, and its not just because I'm a fat ass (well, I'm definitely no JLo) - they're just trying to cram way too many people into too small of a spot.  I've been here a bunch of times because my aunt really likes the sushi here, but its definitely not the greatest I've ever had.  I think its safe to eat here, even if the sushi is cheap (and as we all know, we should always question cheap raw fish).  I'm just addicted to sushi, what can I say.
author: Margie N.

description: went there last night with family... service was okay but you gotta try the fire cracker. that was the best ever. now every time I'll visit this city, kitaro is the first place to eat.
author: Kiki B.

description:
I used to see the ValPak coupons for this place all the time and think "wow! Good deal!" I read reviews here, and had second thoughts. But cheap food always wins out. I tried them for the first time about a year ago. I ordered a rainbow roll. It arrived as a very crude looking, loosely packed rice roll with large chunks of fish on top that were barely cut.  The whole thing fell apart when I tried to remove one piece. The fish was okay. I didn't plan to return.
I did go back. About 3 months or so ago. Must've been a different sushi chef. Ordered a rainbow roll to go. That sucker filled a small plastic clamshell to-go container! And with tax it was barely $7! AND it looked waayyyyy nicer than the first time. Like a regualr sushi roll from a "full price" restaurant!  AND it tasted good! Hurray!  Definitely would go back.
Went back last week. Yep, rainbow roll. With new SF tax, it's now $7.22 total. Still filled up clamshell container, looked good. Tasted okay. Not nearly as good as second time. The fish was warm, which kinda creeped me out. Since time elapsed between pick up and destination was 10 minutes, walking outside on a cold day, it must've been warm at restaurant.  I didn't get sick, so I guess it was okay. 
I'd go back. Especially when really hungry and armed with ValPak coupon. They're sushi menu is not extensive, and seems to have a lot of fried stuff rolls. Not too keen on that. But for cheap, I'll go if in the neighborhood or with friend that has car.
author: Allucaneat G.

description: cheap sushi! pretty good and there catering trays are cheap too for parties...
author: Tasha L.

description: cheap and decent sushi. they always have coupons for their large platters, and my roommates and i make it a habit of ordering them at least once a month. whats better than a buttload of sushi and laziness? nothing i tell ya.
author: Aly L.

description: My first ever sushi experience in high school was here back in the day when they were on 30-something Ave.  Back then they were good.  But a few years later when they moved to the current location, things went downhill very fast.  The quality of food and service took a nosedive.  Where there was somewhat of an authentic or at least a homey feel before, it is now too mainstream and too much cost cutting to keep up with the new rent.  While most sushi places use imitation crab, Kitaro uses the kind that is obviously fake...you know, the chunky kind with the red tips.  Anytime I see a sushi place using that kind, I stay far far away.  The last straw was when I ordered some rolls to-go and instead of giving me extra soy sauce packets, they charged me .10 each when I asked.  Pretty lame if you ask me.  Needless to say I haven't been here since.  The place at the corner with the boats is much better...and that isn't saying much.
author: O'Shea J.

description: Good food and good prices! Seems popular among my friends, and there may be a wait before you get seated. Watch out for discounts/coupons found on the back side of supermarket receipts!
author: Jason T.

description: the price is pretty cheap considering how much food you get.. however i found that there rolls are way too small.. the teriyaka chicken was too salty.. the salad wasnt fresh... etc.. i made the mistake of ordering take out here one time.. they dont give you miso soup, salad,  etc with your takeout! and it tasted horrible!
author: JUDY L.

description: i love sushi. and i dont love kitaro. ive been there a couple times. why? bc i was with guys with very slim wallets. i dont mind splurging on sushi cuz sushi is mylife. the fish is awful. im sure they freeze it to make it last longer nt hen defrost it in a microwave n then cover it in tempura and hotsauce and a cheap price in hopes of misleading the customer. i'd rather go to sakana bune two doors down. they're gettin better, they're cheaper, and their service is somewhat better. (oyea btw kitaro has crappy service! crappy!). i dont think i'll ever go back there again. unless i am dragged or broke with a serious feenin for imitation sushi.
author: Lillian P.

description: Originally we wanted to go to Sakuna Bune for lunch, but we missed the lunch hour. So we decided to try Kitaro, which is located on the same street as Sakuna. At first we thought it was closed because it was so dark and empty. Anyways, we were seated instantly and given menus. The sushi rolls were inexpensive and the quality was right along with the price. I thought the service was extremely slow.. especially becuase we were the only customers dining at the time. In conclusion, I was full of sushi without spending a fortune.
author: Simon S.

description: This place is economical and serves better tasting food than some other overpriced places. Here, you get what you pay for. There's no frills about it, and their food is tasty. I like their seafood salad and a bunch of their rolls. If you shop at the local Safeway, there are Kitaro coupons on the back of your receipt for 15% off your bill. You can't go wrong at Kitaro if your expectations are not high. I leave feeling full and satisfied.
author: Jenn O.

description: why cant i give "0" star? this rest doesnt even deserved to have 1 star.. this place not even worth it to be called japanese restaurant.. nothing appears to be japanese sense... none sense sushi, even the cooked foods seemed so "blah". thanks god no one ever push me to go eat in this rest, i'll smack their head and hunt them down...
author: sherly A.

description: my sorority sisters always ramble about how they love to eat here so my father and i decided to pay visit. the sushi was pretty good and so was the chicken terriyaki and i usually do not like eating chicken terriyaki. i love the  spicy chicken roll. ahh the hype of this place
author: bella h.

description: kitaro is my goto place for cheap quick rolls. don't go here expecting high end quality sashimi.  go here expecting large rolls at low prices and a good time. not a place for japanese food snobs. it's chinese run!
author: Ameer N.

description: Terrible service and food. Me and my friend ordered rainbow roll and pink dragon roll. This pink dragon roll is the tiniest roll ever. There is only a tiny bit of avocado in the middle of the rice and that's it. I ordered this before and it was nothing like this.  I asked the waitress politely and she was like "how big do you want it to be?" Her attitude was horrible and she answered me without even looking at my food. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. I will not going there again.
author: Ian L.

description:
my boyfriend and I have been here a few times and i it was ok. not the best but as a starving college its worth it. 

my friend and my brother came up for spring break so we decided to take them here. the thing is, they don't really have a set time for closing so we came in right when they were about to close but they still took us in. we ordered fast because our waitress said they were closing the kitchen in two minutes and she didn't even give us tea. 

right when we got our food, another lady gave us our checks already and was like 'no need rush' but she clearly didn't mean it. URGH! 

bottom line is that they can be hella rude. i don't think we'll be coming back here.
author: Jodi P.

description: like is mentioned below, if you're looking for a go to spot in this city where the ratio of dollars to sushi quality is at its peak, i'm not sure you'll do better.  and if you do, please respond to me about it.  or maybe you could draw me a graph.  graphing calculators are cheeting.
author: Jay A.

description: maybe it's not the freshest sashimi in the world, but it's pretty good for the  price you pay. the rolls are also pretty filling and inexpensive.
author: ML N.

description: Great place for affordable sushi. The fish has always been pretty fresh, and everything comes out pretty fast. Sure it's not primo sushi, but it's perfect when you're looking for sushi that won't break the bank.
author: Jared R.

description:
parking's a challenge, but when we need a quick sushi fix - we make our way across the park to kitaro.

sushi is good for the price you pay. i personally love the surfer and spider rolls.
author: L B.

description: funny how theres like 3-4 sushi restaurants in the same area. they must cutthroat trying to attract customers from the enemy and sabotaging each other business plans. anyways the sushi here was good. The food was satisfying, but not as fresh as soem other places, but with the prices they charge you kinds expect it.  fairly priced, as two couple can get 3-4 rolls for like 20 bucks. the service was good, even thought they messed up on my order, they quickly brought out the correct order, hopefully without any bodily residue in it. i had a satisfying meal. they had traditional authentic japanese  rolls like the san francisco 4er roll or the rock and roll, which made it feel like you were truly dining in land of the rising sun. i learned that night that the "peas" they give you at japanese restaurants to snack on arent peas but soybeans.
author: Rex P.

description: I've dined here about...three times. I'll have to say just "ok" enough to return that many times. A past girlfriend took me here as she loves this place, or use to, and I have to say it's not all that it's cracked up to be. Parking was hard to find, but then again it is San Francisco and the prices were seemingly high for a regular lunch or mid-lunch dinner meal. Service is up and down on the few times I've been there, there wasn't consistency on quality service. The food was okay, but in terms of price it should have been either tastier, more in portion, or drop the price a little. Theres a lot more room for improvement.
author: Henry N.

description: Sushi here isn't so bad; it's very affordable.  Service is fast for the most part.  They are pretty consistent with their quality.  I always order the same things--Rock-n-Roll, Dynamite Roll, California Roll (yes, I'm like the only one who orders this), and Crab Salad Hand Roll and they always come out tasting just as good as the last time.  One thing some people might not prefer is that they have tight seating.  When it's a full house, you are basically rubbing elbows with the people next to you and chiming into their conversation.  Other than that, it's decent!
author: deeks ..

description: i came here with my friends for lunch and the food taste alright. i got the mango drink or something it tasted like kool-aid. i'd stick with hot tea. the portion they give me for lunch was about the same for dinner. so getting lunch would be a better deal.
author: Valerie N.

description: whenever we go to sushi restaurants we like to order the rolls. the only reason we come to this place is because it is cheap.  today's experience however makes us question whether we should continue coming.  for one, i never had such funny look spider rolls.  the head and tail end pieces looked like little nubs which makes me wonder if our crab was bought for really cheap cuz it was legless or if the restaurant was cheap and pulled off the legs for another roll.  we also ordered a bunch of nigiri and over half of them had a very fishy taste. the salmon, the one highlight, was also cut very thin. the mackeral nigiri was also partially cooked which was probably their effot to hide its freshness.  as others have mentioned, seating is very cramped.  we were probably 3in away from another couple.  our first few visits we felt like we got a deal, but after being to other sushi restaurants i know we got a crappy deal. so as the rating dictates, meh, i've experienced better.
author: thb t.

description:
good for the price.... lots of rice, large rolls but not a lot of fish.  

an economical place i would say.  there's a sister restaurant in sunset called kiki's
author: Alex K.

description: This restaurant is down the block from me in a block with three japanese restaurants and it has the worst food.  For instance, the hawaiian roll (tuna and avocado) we ordered had really pale pink, mushy sushi.  The servers are also very rude.  Our server took about 10 minutes to bring our drinks and take our orders and this was before it got really busy.  He also had a frown on his face the whole time he served us and only reserved his smiles for a caucasian family that came in.  Overall, I would SKIP this place, even if it purports to have "cheap sushi."  For better, cheaper sushi, check out Kiki's on 9th Ave and for better sushi in Richmond, check out Kitaro's neighbor Cocoro, which is actually run by Japanese people and has nicer waitstaff and fresher sushi.
author: Eunice L.

description: the food is good, and i love the sushi.  Nice big rolls.  beats the boat resturant down the street
author: mikayla m.

description: Cheap rolls, has a moderate selection of american rolls.
author: David L.

description: I loved going to Kitaro for my sushi fix. I loved the pumpkin roll and the Godzilla roll, though sometimes they really slathered on a lot of the spicy sauce. The vegetarian bowl was really good too- lots of julienned pieces of pumpkin, broccoli, carrots with great sauce and nicely steamed rice. The prices are really affordable, too.
author: L K.

description: Service is not the best, been there a couple of times (can hear the manager yelling at his employers). Bento box was decent, not the best sushi in the world, but I had this broccoli vegetable roll that I've got to say I can get no where else and was FANTASTIC.
author: Lily L.

description: Kitaro is sooooo good. It's probably my favorite Japanese resturant. It's very affordable and convenient if your around the Richmond district. I love order the bento box w/ Chicken Teriyaki and Shrimp & Vegetable tempura. Also the Philadelphia Roll is delicious. Cream Cheese&Tuna=HEAVEN.
author: Willson Z.

description: Great price, but I'd rather pay more for better food. I had teriyaki chicken and sashimi. The chicken was burned. The sashimi was not fresh. I am against eating unfresh fish. Maybe it's just me.
author: bob k.

description: Kitaro is hands-down the best "bang-for-your-buck" sushi place in San Francisco. I have been going there for years and it is great, big sushi rolls for very reasonable prices and a really nice environment. I am actually taking a date there tonight!!!
author: Keith M.

description: I give this place three stars because it was really cheap which was fantastic.  The service was blah, the sushi was whatever, and the ambiance was ehhhhh... but cheap .. special rolls are almost all less than 5 bucks !
author: Daniel S.

description: I would say this place is ok. The prices are affordable compare to other restaurants. The food is ok and the service isnt that bad. I would go here if i was on a budget, but this place is not good if u are looking for good sushi. The sashimi does not taste fresh and the sushi's are poorly made. If you want to eat good sushi, you have to pay the prices. Cheap is not always good.
author: Jon J.

description: The waiters are not as friendly as they should be, but the food goes above and beyond what could ever be expected. The food also comes in a timely-fashion, save the times when the restaurant is particularly busy. The best thing is that the pick-up times are generally really quick, only about 15 minutes or so. The atmosphere is also good overall, and the prices are good for the quality of the food: you generally get what you pair for.
author: lena c.

description: I wasn't expecting much when a friend convinced me to eat here... but it still totally sucked. Service was mediocre at best, sushi rolls were fine but nothing special. But what pissed me off was the Unagi Donburi was not over rice, but a scoop of rice with unagi on the plate next to it. Donburi means it should be over rice! I heard that a Japanese person owns this place, and that baffles me. How can such food be served that is so not Japanese?
author: C K.

description: good food, good prices, bad service, crowded and VERY HARD to find parking spaces...especially around dinner time. But it is the best japanese place on that block.
author: SF N.

description: Tasty sushi!  It does get crowded, but fresh, cheap sushi- who cares?  Service is always friendly.
author: Mick B.

description: When i first came here my god it was great i had to eat here once a week. Latly though there quality going down hill. New management? new staff? new chef? i dont know but there sashimi not as big as befor and not as fresh. i just recently ate here and ehh i duno rather go somwhere else now.
author: Brandon o.

description: one of my favorite sushi restaurants, has great variety and lots of creative options only thing is the space is small and pricey but service is great and cant ask for anything more!!
author: Len A.

description: on a rainy day like yesterday, all we wanted was some miso, hot green tea, and some chicken teriyaki with sticky rice. kitaro it is! decent food, lacking somewhat in atmosphere and service. but it's cheap and it sure hit the spot!
author: N. M.

description: good place to grab quick inexpensive sushi, service is fair, and place is loud, young crowds.
author: Ken S.

description: what's better than a smorgasbord of americanized sushi for under $15?
author: Kathy C.
